loans.name: Sanoat

texts.en:
Sanoat used to be a labor migrant in Russia. It was very difficult for her to leave her children and work in Russia, coming home only for couple of months per year. Therefore, as soon as she made enough money to start her own business, she did so.

Sanoat started her trade at the open-air market with a place 1 meter wide. She considered this place not busy and actively visited by customers, so her first goal was to afford renting better place in the market. She heard about MicroInvest 3 years ago and started receiving loans there. After receiving several loans she could afford to change her place in the market. At the beginning she had only $300 in her turnover and now has over $1200. She will use her next loan for the trip to the wholesale market to buy new seasonal goods.

loans.use: Trip to wholesale market

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abra A. was born on March 10, 1979 in Tsévié. She is married to a teacher who earns a small salary, insufficient to provide for the needs of the family. A mother of two (02) children, she has been running a small restaurant for some time. Even though she was not an excellent student, she manages her business well, despite some difficulties she has faced, and reimbursed her previous credit promptly. Always smiling, she has the respect of her surroundings. The $700 credit she is asking for will help her buy necessary groceries for her restaurant. She will thus be able to build her business and profit from it so that she can be better able to provide for the family's needs.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Abra est née le 10 mars 1979 à Tsévié. Elle est mariée à un enseignant qui gagne très peu pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Mère de deux (02) enfants, elle tient depuis un certain temps un petit restaurant. Quand bien même qu’elle n’a pas fait de brillantes études, elle arrive à bien gérer son activité malgré quelques difficultés. Elle a su rembourser promptement le précédent crédit. Toujours souriante, elle a le respect de son entourage. Ce crédit de $700 sollicité servira à acheter des aliments nécessaires pour son restaurant. Elle pourra ainsi renforcer son activité et la rentabiliser afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her restaurant

loans.name: Sossou

texts.fr:
Mr. Sossou D. was born in 1980 in Ahonlogoe in the Vo Prefecture. He currently resides in the same village with his family. Married and father of four (4) children, he is a honest farmer who produces different crops. His speciality is truck farming; which he practices with great enthusiasm. The income drawn from this activity enables him to provide for the needs for his family and to ensure the schooling of his children. To secure his business and to be able to cultivate his crops regardless of season, he would like to dig a well in his garden so that the problem of water shortage is mitigated. For this purpose, he requests a credit of $1200.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur D. Sossou est né en 1980 à Ahonlogoe dans la Préfecture de Vo. Il réside actuellement dans le même village avec sa famille. Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants, il est un brave agriculteur qui développe des cultures variées. Sa spécialité est surtout le maraîchage ; ce qu’il pratique avec enthousiasme. Le revenu tiré de cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et à assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants. Pour sécuriser cette activité et faire des cultures contre saisons, il a un projet de creusage de puit dans son jardin afin que soit pallié le problème de pénurie d’eau. Il sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $1200.

loans.use: Purchase of manure and digging of a well

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
This loan will be shared by seven women from the village of Ker Gu Mag in northern Senegal. The group submitted the following loan application:

“Our region has no industrial infrastructure, and if you consider that everyone in rural areas like our own has suffered from land desertification, you will understand why marketing local crops is so important for improving food security. The local women's credit associations lack the financial resources to meet this challenge on their own.

Our group aims to buy, process, and sell local food products, in order to increase the earnings of our members. We will travel to markets in surrounding villages to buy sorghum, millet, bissap [a type of hybiscus, of which the leaves and flowers are widely used in Senegalese cooking] and baobab fruit, and resell them in villages where they are in high demand. The loan will allow our group to ensure the availability of these foods, which are often scarce in our village."

Original French business description:

«La région se particularise surtout par l’absence d’infrastructures industrielles et quand on sait que les conséquences de la désertification n’épargnent plus aucune couche sociale de la région qui est une zone rurale ; on comprend mieux pourquoi la transformation des céréales locales devient une activité capitale pour le monde rural toujours confronté au défi de la sécurité alimentaire. Les coopératrices au nombre de 2339 membres souffrent le plus souvent de la rareté des ressources financières.

L’objectif : Achat, vente et transformation de produits locaux. Aider à renforcer les activités de transformation de produits locaux et encourager le petit commerce.

Objectif spécifique : Appuyer les femmes membres à bien assurer leurs propres activités ; Bref description des activités à mener avec le prêt :

-Acheter les produits locaux dans les loumas de la région et les revendre soit après transformation ou sans transformation suivant l’attraction des prix du moment.

- Pour le volet transformation des produits locaux ; les femmes membres spécialisées s’en chargeront dans leur unité de transformation et les produits revendus pour accroître les revenus des membres. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural micro-enterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Purchase of local grains and food products for resale in village market

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
My name is Bushra B.. I am married and have five children. I live with my family in the small town of Kot Radha Kishan, which is about an hour and a half away from the nearest city. My husband is a daily wage laborer and I sell milk to make a living. I own two cows but now I would like to buy an additional cow, because my husband does not generate a steady source of income and I would like to increase the milk production of my business.



I have many friends in my neighborhood and they all are the members of my loan group. All of us have taken two loans from Asasah, a microfinance institution and invested in our businesses. My group members are: Zainab B., who sells milk to her clients from nearby villages; Anum B. and her husband, who buy milk from various providers and sell it in a nearby city;  Zohran B., whose husband operates a restaurant; and Mukhtar B., who also raises livestock and sells milk. They all are hardworking entrepreneurs and play an important role in bringing income to their families.

loans.use: Buy another cow for the dairy business

loans.name: Faapisa

texts.en: Faapisa was born and grew up with her family in a rural area and married a man from Tuanai. She is 39, and has three sons. Trying to pick up the way of living in town is so hard, but Faapisa has to do something to get some money for her child and her family. She is applying for a second loan to buy seeds and other stuff for her vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Alfoncia's Group

texts.en:
Raida, Irene and Alfoncia have been part of the community bank “Señor de Luren” for the past 6, 4, and 2 years respectively. In their bank they have learned to be responsible, punctual, how to invest their money, how to avoid domestic violence, and to share.

Raida is a single mother; she has three children and is 37 years old. Raida has owned a restaurant on the central street of Ayacucho for the past year. She specializes in “chicharrones” or fried pork. Previously, Raida sold ceviche, a traditional dish made from marinating fish in lemon juice and herbs, near the prison. She decided to open the restaurant because the work is steadier.

Alfoncia is 66 years old. She is divorced and has five children. Alfoncia sells cheese in the Nery G. market of Ayacucho. She also sells products that she buys from markets in the countryside such as fruits and vegetables.

Irene is 57 years old, widowed and has two children. Irene sells “picarones”, which are sweets made from flour, squash, sweet potato, and egg from a cart.

These women need loans of 600, 1000, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying soft drinks, rice, sugar, pork, beans, oil, flour, fruits, and vegetables.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving, and each associate has her own interest earning savings account. Raida, Irene, and Alfoncia plan to use their savings to pay for their children’s education, health care, and in the case of an emergency. Their dreams are to own a home, have everything that is necessary, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: These women need loans of 600, 1000, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying soft drinks, rice, sugar, pork, beans, oil, flour, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mashalla

texts.en: Mashalla A. is a 59-year-old man who cultivates meadows in a small village in the Saatli region. He raises meadows and then sells them to the local farmers and bazaar traders. He has eight years of experience in this field. He applied for a loan of $1100 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz Calderón Chávez is a member of the “Sarita Colonia” comunal bank. She lives in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. Her business is selling grocery items, clothing, and sodas. It is located in the city of Juanjui in her own house, where she has prepared a large and charming space for her business.

With a loan of S/. 1300.00, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy merchandise such as clothing for women, men, and children in different sizes. She will buy grocery items such as: milk and tuna by the box, rice and sugar in sacks, toilet paper, different types of canned fish, and other products that have high demand among her clients.

She is 40 year old and is an enterprising woman. She feels good about her job and the fact that can she can rely on the support of her husband and children. She plans to one day build a house in which she would rent out a room.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Emperatriz Calderón Chávez es socia del Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui, su negocio de venta de abarrotes, prendas de vestir, bebidas gaseosas, está ubicado en el Jr: Lima Nº 648 del Asentamiento Humano 28 de Julio, de la ciudad de Juanjui en su propio domicilio y en el cual ha acondicionado un lugar bastante amplio y acogedor. Con el crédito de S/. 1300.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará mercadería como ropas para damas, caballeros y niños en diferentes tallas, abarrotes como: leche y atunes en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado en diferentes marcas, y otros productos que tienen gran demanda entre sus clientes. Tiene 40 años es una mujer emprendedora, se siente bien con el trabajo que realiza cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos y en el futuro piensa construir en su misma casa habitaciones para que alquilar.

loans.use: To buy products for her busiess.

loans.name: Maria's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14, 11 and 8 years old. Maria owns a small grocery, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8 am to 11 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $160 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in vegetables sales and food sales to the market, and one is a shop owner.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Lam Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lam Thi H., 36 years old, is the fourth-year member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam). Her husband is an officer working for the village council; her two children are in middle school. She is seemingly the only one who takes care of everything in the house. Mrs. H.'s main job is to raise pigs. She is very hard-working and clever, and her pigs grow up quickly and healthy. For each liter of pigs, Mrs. H. earns 500-700 USD. Her husband also helps her with the repayments; everything goes accordingly with the plan. Her family income increases significantly after each loan cycle. This time Mrs. H. would like to borrow 575 USD to buy pigs and food for her animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lâm Thị H., 36 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chồng là cán bộ xã, hai con đang học phổ thông, việc gia đình một mình chị H. gánh vác. Công việc hàng ngày của chị là chăn nuôi lợn. Là một người chịu khó lại mát tay, đàn lợn chị nuôi rất nhanh lớn. Mỗi lứa lợn bán ra thu lãi 500-700USD. Nguồn hoàn trả hàng tuần do chồng chị H. hỗ trợ nên công việc diễn ra rất thuận lợi. Qua các vòng vốn, kinh tế gia đình được nâng lên rõ rệt. Vòng vốn này chị H. tiếp tục xin vay 575USD để mua lợn và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.en:
Abduvahob S. is 44 years old, and with his wife they have raised four children. Abduvahob is a farmer, and a strong physical and spiritual man. Each day he works diligently to make sure that he takes good care of his crop. Not one minute goes by that he is not attentive to his crop. He plows the land to the best of his abilities.

Thanks to his energy and high spirit, he has been able to support his family for 15 years and to offer them an education as well. With his job, he has been able to pay for the schooling of his three children, and this motivates him even more to keep working the land. He is a great role model to his children due to his discipline and diligence, which are good values for his children to learn and to help them throughout life. Abduvahob sows potatoes, corn, carrots, and tomatoes, which he then sells at the local market.

Now that the business is stable, Abduvahob believes that it will be the main income for him in the future as his dearest children are growing up and the expenses are rising.

Abduvahob is requesting a loan of US$850, which he plans to use to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. Abduvahob thanks everyone who trusts him and supports him today, and he promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. You can be an important part of the growth of Abduvahob’s business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Amuda Layi Group

texts.en: Sahadatu is the leader of a six-member group. She is a 70-year-old wife and the mother of three children. The group consists of five women and one man. They are very hard-working and resourceful family providers. They trade in various commodities like kola nuts, palm kernel oil, food stuffs, clothing, etc. to earn a living. Their major challenge has to do with funds to grow these businesses to the expected levels to redeem their families from poverty. They believe the loan will impact their businesses to bring a transformation in their family well-being. Their common hope is to be able to increase savings to provide their children with quality education. They want to use the loan to procure an increased stock of kola nuts, clothing, food stuffs, palm kernel oil, etc. They belong to the group called ‘Amuda Layi Trust Group’. Members in this group agree to guarantee for one another as a social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure an increased stock of kola nuts,  food stuffs, palm kernel oil, etc.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Alondras. She is married, 48 years old and has 4 children. Herminia lives in the District of San Juan Bautista. She sells meat at a stand located on the very popular market, F. Vivanco, in the center of the town of Ayacucho. Herminia, assisted by her husband and daughter, travels to the regional fairs three times a week to buy animals such as cattle, sheep, and pigs to be slaughtered at the town’s slaughterhouse.

Herminia needs a loan of 1600 soles to be invested in buying pigs and sheep. It is her dream to place a roof on the second floor of her house, start a business for her daughter, and set up a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Herminia es socia del Banco Comunal Las Alondras. Herminia es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos. Vive en el distrito D. San Juan Bautista donD. venD. carne en un puesto ubicado en el mercado F. Vivanco, un mercado con mucha concurrencia porque se ubica en el centro D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Herminia viaja a las ferias D. la región 3 veces por semana donD. compra animales como ganado vacuno, porcino, caprino, luego lo beneficia en el camal D. la ciudad. Actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo e hija.

Herminia necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cerdos, carnero. Los sueños D. Herminia son techar el segundo piso D. su casa, implementar un negocio para su hija y tener una tienda D. abarrotes.

loans.use: Herminia needs a loan of 1600 soles to be invested in the purchase of cattle, pigs, and sheep.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es una humilD. y cariñosa madre, desD. muy niña estuvo dedicada a la venta D. pescado dentro del mercado Cerro Colorado D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, oficio que aprendió D. sus padres; gracias a esta labor y al trabajo D. su esposo es que pudieron brindarles educación a sus hijos.Ahora, viendo a sus hijos ya mayores e independientes con sus propias familias se siente realizada como madre, pero al mismo tiempo, sola  y triste por la penosa pérdida D. su compañero D. toda su vida,  su esposo.Actualmente, encontró en su negocio  y sus compañeros D. trabajo la única forma D. distraerse y olvidar los momentos difíciles que le tocó  pasar, por ello, decidió dedicarse íntegramente a su negocio y para ello tiene pensado aumentar el monto D. su capital, para concretar sus planes hace la presente solicitud D. préstamo.
texts.en:
Victoria is a humble and loving mother. Since she was very young she maD. a living selling fish at the Cerro Colorado Market in the city of Juliaca, a traD. she learned from her parents. Thanks to this work and her husband's job, they have been able to proviD. for the children's education. Now, seeing that her kids are grown up and have their own families, she feels like her job has been completed as a mother, but at the same time feels sad and alone after losing her husband, her lifelong partner. Currently she stays busy with her business and her co-workers are her only form of distraction and forget the difficult times that have passed. So she decided to grow her business and for that, she's been planning on raising more capital. She's requesting a loan to help her carry out her plan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital for fish-selling business

loans.name: Mengchin

texts.en: Mr. Mengchin T., 34, and his wife, Mrs. Veasna Mao, 36, who live along National Road Number Six about fifteen Kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have one daughter who studies in the local school. Mr. T. and his wife have been in the business of selling ice for over one year. He buys ice from a factory near his village and carries it by his truck to sell along national road number six. Before starting this business he used to be a construction worker. Currently his truck is broken and he lacks the money to repair it. Therefore, Mengchin is requesting a loan of $1000 to repair his truck to continue his business.

loans.use: Mengchin would like to repair his truck so he can continue his business selling ice.

loans.name: Zoirjon

texts.en:
Zoirjon Y. is 39 years old and is married with three children. For the past 5 years, Zoirjon has been selling dried fruits in the central local market. Dried fruits are very popular in Tajikistan and can be found in most homes to serve guests.  Moreover, dried fruits are, as a rule, served during all  family occasions like wedding parties, birthday parties and others. The constant demand for these kinds of goods has allowed Zoirjon to run a successful business and provide a stable income for his family.

 Zoirjon’s wife, who is pictured in the photo, is also engaged in this business. Zoirjon would like to increase the stock of his goods in order to be able to supply all the demands of his buyers. He is requesting 2700 Somoni ($800 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months to purchase dried fruits like raisins, apricots and nuts like almonds and  pistachios.  Zoirjon has already demonstrated himself as a reliable client with a positive credit history and he would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing of dried fruits and nuts like raisins, dried apricots, almonds and pistachios.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma I. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur woman. She runs a general shop at Machimbo, Vituka. She sells varieties of items which she purchases from the wholesale shops and from Kariakoo City market in Dar es Salaam. She faces a little business competition due to similar businesses in the area, though customer demand is high.

Fatuma requests a loan of TZS 600,000 (USD$500) to buy more items to meet the business demand.

loans.use: To buy more stocks for her shop.

loans.name: Rudy Alberto

texts.es:
Rudy se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y  la siembra de legumbres, cereales y flores cuya producción  lo comercializa en uno de los mercados mas populares de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive  en la comunidad Palomar de la Provincia Murillo del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su madre, la cual colabora en los trabajos del hogar y la agricultura. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de de mediana calidad y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Rudy is dedicated to raise cattle, planting vegetables, cereals, and flowers which are sold in one of the most popular markets of the city of La Paz. He lives in the Paloma r community of the Murillo province of the La Paz department which is located 2 hours from the capital city of La Paz.

He lives with his mom who helps with the household chores and with the agriculture. The loan will be used to buy a milk cow of medium quality and increase the production of milk as well as their earnings. It is their first credit with Impro. The evaluation conducted qualifies him for the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.en:
M. Yulduz is 45 years old. She is a widow and the loving mother of two children. Since her husband passed away she has served as both father and mother for her children and has been their sole provider, thanks to her perseverance and dedication toward her work. She sells clothing for men and, little by little, the business has progressed and given Yulduz favorable results.  It has filled her with satisfaction and joy. Her hard work has helped improve the quality of life for her family. Of course Yulduz wants to keep prospering along with her business and keep advancing the family, helping her beloved children enter University. To help her carry out her goals, Yulduz is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni, for the term of 12 months, to purchase more articles for her business to sell so she can increase her income. This exemplary and courageous mother waits for your kind support and good hearts to help move her and her family ahead.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and is where the rule of Alexander the Great ended.  It is famous for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new childrens' clothing to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Uk K., 28, lives with her husband and elderly father in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province. She is does housework and takes care of her young child. Her husband, who is pictured with Uk here, is a farmer. He grows and sells vegetables at the market and makes around US$ 4.50 per day. This couple would like to use this loan to purchase fertilizer to expand their cultivation.

loans.use: fertilizer for their farming

loans.name: Islom

texts.en:
Islom G. was born in 1962 and is married with two children. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. Thus, when he joined IMON International last year, he was able to make much progress with his previous loan, which he invested mostly in crop farming. Then, he saw a new business opportunity: the rearing of young cattle, which is very profitable because of the constant demand for meat at the market.

Given this loan, Islom will purchase young cattle and feed for them to expand his business. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; for the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, like Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and feed

loans.name: Italo Fernando,

texts.es:
Ítalo es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchos planes para el futuro. Actualmente y desde hace trece años se dedica a vender panes por las mañanas y por las tardes. Esta venta lo hace casa por casa y bajo pedidos. Por otro lado, también cuenta con un puesto propio en el mercado de su localidad. Hace más de diez años pensó en invertir su dinero en un negocio más estable, por lo que decidió comprar un puesto en el mercado de su localidad. Poco a poco fue llenado aquel puesto con mercadería. Hoy además de vender pan por la mañana y tarde atiende en su tienda de abarrotes.

Como si fuera poco, Ítalo también atiende solicitudes de trabajo eventuales como el pintado de paredes u obras de construcción. A sus treinta y nueve años, él desea estudiar administración para poder tener una empresa más grande.
texts.en:
Italo is a hard-working person with many plans for the future. He has been selling bread in the mornings and afternoons for 3 years. These sales he does house to house and by orders. He also has his own stand in the market in his neighborhood. More than 10 years ago he thought about investing his money in a stable business, so he decided to buy the stand in the market. Little by little he filled it with merchandise. Today in addition to bread in the morning and afternoon he takes care of his grocery store. As if that were not enough, Italo also does odd jobs like painting walls or construction jobs. At 39 years old, he wishes to study business administration in order to be able to have a larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries and bread

loans.name: Khujan

texts.ru:
Хужан Мамидов 1946 года рождения, женат имеет 7 детей.Высшего образования не имеет. Сам он пенсионер, нигде не работает. Хужан  разводит скот более 30 лет. Сыновья находятся в России. Дочери вышли замуж но навещают его часто. У него 3 коровы. Невестки ухаживают за коровой. 
Ему потребовался кредит  для расширения  поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Khujan M. was born in 1946, he is married with 7 children. He does not have a college education. Khujan is a retiree and does not have a job. He has been raising livestock for more than 30 years. His sons are in Russia. His daughters are married but visit him often. Khujan has 3 cows and his daughters-in-law take care of them. He needs a loan to increase his livestock headcount.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru:
Хабибулло Карчиев по национальности таджик, родился в 1956 году, проживает в Истаравшане со своей семьей. У Хабибулло 3 детей. Жена работает продавщицей в магазине. Старший сын работает перевозчиком на рынке.
 Хабибулло занимается купле продажей овощей и фруктов(помидоры,огурцы, капуста, бананы и т.д.)
 За товаром ездит в город Худжанд и Б.Гафуровский район. 
 Он хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы оптом закупить товар, после чего Хабибулло раздаст привезенный товар продавцам на рынке.
 Ежемесячно, он получает пенсию в размере 25 сомони.
texts.en:
Habibullo K. is an ethnic Tajik who was born in 1956. He lives with his family in Istaravshan. Habibullo has three children, and his wife works as a saleswoman in a store. Their eldest son makes deliveries in the marketplace. Habibullo buys and sells fruit and vegetables: tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, bananas, et cetera. He travels to the city of Khujand and the Gafurov region on buying trips. He would like to take out a loan to purchase goods in bulk, and in turn sell them to vendors in the marketplace. Every month, he receives a pension of 25 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods in bulk

loans.name: Il'yos

texts.ru: Гафуров Ильёс-молодой мужчина 33 лет,имеет 2-х детей. Занимается откормом и купля продажей скота  на протяжении 10 лет. Он имеет большой опыт в сфере животноводства, так как занимается этим с юных лет..  Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена занимается переработкой шерсти скота и продает ее на рынке, и еще помогает по хозяйству дома. Этим она помогает мужу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Гафуров Ильёс  в свою очередь хочет увеличить количество своего скота.
texts.en:
Il'yos G. is a young man of 33, and he has two children. For the past ten years he has raised and traded in cattle. He has a great deal of experience in caring for livestock, having done so since his youth. He purchases cattle at the market and, after fattening them for two to three months, sells them at the same market. His wife processes the wool and sells it at the market and, in addition, helps out around the farm. In that fashion, she is able to assist her husband in improving the family finances. Il'yos G., in turn, wants to increase the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Sotheany

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheany U., 24, and her husband Mr. Sam-At Sok, 28, were married in 2005 and have one young daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city.

Sotheany has been a silk weaver for nine years. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a silk weaver as well, and he also created another business - growing mushrooms to sell.

Sotheany previously applied for a loan to build a room for her husband for planting mushrooms. Now her husband wants to build one more room to expand his business. So Sotheany is requesting her second loan of $600 to help finance her husband’s mushroom-growing business.

loans.use: To help fund her husband's mushroom-growing business

loans.name: Afivi

texts.fr:
E. afivi délali exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de bijoux, elle dispose d’une ancienneté de 5 ans dans ce commerce ce qui lui a  donné une parfaite maîtrise de ce commerce. Son stock de marchandises a  baissé, voulant rehausser son stock elle sollicite son premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter 30 pagnes « HI TARGET »
Et des bijoux.
Elle est mariée et a 02 enfants.
texts.en:
E. Afivi Délali earns her living selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth). At the same time, she sells costume jewelry. She has been in this line of work for 5 years already, which means that she has a mastery of this business. Her stock of merchandise is low, and, wishing to replenish it, she is asking for her first loan from WAGES to buy 30 Hi-Target-brand "pagnes" and some costume jewelry.

She is married and has 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of "pagnes"

loans.name: John Thuo

texts.en:
John M. is married and has four children. With this loan, he intends to improve the restaurant business he runs next to his butcher shop by buying more furniture to accommodate more customers.

This is John’s first loan from KADET. Before KADET, he was not able to borrow a loan from any other source. He was introduced to KADET through a friend who is already a KADET client. He hopes to be so successful that he can own a chain of butchery and restaurant shops in the near future.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more chairs and tables for his restaurant so he can seat more customers

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca
Teofila es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Teofila vende comida de manera ambulatoria en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Teofila necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Teofila son mejorar su negocio y salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en:
Teofila is a partner of the Community Bank of Señor de Huanca. She lives with others, is 29 years old, and has 1 child. She sells food in an ambulatory fashion in the markets of the city of Ayacucho, which she does every day. Teofila needs a loan of $225 which will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Her dreams are to improve her business and succeed with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice and sugar

loans.name: Gelishon

texts.en:
Gelishon is 27. He sells second-hand shoes in the Gikomba market of Nairobi. He's been in this business for 1 year; he previously sold fabric. He requests his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to increase his stock of shoes. Gelishon would like to become an importer one day.  He sees his business as an investment for his future family. Gelishon describes himself as self-believing and social. 

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of shoes

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope s 45, married and has 6 children. She has been selling food for some time now. She hopes for a loan f N100, 000 to purchase more food to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food stuff to sell

loans.name: Hilaha

texts.en:
Hilaha J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Hilaha is 29 years old and married with a husband who is a businessman. They have two children who both attend school.  With the extra profits that will result from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

About BRAC:
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Atilana

texts.en:
Atilana is 65 years old and married to Mauro, who is 62. They have been together for 40 years and they have two older children who are married and live in their own homes. Atilana married Mauro when they were very young and together they have had many inconveniences but their knowledge has exceeded the constant financial strains on them. They managed to help their children grow up to be good people and gave them a good enough education to finish their university degrees: one in agronomics and the other in law.

Atilana has a grocery store in her own house and Mauro sells coal in his car. They have a good number of clients and they don’t want to stop the coal business because they accommodate many people. They are very happy with their work because it has produced very good results for them financially. They want to take a loan to buy more merchandise such as wheat, rice, sugar and drinks for the grocery store and they also want to buy coal for Mauro to sell.

loans.use: To buy wheat, rice, sugar and drinks for a grocery, and coal to sell

loans.name: Tochidin

texts.ru: Бобоханов Точидин проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Точидин имеет среднее образование. Он более 3 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном продает дойное молоко своим односельчанам. Кредит просит для покупки скота, его откармливания и дальнейшей продажи.
texts.en:
Tochidin B. lives in the Yavan district. He is 47 years old, married and has 5 children. Tochidin has secondary education. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 3 years. He mainly sells milk to his village neighbors. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock, its feeding and subsequent sale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda sells jeans clothing at Voznesenovski market in Zaporozhye. Nadezhda is divorced. She started this business 12 years ago. Being very open and friendly Nadezhda has provided superior customer service and has gained many clients. Today, she has two business locations and offersa large assortment of good jeans and clothing to her repeated and new clients.

Nadezhda would like to borrow 11,300 UAH to purchase more inventory. She would like to increase her sales and develop her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Joaquim Albano

texts.pt:
Joaquim J. nasceu no Distrito de Chemba, Província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, tem 39 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 12, 10, 8, 4 anos de idade, o mais novo com 4 meses de idade, destes os 3 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez 9ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras, mas pretende continuar com meios próprios. Vive com a sua família no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, para alem da família não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Sofala para Maputo, em 1989 com a sua família, a procura de melhores condições de vida. Em 1998, sai da cidade de Maputo para o Distrito de Boane para fixar a sua residência. Actualmente trabalha na empresa Electricidade de Moçambique (EDM) desde o ano de 2004 faz um horário único das 8h as 15.30h e aufere um salário mensal de 6.000.00mt, poupa algum mensalmente na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu irmão que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, barrotes, arreia e pedra) para dar continuidade com a sua obra.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente o presente empréstimo, para poder aceder a mais créditos no futuro afim de concluir a sua obra e oferecer o melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Joaquim J. was born in the district of Chemba in the province of Sofala in the center of Mozambique. He is 39; married; and the father of 5 children who are 12, 10, 8, 4, and 4 months. The 3 oldest go to school. He studied through 9th grade and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources of his parents. But he hopes to continue studying through his own means. He lives with his family in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo and doesn't support anyone besides his family. He left Sofala for Maputo in 1989 with his family in search of better living conditions. In 1998, he left the city of Maputo for the district of Boane to start his home. Currently he works at the Mozambique Electric Company and has since 2004. He works from 8 until 3:30. He makes a monthly salary of 6,000 meticais and saves some every month in his bank account. He has never had a loan with another bank. He became familiar with Hluvuku through his brother who is also a client of the institution. This is his first loan in the amount of 12,000 meticais, which he will use to purchase construction materials (sheets of metal, bars, sand, and stone) to continue building his house. He promises to pay back his loan on time so he can request more loans in the future so he can finish his home and offer more comfort to his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (cement, iron, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
la sra. Karla Patricia F. R. tiene 37 años de edad, tiene una pulperia la cual esta ubicada en el barrio El Chile. es casada, con las ganancias que le genera su negocio logra cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar, le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos economicos.
tiene 6 años de tener su tienda.
necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
su meta es terminar de construir su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia F. R. is 37. She has a mini market, which is located in the El Chile neighborhood. She is married. With the earnings generated by her business she is able to cover all of the household expenses, and she helps her husband with other expenses. She has had her store for six years. She needs the loan to buy more merchandise to stock her business. Her goal is to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock her mini market

loans.name: Esmerna

texts.en:
Esmerna P. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, and married. To make a living, Esmerna owns and operates an agriculture business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Esmerna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esmerna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmerna is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esmerna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business buy food for her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maria Leanie

texts.en:
Maria Leanie A. operates a fishing business. She is 42 years old and married, and she has six children, all of whom are school-aged. Her fishing business is only a year old and she earns PHP 500 per month from her business. She joined PMPC in 2009 and has since taken out one loan from PMPC. She is currently requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. 

Maria plans to use her loan to buy more equipment for her fishing business. She then wants to use her profits to save and repay her loans and she hopes  to see her children as university-educated professionals one day. 

In the photo, Maria Leanie is shown with a foam case that she uses to carry fish and a fish scale, both of which she wants to update to improve her business.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor by using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn tills a 2.25-hectare rice field. She started farming way back in 1989. She is 41 years old, married and has an eight-year-old child. She works hard at the farm because she wants it to prosper. She said that she still needs additional capital for the farm. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use it to acquire farm supplies that she needs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBORO depuis 6 ans et a eu 12 expériences avec le Crédit. Elle développe une activité d'embouche porcine et ovine. Son objectif est de participer aux différentes dépenses de la famille et de soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Marie is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Mboro for the last six years and had obtained 12 loans in the past. Her business is raising pigs and sheep. Her goal is to contribute to the family budget, helping her husband to support the family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: building her animal-raising business

loans.name: Sara Gaudiosa

texts.es:
Sara tiene 59 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos ya independizados y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace un año tiene instalado en su vivienda una pequeña bodega en la que ofrece a sus clientes abarrotes en general y golosinas. Su esposo se dedica a trabajar como obrero de construcción, pero como ya es de edad avanzada, no está encontrando trabajo con la misma frecuencia con la que solía encontrarlo antes. Por ese motivo su negocio es muy importante para el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Su bodega es muy frecuentada por sus vecinos, los cuales acuden a ella para agenciarse de productos de consumo diario por los que tendrían que ir hasta el centro de la ciudad para comprarlos, cabe resaltar que la zona en donde vive queda alejada del centro de la ciudad.

Sara desea implementar su negocio con la compra de una balanza y a la vez ampliarlo con la compra de más abarrotes, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer entregada a su familia y a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es seguir haciendo crecer su negocio para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y salir adelante junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Sarah, age 59, is married and has five independent children. She lives with her husband in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. It is three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. One year ago she set up a small convenience store in her house. She offers general groceries and sweets to her customers. Her husband is a construction worker. But, as he is elderly, he is not finding work as often as he did before. Therefore, her business is very important in supporting the family. Her convenience store is frequented by her neighbors. They come to her to get products for daily consumption, which they would otherwise have to go to the center of the city to buy. It is worth pointing out that the area where she lives is far from the center of the city. Sara wants to equip her business with a scale. She also wants to expand her business by purchasing more groceries. She is requesting, for the first time, a loan for 1,500 PEN from the Edpyme Alternative. She is a woman who is devoted to her family and her work. Her greatest desire is to keep making her business grow in order to get a better quality of life and get ahead together with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a scale and groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable Mourine M. is 45 years old and married to a plumber. They have four children, whom they hope to educate to the university level. 

Mable's business is located at Mutuli, a quiet place with minimal competition in Kakamega. She has been selling such items as detergent, soft drinks, parrafin and more, for the past ten years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge she has is debtors not being able to pay on time. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more general use items in order to expand her business. She hopes to open a supermarket in future. She is very hardworking, ambitious and welcoming.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc., to expand her business

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en: Fredeswinda U. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 70 years old, is widowed, and has six adult children. Fredeswinda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Fredeswinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Fredeswinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 51 year old married man with 3 children. He has owned a mini-market in his town since 1999. His mini-market is situated in a busy area, so he has been able, over the years, to have a growing number of clients pass by his grocery store. He offers all types of food products, soft drinks and juices, cereals, detergents, etc. and he is the only one who can take care of his family with his business income. 

Today, Ahmad is requesting to borrow $1,000 to increase his store’s inventory because, along with the majority of store owners, he has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands.

loans.use: To increase his store’s inventory.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 3 Group

texts.en:
Haidee is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso (New Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.
Haidee is excited to be taking her third loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling jewelry by purchasing merchandise to sell such as earrings, bracelets and necklaces. She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing a computer for them to learn on and by constructing a bathroom in her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase necklaces, bracelets and earrings to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Thy Mi Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy M. is 50 years old and is the leader of this group loan having been selected by its four members located in Prek Hang village in Kandal province. With this group loan, each member will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Thy M. and her husband, Mr. Sen Khorn, are fishermen who are able to earn a small income to support their family. For this business, Mrs. Thy M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fishing nets and a fishing boat to support her business.

This couple has six children: two are laborers while the other four are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and a fishing boat

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie M. is from the village of  Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old. Elsie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products like homemade ice cream  in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mary-Ann Bacurnay Group

texts.en: Mary Ann B. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mary-ann B.. Mary Ann is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Mary Ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Ann from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Chinzorig

texts.en: Chinzorig J. is 26 years old and single. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Chinzorig has a small business running a photo service booth. He has been running his photo service booth for the last five years and has gained an abundant amount of experience in professional photography. One of his dreams is to open his own photo studio where customers would have the chance to dress up in Mongolian traditional clothes while having their photos taken. He is requesting a 1,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase Mongolian traditional clothes and some equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase Mongolian traditional clothes and some equipment for his business

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose C. is from the village of Capayangan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 38 years old. Mary Rose is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Rose owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mary Rose has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Rose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Rose is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Rose from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stocking and sale of kerosene and motor oil

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu B. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Nulu has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Nulu sells her products at the market, retail.    

Nulu has requested  a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings which she will use to buy more bunches  of bananas, from MCDT SACCO. 
The main business challenge for Nulu is seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going directly to farmers for bananas. Nulu lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Zacarías

texts.es:
Zacarías es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Caracucho, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda. Allí el ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario que suelen ser vendidos en el pueblo central (a mas de media hora de camino). Esta actividad es muy importante para su familia ya que se constituye como su principal fuente de ingresos económicos.

Zacarías desea implementar su bodega con mas productos y realizar algunas mejoras, para realizar este objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona resposable y bastante trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir adelante para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le estiman mucho y le consideran una persona de confianza. En la imagen aparece junto a su esposa y a una de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Zacarías is the 34 year old father of a family who lives with his wife and children in the village of Caracucho, a rural area in the district of Mórrope, in the province of Lambayeque, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He makes a living selling general goods and groceries in store located in his home. He offeres his customers all sorts of common products that are usually sold in the central town (a half hours walk). This job is very important for his family because it is their main source of income. Zacarías would like to have more products in his store and make some improvements, but in order to do this he thought it would be a good idea to take out his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 soles. He is a responsible and hard working person whose greatest desire is to get ahead to improve his family's quality of life. His neighbors respect him and consider him to be a trustworth person. He appears next to his wife and one of his daughers in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products to start a small grocery store in their home.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma P. is from the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Wilma is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mariela Viviana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad, se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

La señora Mariela es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy a gusto porque le han ayudado mucho sobre todo para mejorar sus ingresos a través de su negocio. Ella tiene 31 años de edad y es madre soltera de un niño que ya tiene 10 años y que está en escuela, ella vive en la casa de sus padres.

Es secretaria de una empresa y además es comerciante, vende lencería, perfumes y sabanas, trabaja todos los días, en su trabajo les vende a sus compañeros de trabajo y en las noches recorre y ofrece sus productos a conocidos y amigos del sector, entrega la mercadería a crédito y cobra por semana o por quincena de acuerdo a como prefieran sus clientes. Lo que es perfumes y cremas le envía una tía de Estados Unidos, y la ropa y sabanas la compra en Guayaquil una vez al mes.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil a comprar ropa ya que pronto se viene una temporada buena y espera estar preparada. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Ilusiones Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the El Progreso neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo.  This is a marginal, crowded urban area in the city.  It is known as 'the prison sector' because the Portoviejo women's prison is located in this area.

Mariela is a founding member of the communal bank.  She is very happy with the communal bank because it has helped her.  Above all, it has helped her improve her income through her business.  She is 31 years old, and she is a single mother.  She has a ten year old child who goes to school.  She lives in her parents’ house.

She is a company secretary, and she is also a merchant.  She sells lingerie, perfume, and sheets.  She works every day.  She sells to her colleagues at work, and in the evenings she goes out to sell her products to her friends and acquaintances in the area.  She delivers her merchandise on credit, and she charges by the week or biweekly according to her customers’ preferences.  Her aunt in the United States sends her the perfumes and creams.  She buys the clothes and sheets in Guayaquil once a month.

This loan is to go to Guayaquil to buy clothes.  It will soon be a good season, and she plans to be prepared.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: cette femme est célibataire avec 3 personnes à charges, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle a commencé cette activité en 2000 et s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville d'anié. elle réalise de bonnes recettes car le céréales est une denrée très utilisée dans la cuisine togolaise. faisant face à une demande élevée de sa clientèle, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 5 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs de sorgho, 6 bols de mil et divers
texts.en: This woman is single with three dependents. She makes a living by selling cereals. She started this activity in 2000 and stocks up in the interior of the country, in the town of Anié. Her sales are good since cereals are a staple  widely used in the Togolese cuisine. Facing an increased customer demand, she is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase five bags of corn, two bags of sorghum, six bowls of millet, etc.

loans.use: Purchasing cereals

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
la señora Delia Es una cliente que tiene terrenos con riego  permanente de la Cuenca Viloma y de dos pozo de riego en la misma zona, por lo tanto es una productora de choclo, zanahoria y cebolla de calidad en forma semestral. Actualmente requiere agua para cultivar mayor extension de terreno cultivable y de esa manera generar ingresos para mejorar su vivienda y nivel de estudios de sus hijos.

Ella necesita comprar una accion de pozo para esta zona (zona de Viloma Grande) nueva para cultivar sin problemas mas choclo, pues su produccion se encuentra peligrando por la escasez de agua, debido a la sequia que esta afectando a todo el sector agricola.
texts.en:
Delia is a client who has land with permanent irrigation from the Viloma Basin and from two irrigation wells in the same area.  Consequently she produces quality corn, carrots, and onions every six months.

She currently needs water to cultivate a greater extension of arable land.  She will do this to generate income to improve her house and her children’s level of education.  

She needs to buy access to a well for this new zone (Viloma Grande zone) in order to grow more corn without problems.  Her production is in danger from the scarcity of water due to the drought affecting the entire agricultural area.

loans.use: Compra de accion para pozo

loans.name: Retamitas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “RETAMITAS” iniciará su  tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de chamarras, costuras y cueron, artesanía, venta de comida, sastrería y costura, costura, venta de chamarras, confección de polleras.

En el caso de la presidenta, señora Alicia tiene un hogar consolidado, casada, madre de tres hijos, dos de ellos ya han dejado el hogar para conformar los propios.  Con respecto al negocio, la señora Alicia tiene el negocio de costura junto con su esposo, elabora trajes a pedido.  Ella aprendió este oficio de su esposo hace muchos años atrás, en sus propias palabras ella dice: “mi esposo me ha enseñado todo”. La señora Alicia indica que con el crédito comprará tela por mayor de la Ciudad de La Paz, de las tiendas mayoristas. 
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella indica que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The “RETAMITAS” Communal Bank is initiating its 3rd loan cycle with Pro Mujer at the Santiago II Central Office.  The bank is composed of 9 members.  The board of directors includes a president, treasurer, and secretary.  The businesses they are involved in are varied: selling leather jackets, custom-made dresses, leather items, making skirts, selling artisan crafts, meals, plus seamstress work, and making skirts.

In the case of the president, Alicia is married, has consolidated a home, and is the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom have already left home to form their own.  With respect to her business, Alicia, along with her husband, operates a tailor shop.  They make suits to order.  Alicia learned this trade from her husband many years back.  She says, in her own words: “My husband has taught me everything.”  Alicia indicates that the loan will be used to buy cloth from wholesalers in the city of La Paz.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Alicia says that she likes receiving credit.

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTH AT WHOLESALE FOR MAKING SUITS TO ORDER

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela R. R. de 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo tres hijos y dos nietos, junto a los cuales reside en el departamento de San Salvador. María posee una venta de comida, la cual esta en su casa de habitación, esta zona cuenta con mucho comercio, por lo que posee muchos clientes fijos quienes comen a diario sus alimentos. Las ganancias generadas por este negocio son muy importante para la estabilidad de su familia, por lo que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras, frutas, especias, pastas y otros productos más con los cuales tenga todos los recursos necesarios para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Ángela R. R. is 48 years of age and lives with her husband, three children and two grandchildren in the department of San Salvador. María prepares and sells meals from her home. As the area where she lives is quite commercial, she has many loyal customers who come to eat daily at her house. 

The income that is generated by this business is very important for the stability of her family, which is why she is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables, fruit, spices, pasta and other products in bulk. With these products she will have all the necessary resources to offer a better service to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Sandra Maritza

texts.es: Sandra Maritza B. Z. de 34 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán donde vive junto a sus tres hijos todos menores de edad, por quienes trabaja muy duro para sacarlos adelante y darles una vida estable. Sandra posee una venta de zapatos para hombres y mujeres, la cual comercializa en el centro de Ahuachapán, en donde posee muchos clientes fijos, quienes compran constantemente sus productos. Sandra es madre soltera muy responsable y trabajadora quien cuenta con el enorme deseo darle lo mejor a sus hijos, por lo que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más zapatos, obteniendo estilos de moda, lo cual le haga más fácil su venta. De esta forma ella espera contar con más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Maritza B. Z. is 34 years old and lives with her three minor aged children in the department of Ahuachapán.  She works hard to provide an income for them and to give them a stable lifestyle.  Sandra sells men's and women's shoes out of her retail business in downtown Ahuachapán, where she has many fixed customers who buy many of her products.

Sandra is a very hard-working, responsible mother who wants to provide the best for her children.  She plans to use the loan to buy more fashionable styles to increase sales.  Her aim is to improve her family's income.

loans.use: To buy shoes for retail sales

loans.name: Akramjon

texts.ru: Сафаров Акрамжон проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат. Детей не имеет. Живет вместе с родителями. Жена домохозяйка. Сам Акрамжон предоставляет услугу, то есть он занимается перевозками на своей грузовой машине. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Akramjon S. lives in the Yavan Region. 30 years old. Married, without children. His parents live with him. His wife is a homemaker. Akramjon provides transportation services, transporting cargo in his truck. He has been in this line of business for seven years. He is taking out a loan in order to repair his truck.

loans.use: Auto repairs

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon K. is a villager in Thommeakney village in Takeo province. She was born in 1949. She is a widow with three children who are seamstresses in garment factories. She owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. 

Recently she wants to start a new business breeding cows, but her savings is not enough money. So she is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.
