loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Doolat's Group

texts.en:
Doolat is 43 years old and married with four children. She belongs to Kasur, which is a small city in Punjab in Pakistan and famous for its leather industry. She owns a small home of two rooms there and has been living in it with her family for the past 10 years.  She is a very supportive lady who knits sweaters to share the financial burden with her husband. In fact, knitting sweaters has become Doolat’s family business. All of her children operate the same business and earn very good profits. Their business grows well. especially in the winter season. They also supply the sweaters to other cities as well.  Her husband’s name is N. D. and he operates a loading business with his donkey cart. He puts the load on his donkey cart and delivers it from one place to another.  Doolat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy a new donkey cart because his current cart has become rough and rotten in different areas. The new cart will help him do his work better by putting more loads on it. Doolat is hopeful that an investment will improve his business to a great extent and he will be able to make more profits. She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that it will prove to be a good decision for her.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Doolat”.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 55 is a married mother of nine school-aged children who all attend school. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years in Nyamira town, western Kenya. Her main produce is tea, milk and vegetables, which are all sold locally. 

She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. She would like to sell maize at wholesale in the next five years. Her biggest challenge is too much rain, which affects her tea production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: 35.thi Tran. Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hường H. Thị (19) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Thi Tran Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Huong is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 36. Thi tran. Thieu hoa (12.06.36 Thieu Hoa).


Hường is married and has two very young children.  To make a living, Hường operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale.  Hường has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2011, Hường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huong is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in the amount of 5,787,900 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hường plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê Thị Lan (8) is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Lê Thị Hoa (10) is a 55-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hường H. thị (19) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thi Tran Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Hường là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 36 Thị Trấn Thieu Hóa (12.06.36).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Hường thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hường kiếm được khoảng 1,200,000 VND.  Vào 2011, Hường đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hường đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,787,900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê thị Lan (8) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,787,900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Lê Thị Hoa (10) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,787,900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: EL SEÑOR MIGUEL LABORA COMO COLECTOR ,ES SOLTERO,TIENE UNA PERSONA A SU CARGO,ES LE PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, DA GRACIA A ESTA INSTITUCION POR BRINDALE  ESTE DESEMBOLSO QUE SERA UTILIZADO PARA COMPRA DE MATERIALES  DE CONSTRUCCION  COMO ARENA, CEMENTO, BLOQUE, HIERRO,ESTRIBO, CLAVO,MANO DE OBRA PARA REPARAR PARED DE SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en: Miguel works as a collector.  He is single and has one person in his care.  This is the first loan that Ceprodel have granted him.  Miguel would like to thank the institution for having provided him with this loan which he will use to buy construction supplies such as sand, cement, blocks, iron, brace and nails, and to pay labor costs, so that he can have one of the walls in his home repaired.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María del Carmen  Sánchez Torres, vive en la localidad de Ángel Alvino Corzo, un lugar muy bonito donde su gente es muy popular. Ella vive en unión libre con el señor Jose Trinidad Mejía  Gómez  y con quien procreo tres hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad: Guadalupe, Gabriela  y el más pequeño es José Arturo.
     Solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos por catalogo  de la marca Andrea y Terra, en donde lleva  un año y cuatro meses  de lo que nos cometa que le va bien ya que le ha dejado buenos ingresos. Para dedicarse a esta actividad la  inspiro su esposo para así desarrollarse en sus gastos económicos.
      Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo  ahorra  para comprar más zapatos  y tenga lo suficiente para que su clientela obtenga lo que desea comprar  a su gusto.
      Su más grande deseo es que con la  ayuda de dios y el préstamo logre comprar un terreno donde pueda construir una casa más grande, así podrá vivir mas cómoda con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs Maria del Carmen Sánchez Torres lives in the Ángel Alvino Corzo town, a very beautiful place with many people. She is in a common-law marriage with Mr. Jose Trinidad Mejía  Gómez, with whom she has three children who are under their care: Guadalupe, Gabriela, and the youngest, Jose Arturo.
She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of shoes from the Andrea y Terra catalogue. She has been doing this for one year and four months, and she tells us that it is going well and she has made a good income. Her husband inspired her to do this work in order to contribute to the household costs.

She saves her income to buy more shoes in order to have enough that her customers can obtain what they most want to buy.

Her greatest wish is that, with the help of God and this loan, she will be able to buy a plot of land to build a bigger home, in order to be able to live more comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of shoes from a catalogue

loans.name: Lucia Carolina

texts.es:
Lucia de 25 años , es una mujer trabajadora que empezó su actividad hace poco por medio de una inversión que hizo con ayuda de sus padres abrió una papelería.

Ella labora sola de 7H00 am a 6H00 pm en su negocio. Esta casada y su conjugue trabaja en una empresa de limpieza tiene un hijo de 6 años que estudia. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas mercadería como peinillas, vichan, maquillaje, esmaltes para aumentar sus ingresos. Lo que mas anhela es construir su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Lucia, 25, is a hard working woman who started her activity a short while ago through an investment she made with help from her parents: she opened a stationery shop.

She works from 7am until 6pm.  She’s married and her spouse works for a cleaning company.  She has a 6 year old son who goes to school.  With help from the loan she wants to buy merchandise like hair clips, make-up, nail polish, etc. to increase income.  What she most wants is to build a cement house.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is from the village of Cawayan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 67 years old. Pilar is widowed and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pilar owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Pilar has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Pilar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pilar is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk food and biscuits. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Pilar from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk food and biscuits

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school while one is too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 4 years, Tatu has operated a retail business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a clothing stall in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Ильхом проживает в городе Душанбе. Холост. Ему 24 года. Он живет вместе с родителями. Его мама работает домкомом, а отец таксистом. Сам он имеет высшее экономическое образование. По профессии он проработал 2 года. Сейчас Илхом предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он имеет богатый опыт. Так как на сегодняшний день цены на топлива увеличились, Илхом хочет установить оборудование для установки природного газа.  Поэтому он берет кредит в Хумо. Если клиент установит газовое оборудование, то в этом случае цены на такси снизятся и это даст населению передвигаться на такси по доступным ценам. И кроме того он сможет получить больше прибыли.
texts.en: Ilhom lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents.  His mother works as a residential property manager, and his father works as a taxi driver.  Ilhom has a higher education in economics and spent two years working in that field.  Currently, Ilhom provides taxi services and has extensive experience in this field.  Due to current high fuel prices, Ilhom wants to convert his car to run on natural gas.  This is why is requesting a loan from Humo.  If Ilhom installs the gas equipment, he can lower his taxi prices, which would offer people a more affordable way to use taxi transportation.  Besides, he would be able to increase his profits.

loans.use: to install natural gas equipment

loans.name: Duo Mujeres De La Giralda Group

texts.es:
DUO MUJERES DE LA GIRALDA:
La señora Natividad día a día se dedica a su actividad económica que es la compra y venta de laurel, ya que hace quince años ella se a dedicado a esta actividad para el sostenimiento de su familia ya que su esposo es de escasos recursos económicos y ella lo ha apoyado para sacar adelante a su familia ya que no cuentan con otro recurso económico mas que lo de su negocio y se dedica un poco a la crianza de animales y tejidos típicos hechos a mano. Dolores, ella es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales, ya que ella es una persona que vive sola y ella día con día se dedica a su actividad económica  para sostenerse  ya que su esposo a fallecido y ella a salido adelante por si sola. También se dedica a la venta de chuchitos, Tamales y chile rellenos  ya que a ella ya la conocen bien  y las personas le hacen pedidos de sus productos por eso ella quiere ayuda a su capital.
ellas estan solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccin de tejidos.
texts.en:
'Mujeres la Giralda' group:

Natividad works daily in her business buying and selling bay leaves.  She has been working in this business to support her family for 15 years.  Her husband is of limited financial means and so she has supported him in getting their family ahead in life as they don't have any other financial income than that provided by her business.  Natividad also raises a few animals and makes traditional woven products by hand.

Dolores is a hard-workiing woman who makes traditional woven products by hand and raises animals.  She lives alone and works in her business daily in order to support herself.  Her husband is dead and she has been getting ahead on her own.  She also sells 'chuchitos' (Guatemalan tamales), tamales and stuffed chilis.  She is well known and people order her products from her.  For this reason, she would like some help in increasing her capital.

The two ladies are requesting this loan to buy raw materials for making woven products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and is married with three children. For the past five years Gemma has grown and sold gemilina trees (or gmilina; like mahogany).

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for the young gemilina trees.

In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the young gemilina trees.

loans.name: Majiti

texts.en:
Majiti is a married man with six children. Five of his children attend school and one has graduated from school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five months, he has operated a business selling milk from door to door to his neighbors. He also operates a poultry business, which contributes to his other source of income. Majiti faces the major challenge of seasonality, especially during hot seasons when the production of milk is low. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase milk to sell and poultry chicks. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase milk to sell and poultry chicks.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing a boutique to sell clothes in the future.

With the 100,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of lesos (rectangular-shaped patterned cloths) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of lesos for resale.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 25 años vive en unión libre con su mujer y sus dos hijos que tienen 4 y 2 años, los mismos que viven en Cotacachi a 15 minutos de Otavalo;Carlos se considera como una persona tranquila que le gusta trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia.

Trabaja con su mujer en la siembra de tomates de árbol por el tiempo de 1 año aproximadamente. Es la primera vez que trabaja con FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de abono para el sembrío de los tomates de árbol.

La compra de este abono mejorará la calidad del tomate de la misma manera mejorarán sus ventas.

Su sueño es comprar terrenos para sembrar y tener buenos ingresos económicos para que sus hijos tengan un buen estudio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25 and lives with his common law wife and their two children, who are 4 and 2 years old. They live in Cotacachi, 15 minutes from Otavalo. He is considered to be an easygoing person who enjoys working so that his family will get ahead.

Carlos has been working with his wife planting tamarillos [tree tomatoes] for approximately one year. This is the first time he has worked with FODEMI and he is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer for the sown fields of tamarillos.

Purchase of the fertilizer will improve the quality of the tamarillos and in this way he will increase his sales.

His dream is to buy more land to cultivate and to have a good income so that his children will have a good education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his tree tomatoes.

loans.name: Adan Elias

texts.es:
Adan Elias tiene 47 años de edad es casado, vive con la esposa y los dos hijos de diecinueve y diecisiete años de edad en el  Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Los Miembros de la VRC Voluntad de Dios, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad la cría, Parroquia Guanujo a una distancia de 20 minutos perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la Agricultura y ganadería.

Adan se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, tiene casa propia, 10 cuadras de terreno, siembra papas, maíz, trigo, habas, alverja además cría otras especies de animales como cerdos, ovejas pollos y cuyes. Compra y vende sus productos en la ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, líquidos para plagas, insumos y  para sembrar papas e incrementar su negocio. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos el incremento y caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los bruscos cambios climáticos por los que estamos atravesando. 

Su sueño es tener buenos ingresos y dar a los hijos para que culminen los estudios superiores y gozar de salud para poder seguir adelante, ampliar su producción, tener una vida tranquila. 
Le gusta las festividades del carnaval y las del sector.
texts.en:
Adán Elías, 47, is married living with his wife and two children who are 19 and 17 years old in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.

The members of the “Voluntad de Dios” (God’s Will) communal bank are located in the community of La Cría, Guanujo Parish twenty minutes away and belonging to Guaranda Canton.   They are farmers and raise livestock.

Adán works farming and raising livestock.  He owns his house and ten cuadras (unit of land area) of land and grows potatoes, corn, wheat, lima beans and peas; he also raises several species of animals like pigs, sheep, chickens and guinea pigs.  He buys and sells his products in the city of Guaranda.

He requests the loan to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides and to plant potatoes and increase business.  The loan will help him meet his economic needs and improve his farming activities.  He faces challenges like the fluctuation in prices of the products he sells as well as the brusque weather changes we are experiencing.

His dream is to earn good income to give his children so that they will complete their higher education and to enjoy good health so that he can continue expanding production and have a tranquil life.  He enjoys Carnival and the local festivals.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Rosario

texts.es:
María Rosario tiene 57 años está casada con el señor Gregorio desde hace 42 años, don Gregorio esta enfermo de las costillas por lo mismo no puede trabajar ya no tiene hijos que dependan de ellos solo tuvieron dos hijos pero ya se casaron y viven aparte.
La señora Rosario tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace tres años donde invertirá el crédito comprando, pan, leche, huevo, refresco, agua, golosinas, productos enlatados, en general comprara productos que en su comunidad la gente necesita que sería todo tipo de comida.
La esperanza que tiene doña Rosario es que su negocio crezca porque necesita las ganancias para el tratamiento de su esposo. Ya que es por el problema que se le está presentando en estos momentos. “muchas gracias por el crédito porque me ayudara de mucho sobre todo para abastecer la tienda que se estaba quedando sin mercancía.”
texts.en:
María Rosario is 57 years old.  She has been married to Gregorio for 42 years.  Gregorio has a problem with his ribs and so cannot work.  They no longer have any children who are dependent on them.  They only had two children and they are now married and live in their own homes.

Rosario has had a grocery store for three years.  She will invest her loan in her store, buying bread, milk, eggs, soft drinks, water, candies and canned goods.  She will buy products that people in her community need which is all kinds of food.  Rosario's hope is that her business will grow because she needs the profits for her husband's treatment for the problem that he has right now.  "Thank you very much for the loan.  It will help me a lot, especially in stocking my store which was running out of merchandise".

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, sugar, oil, soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a farmer and a resident of Nkubu, Central Kenya. She is aged 62 and has been in farming for 30 years producing and selling milk, passion fruits, coffee, eggs and bananas to the local market. She has 4 children all of whom are adults. 

Lilian has requested for a loan of 52,500 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the additional income will improve her living standard. She  aspires to have 8 dairy cows and increase the number of her poultry birds to 1000 in future.

Lilian says lack of sufficient animal feeds and diseases are the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis tiene 41 años, es acompañado, y tiene dos hijos.

Jose Luis lleva 20 años dedicandose a trabajar como jornalero. Dicho oficio lo aprendió de su padre. El vive en la hacienda donde trabaja, y tiene un dia libre en la semana para ir a visitar a su familia.

Jose Luis cosecha maíz para el consumo de su familia, y para comprar sus insumos él viaja una media hora a una ciudad vecina. Jose Luis siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, y ha pedido un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de insumos para su cultivo. Además de los insumos, Jose Luis quiere comprar unos cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos. Con la siembra Jose Luis asegura tener maíz todo el año para el consumo e su familia. Los cerdos le proporcionaran un ingreso adicional a su salario de jornalero.

En un futuro Jose Luis quiere tener una crianza de cerdos. Su jefe le está dando la oportunidad de tener los cerdos en su granja para que Jose Luis se pueda superar. En un futuro Jose Luis quisiera tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is 41 years old.  He has a significant other, and has two children.

For the last 20 years, Jose Luis has been working as a day-laborer, a trade he learned from his father.  He lives on the farm where he works, and has one day off a week to go visit his family.

Jose Luis grows corn for his family's consumption, and travels for half an hour to a nearby city to purchase his farming supplies.  Jose Luis plants 7,000 square meters of corn, and has asked for a loan from Fundación Campo for the purchase of supplies for his farming.  In addition to these supplies, Jose Luis wants to buy some pigs to fatten and sell.  With the planting, Jose Luis will ensure that he has corn throughout the year for his family's consumption. The pigs will provide him with an additional source of income to his salary as a day-laborer.

In the future, Jose Luis would like to have a pig-raising business.  His boss is giving him the opportunity to keep the pigs in his farm, so that Jose Luis can  do well.

In the future, Jose Luis would also like to own his own home.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing corn, and to buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla works hard to support her family. Priscilla is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Priscilla is borrowing 1,800 PHP through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family. Priscilla is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es: Sara Maria se dedica a ofrecer los servicios notariales. Desde hace dos meses ella quería realizarle estas mejoras a su vivienda pero no había podido porque no tenía el dinero suficiente. Solicita el Crédito para comprar madera, zinc, piedrín, arena y cemento.  Ella sueña con lograr construir su casa muy bonita, para poder disfrutarla con su familia. El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia gracias al crédito.
texts.en:
Sara Maria provides notary services. For the past two months, she has wanted to make improvements to her home but she has not been able due to a lack of sufficient funds. She is requesting a loan to buy wood, zinc, gravel, sand, and cement. Sara dreams of building a very nice house so that she can enjoy it with her family.

Thanks to the help of this loan, the quality of life for her family will improve.

loans.use: to buy materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en:
Joelita is a married woman with two children. She is 35 years old and resides in Osamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Joelita owns and operates a business raising crops, planting & harvesting rice to sell to earn a living, and she's been in this business for five years. She earns PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Joelita is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Joelita wants to make improvements to her house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde is 41 years-old and is married with five children aged between 6 and 21 years-old. Her business is well, clean and good. She sells various goods such as: soap, biscuits, drinks (Fanta, juice, water, etc.). She has six years experience in this business and employs three people to help her. Her business starts from 6am until 9.30pm every day except Saturday. 

Clotilde has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance company in order to purchase various goods such as: soap, biscuits, sugar, drinks (Fanta, juice, water, etc.) to sell. With any profit from the loan, Clotilde will expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as: biscuits, juice, water, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 42 años, es una madre abnegada. Sus 2 hijos, Rocío y Anderson son la inspiración para trabajar. Ella, su conviviente e hijos  viven en la casa de sus padres en el distrito de Palcamayo. Desde pequeña aprendió a trabajar la tierra. En su comunidad cuenta con terrenos de cultivos propios, donde siembra arvejas, espinacas, zanahorias, lechugas, etc. Y como Juana no se conforma con su producción, alquila otros terrenos para extender sus sembríos. De esa manera comercializa una gran variedad de verduras y hortalizas, las que vende con satisfacción en el mercado mayorista. “Las verduras de Tarma son bien solicitadas para Lima, y los compradores se llevan por sacos y canastas”, comenta. Y como el negocio es rentable también se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras y tubérculos, pues cuenta con clientes conocidos en la ciudad capital quienes le hacen diversos pedidos. Juana tiene planeado culminar la construcción de su hogar propio, para ello ha luchado día a día con su negocio y con la perseverancia que la caracteriza. Más adelante equipará su domicilio con muebles y electrodomésticos que piensa adquirir poco a poco. Juana ha solicitado un crédito individual a MFP por que siente que la entidad la ha apoyado en momentos decisivos en su negocio. Esta comprometida a pagar las cuotas en los días indicados. De recibir el apoyo, esta mujer luchadora podrá techar las construcciones de su casa. Para ello comprará cemento y contratará a operarios quienes la apoyarán en la faena.
texts.en: Juana is 42 years old and a self-sacrificing mother. Her two children, Rocío and Anderson, are the inspiration for her work. She lives in her parents’ house in the district of Palcamayo, along with her partner and two children. She learned to work the earth when she was a child. In her community, she has her own lands where she cultivates peas, spinach, carrots, and lettuce, etc. Since Juana is not satisfied with this production, she also rents other plots so she can raise more produce. In this way, she markets a wide variety of vegetables, which she sells with satisfaction at the wholesale market. “The vegetables from Tarma are in demand in Lima, and the buyers take them away in bags and baskets,” she says. As her business is profitable, she also buys and sells vegetables and tubers, since she has well-known customers in the capital city who request a variety of products from her. Juana plans to finish building her own home, which is something she has worked hard for and persevered on a daily basis with her business to attain. In the future, she will furnish her home with furniture and appliances that she will purchase little by little. Juana has requested an individual loan from MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma] because she feels the organization has helped her in decisive moments with her business. She is committed to make her payments on time. By receiving this help, this hard-working woman will be able to put a roof on her house. To do so, she will purchase cement and will hire workers to help her with this project.

loans.use: To purchase cement and hire workers.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Matumaini Ndembo Group

texts.en:
Donald is a 46-year-old father of eight children. Two of his children attend secondary education and two attend primary education. He is doing better in growing coffee, maize, and beans for over 6 years. He has farming problems based on a lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Donald is seeking working capital to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He is performing well in agricultural activities so in the next 5 years he could be able to buy an insecticides pump machine, build a good house, and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie farms rice to earn a living for himself and his family. He is 36 years old and has two school-aged children. Jessie endures the hardships of farming because he wants to support the education of his children. He plans to expand his rice acreage in order to increase production. 

Jessie is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay the wages of farm laborers. He hopes he will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay for farm laborers

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Uk, 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She is a rice farmer. Her husband is a construction worker. One of her children is also a construction worker who works with his father. 

Due to the lack of construction materials, Uk is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more construction materials for her husband to run his business to be a construction foreman. By doing so, her husband will generate more profit to support the family. In the future, she plans to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase construction material for her husband to run his business to be a construction foreman.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is forty-one-year-old Adama. She was born in Freetown and is married to a school teacher. For the past five years, she has sold gara lappers and Bamako lappers, which is locally dyed cloth and cloth dyed in Mali. 

Adama is requesting a loan to buy materials such as ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, and other items to produce a large quantity of gara lappers to sell. She will use the remainder of her loan to buy Bamako cloth to add to her business.

loans.use: to produce locally dyed cloth to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda es una persona que se ha caracterizado por siempre querer ofrecer a su familia un mejor bienestar. Casada y con un hijo de 5 años, Erlina se esfuerza todos los días en su taller de confección con el ánimo de sacar su familia adelante. Erlina montó su taller hace aproximadamente 4 años con el ánimo de contribuir con los ingresos del hogar, pues los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para poder sostener todos los gastos. Erlina decidió montar un taller de confección, actividad que conocía pero realizaba esporádicamente. En su taller, Erlina ofrece todo tipo de confección a sus clientes, lo que ha hecho que tenga muy buen reconocimiento y le genere buenas ventas. Debido a que Erlina montó su taller con muy bajo capital, a menudo se ve corta de tiempo y de materias primas para poder responder a los pedidos de sus clientes. Es por esto que Erlina busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de de insumos y materias primas para su confección como son hilos, agujas, telas, entre otros. 
Erlina espera que con esto su negocio siga adelante generando mayores ventas, pues podrá satisfacer más necesidades de sus clientes. Erlina también espera que su negocio le brinde la posibilidad de brindarle a su hijo una educación de mejor calidad que a la que puede acceder actualmente.

loans.use: Compra de de insumos y materias primas para su confección como son hilos, agujas, telas, entre otros.

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr: Rosine âgée de 34 ans a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Rosine est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Théophile. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et a leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, depuis trois ans, Rosine vend des tissus en velours comme activité principale. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Rosine s'approvisionne au Ghana et au Nigéria. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Rosine sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus en velours.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like fish net, gasoline, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials like fish net, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married with two children. He lives in the Kiwalani area in Dar es Salaam. He owns a shop near his residence where he sells sewing and tailoring materials.  The demand for these items has risen recently. This may be partly because of the start of a new academic year for the schools in  his area.  All of the primary and secondary students need new uniforms.  With his savings he managed to stock a few of these sewing materials. He cannot meet the demand for these items due to insufficient working capital.  He will use his loan to stock the necessary materials and expand his business.

loans.use: ADDING STOCK OF SEWING MATERIALS

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en: Gabil is a 27 year-old local resident. He is married and has two children. He is engaged in cattle breeding and selling. He has been doing this business since 2004 and now has three cows. At first he borrowed $600 from Normicro Beylagan branch to buy livestock. His subsequent loans were $900 and $1000. The business is now developing. He needs $1200 to buy four calves and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi A. was born in 1977 in Tsévié. He had left middle school and started his own little business selling beverages. But insufficient funds are inhibiting its development, and he is often faced with inventory shortages. He would like to better equip his shop with other items to bring in more revenue. This is why he is requesting a loan of $700. He will stock beverages from the pub, which is a cheaper way to go for him. Thus, he will be able to maximize his income to help his family more in improving their living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1977 à Tsévié, Monsieur A. Koffi a arrêté ses études au collège et à commencer par exercer son petit commerce de vente de boisson en son propre compte. Mais l’insuffisance de fonds fait que son commerce n’évolue et il est très souvent confronté à la rupture de stock. C’est ainsi que pour pouvoir mieux équiper sa boutique d’autres articles, afin d’augmenter ses revenus, il sollicite un crédit de $700 qui servira à acheter les boissons depuis la brasserie ce qui lui revient moins cher. Ainsi pourra-t-elle avoir le maximum de revenus pour contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Acquiring beverages to sell

loans.name: Messan

texts.fr:
Born in 1960, Mr. A. Messan is married and the father of eight children. Educated until secondary school, he left his studies to take up farming. Agriculture has become his beloved job, and is his principle source of income. Moreover, selling his crops is how he is able to support his children. In light of the current high demand, Mr. A. Messan would like to improve his land and production to meet the market. In order to do this, he is seeking a $1200 loan to buy fertilizer in the hopes of bettering his harvest. He would then be able to better take care of his children's schooling, health, and food.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1960, Monsieur A. Messan est marié et père de huit (8) enfants. Instruit de niveau secondaire, il a fini par renouer avec le travail de houe. Devenu son métier adoré, l’agriculture fait son principal revenu. C’est d’ailleurs à partir de la vente des produits agricoles qu’il arrive à prendre en charge ses enfants. Vu le niveau actuel très élevé des demandes, Monsieur A. Messan pense enrichir son espace cultural pour pouvoir être à la hauteur des demandes. Pour cela, il sollicite ce crédit de $1200 afin de s’acheter des fertilisants pour espérer une bonne prospérité de la récolte. Par ce moyen, il pourra mieux s’occuper de ses enfants sur les plans scolaire, sanitaire et alimentaire.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina, 26, is happily married and the mother of four children (three boys and a girl).  Except the youngest, who is just two years old, they go to the public school of the township. Her husband is working in a construction company in the same township. Catalina has a grocery store and a small beauty salon in her house. She started the business about two years ago. She sells basic foodstuff like potatoes, bananas, carrots, onions, and other groceries that people can’t easily get in the area. At night, she sells soups and drinks. She also offers hairdos and hair straightening. The entrepreneur is asking for a loan to expand her inventory in order to better satisfy the customers' needs. This way, she’ll be able to help her husband financially support the family.

loans.use: To purchase goods like potatoes, carrots and other groceries to diversify her inventory

loans.name: Emil

texts.en: M. Emil is 27 years old. He was born in Sumqayıt City of Azerbaijan. Sumqayıt is situated in eastern  Azerbaijan. M. is the only breadwinner for his family. He is dentist, and he began his profession 8 years ago. Emil is a good dentist, and he wants to provide the best service he can to his customers. He is requesting a loan of $500 so he can purchase equipment for the new treatment room. This will enable him to provide more treatments to more people, and also improve the living conditions of his family. He will repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for the new treatment room

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is a young married woman of Saaga Siumu, her business is a taro plantation not far from her backyard, owned by her husband. She joined the program in 2005 and she is now on her second loan. She used to sell 10-15 bags of taro at Fugalei Market and she gets $80-120 USD a week.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is an active client of our organization and has been involved since 06.07.2007. His first loan was taken out to purchase high quality modern clothes. He said that MicroInvest helped him to increase his working capital and attract new clients with a modern assortment of clothing. Husein lives with his parents who helped him to start his own business. After graduation from secondary school his father helped him rent a stall in the Big Market "Korvon", Dushanbe, Tadjikistan. Husein's friend Askar, who has a stall next to Husein, brings goods from Bishkek and is responsible for supplying goods to Husein's trading place. Husein wishes to make the trip himself, but he is unable to afford to do so at this time.

He hopes to receive a loan from the KIVA program to increase the volume of his goods and collect money for a trip to Bishkek. (In the photo, you can see Husein on the right and Askar on the left.)

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Nereah

texts.en: Nereah A. is a 55 year old widow. She lives with seven of her own children and four grandchildren at Dunga in Kisumu Kenya. She dropped her original business of selling fish due to competition from other traders. In 2007 she started making traditional mats which are locally used by the community. She plans to boost her current business and also supplement it with cereal sales, currently in high demand, using the US $600 she has applied for.

loans.use: Boost her current business of selling mats and supplement with cereal sales.

loans.name: Muhamadjon

texts.en: Muhamadjon U. was born in 1958 in the Spitamen region. He is married and has 3 children. He has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest-Tajikistan since 2007 and has improved his business thanks to previous loans. The business stability and the permanent family income have helped him to repay the previous loans on time and to plan for business expansion. He is engaged in the family business of livestock raising and selling. His wife does milk production. He has a small herd and dreams of a large herd. He is also a taxi driver in his spare time. Now Mr. U. is applying for a loan of 2,100 STJ to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima owns a successful clothing sales business at the central market in Ordshonikidze, Ukraine. She has a small booth in a good, visible location at the market where each day she sets up an attractive clothing display for passing customers. Rima is divorced. Her business provides an important source of income for her. She makes around $700 in a typical month.

Rima has requested a short term loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to add to her working business capital and help purchase new inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia started her business because she and her husband were without work. They decided to take a chance in traveling markets in various neighborhoods throughout the Monterrey metropolitan area to make a living and to support their children, their main concern.

The business started after her husband had spent many years struggling to find stable and well-paying work. To increase her family's income, Leticia started going to traveling markets, selling electronics.

Now she needs a loan of $500 that she will repay in six months to stock merchandise and to increase the volume of her sales. With your help, it is possible.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Leticia inicio en el negocio porque se quedó sin trabajo al igual que su esposo y decidieron aventurarse en los mercados rodantes en varias colonias del área metropolitana de monterrey, para subsistir y mantener a sus hijos, ya que para ellos son su máxima preocupación.

El negocio lo comenzó primero su esposo hace varios años tras batallar en conseguir trabajos estables y bien pagados, después ella para obtener mayores ingresos familiares se le unió en los mercados rodantes, vendiendo artículos electrónicos.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $ 500 que pagara en 6 meses surtir mercancía y obtener un mayor volumen de venta. Con tu apoyo esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk for re-sale in a local community

loans.name: Socorro Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia began her business to earn a living and provide a better quality of life for her children. She decided to begin the business as her husband’s income didn’t cover their household expenses. Over a year ago she began selling telephone equipment to her neighbors and acquaintances, little by little growing her customer base and they recommended her to others and now she earns a good income.

She needs a loan of US $500, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy more equipment. With your help Patricia will be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Patricia inicio el negocio para prosperar y darle mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ella decidio iniciar su negocio ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos familiares. Comenzo hace mas de uño vendiendo equipos telefonicos con sus vecinas y familiares, poco a poco logro hacer cartera de clientes y ellos la recomendaron con mas gente hasta lograr mejorar sus ingresos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar mas equipos, con tu apoyo Patricia saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase telephone systems to resell

loans.name: Mujeres Group

texts.en:
The trust banks Mujeres Nahuala is made up by a group of women who come from three different remote villages around Nahualá called Patzig, Palenqeuch and Rakantela.

Although these groups of women are used to live in their villages and like their lifestyles a lot, they have to leave their towns in order to earn some money. These towns are very poor and commercial activity is very scarce. There are very few shops out there, maybe one or two convenience store per town. Running water is a novelty and men often leave the towns to work in far away cities, even the United States. Most of the "Mujeres Nahuala" travel 3 days a week for 4 hours as far as the coast and Totonícapan to sell their products in the main markets over there.

The number three is a perpetual factor with this group. This is because the women have to travel 3 days a week, they come from 3 different town, and the ladies work in 3 different economic activities. One group of 3 women are buying and selling skirts and huipilles (traditional blouses), 3 of them are buying and selling other typical clothes, and the last 3 including the president, make and embroider skirts and pañuelos. The pañuelos are the pieces fabric women use to carry their babies, their goods from the markets, and during a chilly day they will wrap the panuelos around them to stay a bit warmer.

The president of the group who herself sows and embroiders skirts and huipilles was the one who formed the group. She was inspired by the success of other people who asked for loans before, so she wanted request one too so she can in her own business and improved her life this way. So, she went to recruit all of the members one by one. The group members went to the office and attended the pre-credit orientation session and after a couple of months later the group was formed.

For all of them this will be their first credit, and they are all very excited to get this opportunity to invest in their businesses and through that; in their lives and the lives of their family members.

loans.use: To invest in a more diverse stock

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica es natural del departamento de Ica, por situaciones familiares,  hace 27 años radica en el pueblito de Santa Lucia, Puno, desde que formó su hogar, se dedicó a innumerables actividades  para generar ingresos económicos, una de ellas fue la venta de artefactos eléctricos, pero desafortunadamente  sufrió el robo de su mercadería, desde entonces se dedicó a la venta de jugo de frutas, mientras que su esposo Valerio trabaja como obrero en una empresa minera , los dos juntos tratan de salir adelante.Hace un par de meses, Angélica fue operada, por ello que dejó de dedicarse a su negocio, pero ya restablecida, se encuentra deseosa de  continuar con su negocio, para ello necesita el dinero que solicita, su anhelo es seguir ahorrando para poder hacer construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Angelica is a native of the Ica Department. 27 years ago she settled for family reasons in the town of Santa Lucia, Puno. Since she formed her household, she has made her living doing countless activities to generate income. One of these was the sale of electrical devices, but unfortunately her merchandise was stolen. Since then she has made her living selling fruit juice, while her husband Valerio has been working for a mining company, both trying to get ahead. A couple of months ago, Angelica had an operation, so she had to stop her business. Now that she has recovered, she wants to get it going again, which is why she needs the money she is requesting. Her desire is to keep saving up to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital to re-start her business, which she had to stop due to health reasons.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
U. Nodira is a dynamic and ambitious 25-year-old lady. She is married and has 3 children. For 2 years she has had a small business processing dried apricots. Thanks to the quality of her products, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers and the demand for her goods has grown. This income allows Nodira to contribute significantly to the household.

Nodira requests a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600). She plans to purchase dried apricots and then process and resell them. Nodira hopes that she will continue providing her children with education so they will be able to receive an adequate education. She expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Purchase dried apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Mwajuma Mohamed's Kanga Group

texts.en:
MwaJ. M., 38 and single with two children, aged 11 and 6, operates a business selling kangas and vitenge (traditional Swahili fabrics) door-to-door. She started this business in 2002 and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $122.

This will be MwaJ.’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, the first one, since repaid, having been used to increase the stock of her business. She intends to use this new loan for the same purpose.

MwaJ. will share the money with her loan group, Kanga, whose 20 members hold each other accountable in repaying their loans. In the picture, MwaJ. is standing in the center and holding a blue purse.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of kangas and vitenge.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah S. is married and has 6 dependents. She completed senior high school. Since 2004, Hannah has sold a local meal known as 'Kenkey', which is made out of corn. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country and it is normally eaten with hot sauce and fried fish. Her husband is a trader. Hannah uses her income to take care of her children's financial needs. Hannah will use the loan to purchase more maize, fresh fish and other ingredients so she can prepare more food for sale. Hannah plans to reinvest her new profits into the business to improve her capital base.

In the picture is a sample of the local 'Fante Kenkey'.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients in order to prepare more food for sale.

loans.name: Mrs. Sa Mai Sor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank group, which consists of seventeen people is located in Phum Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Sa Mai S. is the group president who has been selected by the members. She is a housewife who cooks delicious foods for her family. Her husband, Mr. Deam Von, is a construction worker who makes a small income that supports the family. They have six children, four of whom are working in a garment factory, while the others attend the local school. Although Mrs. Sa Mai S.’s family members work hard, they still live in an old house that is in poor condition. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Sa Mai S. decided to ask for a loan which along with her savings, will allow her to build a new house for the family.

Village bank group loans consist mainly of end-of-term loans. Five members have had end-of-term loans and the rest have had monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a new house for the family.

loans.name: Fadhil

texts.en: Fadhil I. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. His business is to sell lumber and furniture at Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. Buguruni is a market center for timber from different regions in Tanzania. He purchases wholesale from the wholesale shops and sells retail. Also he is a carpenter; he makes several varieties of furniture which he sells to customers. He needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more stock.

loans.use: To buy more lumber

loans.name: Kabul

texts.en:
M. Kabul is a hardworking father with the responsibility of taking care of his wife and two children, the driving force for his work. Early every morning, David leaves to take care of his farmland, irrigating and fertilizing in order to produce quality crops that will earn a good income. His wife and children also help him with his business. 

One of this couple’s dreams is to enable both of their children to achieve higher educations so that one day they’ll become great persons. To that end, they are requesting the current loan to increase their crop production by buying seed, fertilizer and other supplies needed for productive farming of their land.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing  hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for the farm.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts and is requesting a loan to expand her business. She is 25 years old. Her husband is a security guard. She has two children and both children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to open up a shop

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina S. is married with 4 children and has received schooling through Form 4. Selina sells groundnuts, rice, beans, and other provisions in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2006. Her husband works for the fire department. Selina uses her income to pay for rent, utilities, clothes, and other necessities. Selina will use the loan to purchase goods to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Selina plans to put up a building.

loans.use: purchase goods to expand the business

loans.name: Nasrulo

texts.ru: Нарзулоев Насруло проживает в городе Вахдат, в возросте 46 лет.Женат имеет троих детей, имеет среднее  образования.Сам клиент занимается торговлей, у клиента имеется собственная торговая точка. Этим видом деятельности клиент занимается более пяти лет Ходжикотагон.На полученные деньги, клиент хочет увеличит свой товар. От полученного дохода, клиент хочет отремантировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Nasrulo N., 46, lives in the city of Vahdat. He has a high school education, is married and has three children. This entrepreneur has his own store, and has been working in sales for over five years. He would like to receive funds to expand his inventory, and then use the income generated to make repairs to his home.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: CHEIKH GUEYE EST UN JEUNE TRANSPORTEUR QUI HABITE AU QUARTIER MEDINA FALL DE THIES AVEC SA FEMME .DEPUIS 2005 il dispose d'un véhicule de transport en commun qui est sa principale source de revenu;avec ce pret il veut réparer son véhicule qui est en panne.
texts.en:
Cheikh Gueye S. is a young professional driver who lives in the Medina Fall district of Thies with his wife. Since 2005, he has had a public transport vehicle which is his principal source of revenue. With this loan, he wants to repair that vehicle which is currently out of order.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repairing his public transport vehicle

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila O. is a resident of Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as motor-cab driver and earns only a meager income. She registered as a regular member of Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner, in August 2006. She is very responsible with her weekly obligations such as savings, share capital and insurance. She has begun a “sari-sari” (general variety) store business. In need of capital, she reached Paglaum for her project and applied for a loan of PHP 25,000.

She is very thankful to Paglaum as her financing partner. She looks forward to seeing her sari-sari store become successful.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for "sari-sari" store business

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 55 years old. Perlita is widowed and has seven adult children. To make a living, Perlita owns & operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Perlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business and to partly help in building her house. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Perlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business and to help in building her house

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Naana

texts.en:
Naana A. sells gari (a fried cassava dish); she buys cassava and then mills it and fries it to get her gari. She then packages it in sacks before sending it for sale at the market at Kormantse near Cape Coast. Naana has received junior high school education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Naana has been selling gari since 2003. She is responsible for feeding her family and also for paying her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her capital in order to buy more cassava to process and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her husband in educating their children.

loans.use: To increase her capital in order to buy more cassava to process and sell

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
M. Hafiza is 44 years old. She is married with 4 children. Hafiza’s husband is retired on a pension and currently unemployed. That is why her business is the main source of income of her family.

 Hafiza has been running her own business for 8 years already. She has a place in the local market selling foodstuffs such as flour, macaroni, rice, sweets, tea and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Her son help her in the store, registering the stock and serving the customers. 

Hafiza and her son are very friendly and polite which allows them to have a large clientele. Now she requests 7000 Somoni for purchasing more goods to sell thus increasing the range of her goods. Hafiza promises to repay her loan on time and thanks everyone who decided to support her.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchasing goods for sale to expand her inventory

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es:
Nolberta es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar II.
Nolberta es casada, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Nolberta tiene un molino en su casa en donD. brinda el servicio D. molienda, además compra cereales que le traen los productores para luego procesarlos en harinas, producto que venD. en la selva ayacuchana.
Nolberta necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cereales.
Además Nolberta sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nolberta is a member of the Bienstar II Communal Bank. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a grain mill in her home where she provides milling services. She also buys grain from producers and processes it into flour, which she sells in Ayachucho.

Nolberta needs a loan of 1050 soles to purchase grain. She also hopes to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Immaculate's Group

texts.en: Immaculate T. is the leader of this lending group in Ibanda. She is 28 years old and married with 2 children who attend primary school. She is a hardworking and determined lady with a bar business in the Bisheshe trading center.  She has been running this business for one year and her best selling point is making good and classy drinks.  She is now seeking a loan in order to increase her stock of beer, wine, soda, mineral water, and malwa so she can attract more and more customers, and therefore more income. The profits from this business,  in contribution with that of her husband, will continue to help Immaculate provide for her family and educate her children.

loans.use: To increase the stock of beverages for her bar.

loans.name: Funmi

texts.en: Funmi is 55 years old and she is a widow with six children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en: S. David is an individual client that has been working with Pearl microfinance for 4 years now. He is a married man with 4 children the eldest being at the University and his dream is to see all the four attaining the best of education. He is a farmer involved in banana growing in Rubaare, Kagongi Cell for 20 years and he is grateful that at least every week, he has a net profit of 50,000/=, because of the quality of his produce. He is mainly affected by the unstable prices of produce that keep on changing depending on the season and it is good that for such seasons, he plans accordingly. He wants to live a happy life together with his family since they have gone through a lot together. He needs a loan to help improve his banana plantation by buying farm inputs for improved quality and quantity.

loans.use: Buying farm inputs for an improved farm for more revenue.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es socia del Banco Comunal Pueblo Libre que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua.
Adelaida es casada, tiene 39 años y 1 hijo, Adelaida viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende mantas que manda a tejer, además vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza 3 días a la semana.
Adelaida necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mantas.
Adelaida sueña con tener una casa propia y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a member of the Pueblo Libre, which means Our Strength in Quechua, Communal Bank. Adelaida is 39, married, and has one child. Adelaida travels to regional fairs where she sells blankets that she has woven. She also sells various clothing. She does this three days a week. Adelaida needs a loan for 900 PEN to buy blankets. Adelaida’s dream is to have her own house and that her son finishes his education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blankets

loans.name: Armande Louise

texts.fr: N. Armande Louise est née le 24/08/1976 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Armande Louise est mariée à DJIKPETO Luc, un transitaire. Armande Louise et Luc ont trois enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Cocoomey, non loin de Cotonou. Armande Louise et Luc assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Armande Louise a fait le cours secondaire mais c'est la coiffure que Armande Louise a fini par apprendre. Armande Louise a son salon de coiffure à Cocotomey et y vend également des produits de cheveux et de beauté. C'est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Armande Louise s'approvisionne en ces différents produits. Armande Louise a besoin de moyens financiers pour agrandir son salon, c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Armande Louise N. was born on August 24, 1976 in Cotonou, the capital city of Benin. Armande Louise is married to Luc Djikpeto, a driver. Armand Louise and Luc have three children, and they are all going to school and they are all still in their care. The family lives in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou. Armande Louise and Luc are both responsible for the family’s wellbeing. Armande Louise finished high school but it’s hairdressing that she ended up studying. Armande Louise has a beauty shop in Cocotomey and she also sells beauty products and hair care products. In Dantokpa, the large international market in Benin, Armande Louise buys all her different products. Armande Louise requires funds to expand her salon, which is the reason why she is requesting a loan of Alide (Kiva Field Partner).


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic and beauty products.

loans.name: Muhaiyo

texts.en:
S. Muhaiyo is a married woman with a great drive to better herself, and this positive outlook on life has led her to make progress, little by little. For the past seven years she has been continuously devoted to animal sales. This business activity has led to much satisfaction because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. Now Muhaiyo is planning to expand her business and buy more cows. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan of $1500 USD. She kindly thanks you for your generosity.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle

loans.name: Kaja Group

texts.en:
Mwasiti M. is 37 years old, married, and has three daughters, Diana (18), Miriam (16), and Amy (13). 

Mwasiti has been a businesswoman since 1990 since she was just 18. She is in the clothing business, buying clothes in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and selling them in Arusha, a city eight hours north by bus. She says that Arusha has "bei mkubwa sana," or "very big prices," compared to Dar.

Mwasiti works from 8 am til 10 pm every day, making a monthly profit of about 300,000 TZS ($225). She uses her profit to care for her family, paying for school fees, food, and health care costs.

This is Mwasiti's fifth loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. She has repaid all of her previous loans successfully, and wants to use this one to buy more dresses, kangas, shoes, pants, and other accessories to increase the variety of her goods. 

She believes increasing the variety of the items she sells will help her business become more profitable. 

In the photograph, Mwasiti is seated second from the right in the front row. She and all of her group members are from the Makumbusho area of Dar es Salaam. 

Mwasiti will share this loan with the members of Kaja group. The group loan will help support the businesses of six photographers, three clothes sellers, a video shooter, two shop owners, two salon owners, a fish vendor, and one woman who sells radios and TVs.

The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy dresses, kangas, shoes, pants, and other accessories to increase business stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for plowing and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en: T. Dulamsuren is 58 years old and lives in Zavkhan Province in western Mongolia. All of her children are now fully grown and live on their own, and her husband recently passed away. She lives in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Dulamsuren has managed a small grocery shop in her town since 2001. She is an accountant by trade and has used her business knowledge to build a consistent operation over the years. Dulamsuren enjoys her work and hopes to continue her success in the future. She says, “I am working hard in order to achieve my dreams.” She is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase grocery items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Rhyan

texts.en:
