Rhyan is 19 years old and married. He is from Danao in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. His principal business is fish vending and trading, weighing and selling the fish he buys using the scale and foam box pictured. He's been doing this for four months now. He earns about P2,000 from his business.

Rhyan joined PMPC four months ago. A neighbor told him about their products and services, as well as their ability to help him start  his business. He took out his first loan of P3,000 and now is taking a loan of P10,000. He plans to use his loan proceeds to buy more foam boxes for his fish vending business and will use the profits to help support his mother financially.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To buy more foam boxes for fish vending business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene G. is a woman with determination to rise above poverty. She is 56 years old and the widowed mother of four children, all of whom are of legal age already. She lives in Coastal Talim Island, town of Binangonan, Rizal province, in the Philippines.

In 2007, she decided to join Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, to obtain capital for her sari-sari store (general store). During her membership in ASHI, her performance has been recorded to be very good. Now she is requesting a loan of 20,000 pesos to pay for 50 sacks of charcoal, liquors and other groceries for the store.

With the help of ASHI and Kiva, she believes that she will rise up from poverty. She said that the services of ASHI and Kiva offer big opportunities to make their family dreams come true.

loans.use: To pay for 50 sacks of charcoal, liquors and other groceries for the store

loans.name: June

texts.en:
June has successfully combined her passions for movement and child development with June Bug’s Gym, a place where she strives to help children build self-confidence and find joy in being fit. Combining twenty years of work with preschool children and with a background in competitive gymnastics, ballet, modern dance, theater and horse-vaulting at an international level, it is not surprising that June has seen her business triple since it started in November of 2008.

To accommodate her growing client base, June needed to expand her gym into a larger space. A friend from Wells Fargo, who was frustrated that she was unable to help due to the tighter loan qualifying criteria set by banks, referred June to Opportunity Fund.

With this loan June will be able to create a safety wall, install netting around the trampoline area, and buy new gym equipment to ensure the gym continues to be a fun, educational, and safe environment. In addition, June will be able to purchase a computer to accommodate new gym software to help grow the business, and contract a bookkeeper to help establish a better budgeting and record-keeping system.

With the expansion of her gym and just one semester left to earn her degree in Early Childhood Education, June is close to fulfilling a lifelong dream of owning a preschool-gym business. “My family especially thinks that this has changed me a lot. I have so much freedom working for my own business compared to when I used to work for somebody else. I am very happy now. Everyone in the family is saying that I am finally doing what I want to do.”

loans.use: To buy new gym equipment, a computer and record-keeping software

loans.name: Velmar Zawadi

texts.en:
Velmar is a 30-year-old single parent of two children: Kelvin and Sofia Kazungu. She was introduced to KADET by an existing client of their group and this is her first loan.

Velmar, is in the business of selling charcoal and has done this for two years in Gede shopping center which is part of the larger Malindi district. Her customers are mainly the residents of the households in Gede-Malindi and she earns a monthly profit of about Kshs 3,000. She plans to use Kshs 3,000 of the loan to add to her stock of charcoal and Kshs 2,000 to buy a stock of greens.


With the extra income from this loan Velmar hopes to open up a big charcoal business to supply wholesalers. She is a woman who describes herself as hardworking and dreams of seeing her children excel academically.

loans.use: To add to her stock of charcoal and to buy a stock of greens

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is indeed happy that she cooks and sells cassava dough. This is a staple food in Nigeria, which comes from cassava. She sells cassava dough in an open area in the market.

Rosemary is 44 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a farmer and he also supports the home. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more dough to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: Aminat

texts.en: Aminat sells clothes to make a living. With this business, she hopes to make more profits. She loves this business because of the opportunity it gives her to interact with her customers. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is 31 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. She hopes to pull her family and business out of poverty. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food produce & mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Neftalí Antonio

texts.es: Neftalí Antonio M. de 47 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Su grupo esta conformado por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y así mismo le ayuda a Neftalí con el trabajo, así mismo vive junto a sus tres hijas de 12, 10 y 9 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Neftalí se encarga de elaborar camas de junco, un trabajo muy escaso, por lo que puede venderlo a muy buenos precios por ser un producto artesanal, el cual se comercializa en gran manera con personas extranjeras. Su venta este ubicada sobre la calle principal de Ilopango, en donde coloca las camas sobre la acera, con lo cual obtiene mayor visibilidad de los posibles clientes. Neftalí solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más junco y así mismo toda la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración de camas. Él es un padre de familia muy responsable, el cual trabaja muy duro por salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Naphtali Antonio M. is 47 years old and lives in the town of Ilopango, located in the department of San Salvador. His family is comprised of his wife, who is engaged in household chores which helps Naphtali to concentrate on his work, and their three daughters, ages 12, 10 and 9, who are studying in school . Naphtali takes to the task making reed beds, an uncommon trade. He can sell them at very good prices as a handmade product, which are sold largely to foreigners. Their point of sale is located on the main street of Ilopango, where the beds are placed on the sidewalk, thereby obtaining greater visibility to potential customers. Naphtali requesting a loan so that he can buy more reeds and the raw materials necessary for the production of beds. He is a very responsible parent, who works very hard to get ahead with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy reeds to make beds

loans.name: Rodolfo De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Rodolfo es un padre de familia de dos hijos, es de recursos económicos pobre y ha tenido que trabajar duro para poder alimentar a su familia debido al desempleo de nuestro país. Tiene vaR. años laborando como guarda de seguridad con un salario bajo pero fijo. Lo mas importante para el es poder culminar su casa y pode tener un techo mas seguro pero como sus utilidades son bajas no puede lograr un financiamiento grande, es por eso va poco a poco haciendo la casa de concreto.
Con el crédito anterior logro avanzar mucho, y con este financiamiento seguirá la construcción para terminar las paredes de concreto. Para luego poder comprar zinc, embaldosar ya que es de tierra y lograr una mejor higiene  y un mejor patrimonio. Sus planes es lograr el objetivo con su vivienda que gracias a los préstamos se ha hecho posible.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is the father of a family of two children. He has few economic resources and has had to work very hard to feed his family, owing to the unemployment in his country. He has been working as a security guard for several years for a small but secure salary. The most important thing for Rodolfo is to be able to finish his house and have a more secure roof over his head, however as he has few finances he hasn't been able to obtain a large loan. Because of this he has been building his house from concrete, little by little. With his previous loan Rodolfo was able to advance progress on his house a lot, and this loan with allow him to continue construction to finish the concrete walls. Now he will buy zinc and tile what is currently earth, creating better hygiene and wealth. Rodolfo's plans are to achieve the objective of finishing his home, and thanks to these loans it has been made possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials such as concrete blocks, sand, cement, iron

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola M. is currently in the business of selling necklaces and earrings in a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more earrings to sell. Viola is 39 years old and is married to a clerk. She has four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more earrings to sell

loans.name: God’S Mercy Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'God’s Mercy'. She is 42 years old, single, and has three children who range from 18 to 24 years old. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to lack of financial support.
 
For 15 years, she has been selling coconuts in Redlight Market, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 60,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more coconuts. She describes herself as a jovial woman. Her plan is to grow her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Meme is inset at lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence operates a mixed farm in Kisii town in Western Kenya. He has been farming for 15 years and employs one farmhand. His main products are milk, tea, bananas and chicken, which he sells locally. Lawrence is also a mason. He is 44 years old and married with six children between the ages of 6 and 22. All his children except one attend school.

Lawrence recently paid off a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to lease land and plant napier grass for his three dairy cows. He says that this loan will increase his income through the sale of milk, improve his family's health, and produce enough manure for his farm from his cows. However, he faces the challenge of livestock diseases and lack of a market for his milk. In five years' time, he plans to increase his herd of cows to at least seven. He appreciates the help and would like to be financed again in the future.

loans.use: To lease land and plant napier grass for his dairy cows

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun S., 30, is married and resides with her husband and a young child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. (S. was not available, so her husband appears in the photograph instead.)

S. is employed at a garment factory for an income of $2.50 per day. Her husband is a farmer and construction worker, earning an income of $3 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows to help plow the fields

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She has 5 children, 2 of whom are still attending school. 10 years ago, she started working at the occupation she really likes, wedding and speciA. ceremonies organizer. Her work consists of arranging and organizing all the preparations related to the events in addition to making flower designs. Over the years, her work has developed and she has built a good business reputation. Today, she is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase designing merchandise and motifs. During the summer season, her work operation increases and she has to be prepared to be always recruiting clients.

Note: Based on the politicA. and sociA. challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF InternationA., Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the CentrA. Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financiA. institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financiA. services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financiA. services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase designing merchandise and motifs.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan A. has been running a grocery shop since 2008. He supports his wife and two children. Vardan rents a shop in between several buildings serving the neighborhood. To meet his customers’ demands, Vardan wishes to introduce a fruit and vegetable corner in his shop.

loans.use: to introduce a fruit and vegetable corner

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna B. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her sisters. Berna has a business of poultry farming. She has been in this business for ten  years and she works 7 days a week. Berna sells her products retail from home. Berna lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Berna has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy poultry feed and chicks. 
The main business challenges for Berna include high prices for poultry feed and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a delivery van and also own 2000 chickens.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Rosa Leticia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Panamá es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive en la comunidad de San Juan Loma que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por la producción agrícola en donde la mayor parte es para el consumo de su población, también se dedican a la cría de animales y mucha de su población trabaja en la ciudad realizando varias actividades.

Doña Rosa es comerciante hace 10 años, tiene un puesto en la Terminal Terrestre de la ciudad donde vende varios productos como cigarillos, caramelos, gaseosa, dulces, etc. labora toda la noche y en la mañana es uno de sus hijos quien le ayuda en la atención del local ya que trabaja las 24 horas del día y todos los días de la semana.
 
La Señora. Rosa tiene 49 años, está  separada hace 20 años y tiene 4 hijos de 24, 23, 21, 20 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos tienen compromisos, su primera hija vive en su casa y comparten gastos, su segundo y tercer  hijo viven independientemente y  el último le ayuda en la atención de su local, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la fundación y fue invitada por una amiga que es socia del banco comunal. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para su negocio como gaseosas, caramelos, cigarrillos, etc.
 
Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the community bank "Blooming Women." She lives in the community of San Juan Loma which is in the parish of Valle. This parish is known for its agricultural production, and the majority of the produce is consumed by the local people. The people also raise animals, and many people work in the city at various jobs.
Rosa has been a shopkeeper for 10 years. She has a stall in the bus terminal where she sell a variety of goods including cigarettes, candies, sodas, etc. She works all night, and in the morning one of her children takes over so that the stall is open 24 hours a day every day of the week. 
Rosa is 49 years old, has been separated for 20 years, and has 4 children how are 24, 23, 21, and 20 years old. Her two eldest children are engaged, her oldest daughter shares her home and income, her second and third children live independently, and the youngest helps her with the stall. She does not have her own home so she rents.
This is the second loan that she has had from the Foundation and she was invited by a friend who is a member of the community bank. She will use the loan to buy more products for her store, such as sodas, candies, cigarettes, etc.
Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: Comprar gaseosas, chocolates, caramelos, cigarrillos,etc.

loans.name: Marygane

texts.en:
Marygane C. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 35 years old. Marygane is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marygane owns & operates a business harvesting & selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Marygane has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marygane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marygane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Marygane is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Marygane from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es: El Señor Gerónimo nacido el 1 de Octubre de en Munaipata, casado con doña Toribia con tres hijos hace 4 años que llegaron a Sta. Cruz y viven a 32 Km de El Torno  en la cual tiene su parcela en la comunidad paso del Chivo, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra Maní y cebolla todo el producto que siembra el lo saca para vender en El Torno, sus hijos le ayudan con el sembrado y la cosecha de sus productos, son muy trabajadores y muy responsables, con el dinero del crédito comprara semillas y prepararan la tierra para el sembrado del mismo, son un afamilia muy unida que trabajan para mejorar su calidad de vida, estan agradecidos con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: El Señor Gerónimo was born on October 1 in Munaipata.  He is married to Doña Toribia, and they have three children.  They came to Santa Cruz four years ago and live 32 kilometers from El Torno, where they have land in the Paso del Chivo community.  He grows peanuts and onions and sells all his products in El Torno.  His children help him sow and harvest his crops.  They hare very hard-working and very responsible.  With this loan, they will buy seeds and prepare the land for sowing and cultivation.  They are a very close family that works to improve their standard of living.  They are grateful to the lending institution for the assistance.

loans.use: For controlled burning of land and sowing of peanuts and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy potato and corn seed and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Adrian Wilder

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Adrian; el tiene 43 años de edad, casado y tiene 1hijo; el socio se dedica al alquiler de su carro (camión), el lo alquila a las personas que lo requieren, el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa siendo este el medio para sacar a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento del carro.

 El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Adrian belongs to the “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Adrian is 43 years old.  He is married and has one child.  His business is hiring out his vehicle (a truck).  He hires it out to people who need it.  He works together with his wife and this is how they get their family ahead.

He is requesting this loan so that he can have maintenance work done on his vehicle.

He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To have maintenance work done on his vehicle

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Gisela vive en  la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz, soltera, no tiene hijos; es dueña de un micro (movilidad tipo van de transporte de pasajeros) con el cual genera sus ingresos, para su educación, alimentación y algunos otros gastos.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar repuestos y mantener estable su herramienta de trabajo.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Gisela lives in La Paz’s San Martín zone.  She does not have any children.  She owns a micro (a type of van used to transport passengers) that generates income for her education, food and some other expenses.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy replacement parts and to service the vehicle.

She is an Impro client and pays well so may access a new loan.

loans.use: For replacement parts and maintenance of her microbus.

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia B. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 37 years old. Rodelia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rodelia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Rodelia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rodelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodelia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as biscuits. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rodelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as biscuits

loans.name: Adebiet

texts.en:
Adebiet S. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. His four children attend a local secondary school.

Adebiet operates a meat trading business in his town with the help of his wife. He started his business in 1998 and has since built a stable operation. After these many years of operation, he has gained much experience in his trade.

People usually prepare their meat for winter between December and March, and therefore during those months the price of meat falls. Adebiet plans to buy a large amount of horse and sheep meat at a cheap price and preserve those frozen meats to sell in the upcoming spring months when the price of such a product is very high.

So Abediet is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of meat to sell this spring. In the future he hopes to have his own cellar that can contain a large amount of meat.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel R. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Marifel is married and has 3 school-aged children. Marifel owns & operates a livestock business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. Marifel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marifel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marifel has successfully repaid her first loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Marifel is now requesting a second loan, for 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar S., 41, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in the Tuv province of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they own. His older son attends local high school and his younger son goes to kindergarten. 

Uuganbayar started operating his current food store in 2000. His wife works at the store as a salesperson. Uuganbayar also works for a company as a security guard where he spends three days a week. Besides working as a security guard and operating his food store, he drives a taxi. 

He is a hardworking man who is trying to save money for his children's further study. He says, " I want to expand my business and increase my profit in order to give the opportunity to my children to study at a college."  He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more food to sell and increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia T. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 56 years old. Virginia is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Virginia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and canned goods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and canned goods

loans.name: Siyathokoza Group

texts.en:
Sphiwe is 40 years old, single, and has 3 children between 6 and 12, all of whom attend school. She has been in business for 3 years, and earns additional income from the government’s child support grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is acquiring stock, because she does not have transport. In the photo above she is standing on the far right hand side in front of the group. 

Sphiwe requested this loan through Women’s Development Business and KIVA to buy airtime, clothes, cold drinks and chips. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her kids to better schools and have a good life. In five years time she would like to have a factory and more employees.  She appreciates WDB and Kiva very much because her business is going to be seen on the website.

loans.use: to buy clothes, airtime, cold drinks and chips

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia lives in Jaranwala which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for almost 16 years. 

Her husband’s name is S. P. and he is a painter by trade. He paint houses, walls and buildings on order. He makes contracts with different companies and also works for individuals on a daily wage. He has good skills in his work and receives regular orders every month. 

Safia is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and perform her household responsibilities. She is a very caring mother and takes care of her children very well. She has two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son operates a grocery shop while her remaining children are studying at a local school. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy paint and brushes that will help him offer better quality services to his clients and earn better profits. 

He has been doing this work for the past 10 years and Safia is confident that the loan investment will help him earn more profits from his work. Safia is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy paint and brushes for her husband's painting service.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: EL SEÑOR P.  LABORA COMO SEGURIDA INTERNA ,ES SOLTERO ,TIENE  DOS PERSONAS A SU CARGO, ES  EL QUINTO  CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE LE HAN BRINDADO  ESTA INSTITUCION  CON LOS DESEMBOLSO QUE LE HAN APROBADO , ESTE CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA  COMPRAR CEMENTO, BLOQUE, HIERRO, MANO DE OBRA,PARA HACER  BAÑO  Y COCINA EN SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en:
Mr. P. works in internal security. He is single with two dependents.
This is the fifth loan granted to him by CEPRODEL. He is grateful for the opportunity provided by this organization's approval of the loan disbursement.
He needs this loan to buy cement, blocks, iron and labour to build a bathroom and kitchen in his home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Raquel; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende en el hotel de yanahuara llamado Casa Andina, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the San Isidro de Yanahuara Communal Bank. The bank is located in the District of Urubamba, part of the Province of Urubamba and the Department of Cusco.

Raquel is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling handicrafts. She makes her sales at a hotel in Yanahuara called Casa Andina and works from 5am to 10pm. Raquel uses this business to get her children ahead in life. She is requesting the loan to buy handicrafts at wholesale.

Raquel is happy for the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts at wholesale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 2 menores hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande a tan solo 1 hora de distancia de la provincia de chiclayo, cuenta con una casa propia, con todos los servicios básicos (agua,luz y desague) ubicada en la zona rural de dicha provincia. Tambogrande se caracteriza por ser una zona netamenente agricola y ganadera.

Maribel a acondicionado la sal de su casa para poner un peueña tienda para vender productos de belleza y todo tipo de adornos, ésta actividad lo realiza desde hace un poco más de 2 años.  Estos productos es para que las personas mejoren su imagen perosnal y  también ofrece en su tienda distintos regalos para cualquier evento,  con estos ingresos se ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos  junto con su esposo.

A solicitado Maribel a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles para comprarmas productos de belleza y sustir su tiende con otro tipo de  mercadería como ropa para diferentes edades,ya que en su distrito las personas que le compran le han comentado que sería bueno que también venda otras cosas . Con los ingresos de la venta de todos sus productos cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado y mejoraría su calidad de vida.

Maribel es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, alegre, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro para los suyos (esposo e hijos).
texts.en:
Maribel, 35, is a mother living with her husband and two minor children in Tambogrande District a mere hour from Chiclayo Province.  She has a house of her own with all basic utilities (water, electricity and sewage) located in a rural zone of said province.  Tambogrande is noted for being a distinctly farming and livestock raising area.

Maribel refurbished her living room to accommodate a small store selling beauty products and all kinds of decorations.  She’s been in this activity for a little over two years.  The products are designed for the improvement of personal appearance.  She also stocks gifts for all occasions.  Income helps her and her husband support their children.

Maribel has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2500 new sol loan to buy more beauty products and to stock her store with a different kind of merchandise, like clothes for all ages, because people in her district who buy from her have commented that it would be good for her to sell these kinds of things in her store too.  Income from the sale of all her products will cover her loan installments and improve her quality of life.

Maribel is very well known for being a hard working, cheerful, responsible woman and for being a good mother who wants to provide a better future for her loved ones (husband and children).

loans.use: to buy more beauty products and clothes for all ages.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is from the village of Cawayan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Carmela is married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Carmela owns & operates a business buying and selling vegetables like cabbages & eggplants in the local community. Carmela has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmela is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional eggplants & carrots. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carmela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggplants & carrots

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 27 years old and married, with two children aged one and five.  He sells household goods such as utensils, basins and buckets.  He appreciates Faulu Kenya because the organization has helped him to add business stock.  Stephen works hard in his business so that one day he  can open another shop.  He has requested  80,000 KES to buy more utensils.

loans.use: To buy more utensils

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is an enterprising 30 year old business lady who is married to Morris, who works as a driver. They are blessed with two children. She has been running a green grocer business for the past 3 years, and earns a monthly income of KES 5,500, which she uses to support her family.

Ann is applying for her first loan with KADET, after being introduced to the organization by staff. She will use the money to increase her stock of things like tomatoes, kale and potatoes.  With the anticipated profits from her business she plans to improve her family’s standard of living. Her dream is to own a big grocery store.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes, kale and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 42 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintero, el realiza trabajos como sillas, mesas y puertas, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio vende sus trabajos en las distintas ferias de Anta, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de carpintería. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los muebles como barniz, madera y pegamentos. 
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE HUANCA” communal bank located in Calca District belonging to Calca Province and Cusco Department.

He is 42 years old, married and has three children.  He alternates his daily activities with being a carpenter.  He makes such things as chairs, tables and doors.  He works from 8am until 7pm.  He sells his items at various markets in Anta.  He wants to expand the carpentry business and is asking for a loan to buy supplies to make furniture like varnish, lumber and adhesives.

He is happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy furniture making supplies like varnish, lumber and adhesives.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia comes from the village of Charnali in the Adjara Region. He is 39 years old and lives with his big family: wife Medea, 9 year-old-son, two daughters (7 and 4 years old), his 32-year-old brother and his parents (retired). 

Gia works in a local glass workshop, which produces different household goods made from glass. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in his family's agricultural business. Gia’s family is engaged in a variety of agricultural activities: They have 6,000 square meters of citrus gardens. Harvested citruses are sold to local retailers. Also, the family has two milking cows, which give approximately 40 kg of cheese per month. The cheese is sold to local dairy products retailers. Along with the above-mentioned businesses, Gia runs beekeeping business. He has 70 beehives with bee colonies. Honey is sold on local market. Total average income of the family is 1,500 Laris per month.

Gia requested credit for expansion of the beekeeping business. He plans to purchase an additional 5-6 beehives and bee colonies. It will increase the amount of honey, and thus increase of family’s total income. 

With the increased income, Gia’s family will purchase new household goods to improve the living conditions for the children, as well as for the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase additional beehives and bee colonies.

loans.name: Karla Isabel

texts.es: Karla Isabel tiene 30 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo, ella lucha por él y por proporcionarle los ingresos como alimento, vestimenta y estudios. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta de su actividad económica pues además le proporciona los ingresos para su hogar. El financiamiento es para la compra de perfumes, tratamientos, cremas, lápiz labial, polvos, entre otros.
texts.en: Karla Isabel is 30. She sells cosmetics. She has had this business for over 3 years. She has one young child under her care. She fights for him, and to be able to offer him the necessities such as food, clothing and education. She is a very enterprising woman who benefits from this business as it provides her an income for her household. This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, treatments, creams, lip liner, and powders, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, treatments, creams, lip liner, and powders, among other items.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 56, a resident of Pasay City, in the Philippines. She is married to Juanito, a tricycle driver, and a mother of two children who already have their own families. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. 

Elvira operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. 

This is not only a typical family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 750 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more  products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elvira dreams to make this store a mini-grocery. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients needed in her business

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es: El señor Ariel se dedica al comercio de productos naturales,  su madre y su padre también se dedican a esta actividad la familia del señor Ariel vive en una zona periurbana de la ciudad, en villa fortaleza,  es soltero,  se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años indica que es una fuente de ingresos para su sustento y  para ayuda de su papa y mama y sus hermanos, el señor indica que el dinero que le otorgamos lo empleará en compra de más productos por que  tiene demanda en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de estos productos.  Cuando no logra comerciar sus productos el se dedica a la construcción es ayudante de albañil y donde también recibe un dinero extra por esta actividad, es una persona joven con deseos de superación, en un futuro le gustaría estudiar una carrera técnica,  ese es su deseo.
texts.en:
Ariel sells natural products, as does his mother and father. Ariel's family lives in the zone surrounding the city [of Santa Cruz], in Villa Fortaleza. He is single and has been involved in this economic activity for some 3 years. He says this is a source of income for his sustenance and for helping his father and mother and his brothers.

Ariel indicates that the money we loan him will be used to buy more merchandise because demand exists in the city of Santa Cruz for these products.

When Ariel is not engaged in sales, he works in construction. He is a bricklayer's helper and earns extra money for this activity. He is a young person who desires to get ahead. In the future he would like to study for a technical career – this is his desire.

loans.use: increase his capital to buy natural products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plastic bags and a variety of chili peppers.

loans.name: Luz Mila

texts.es:
Luz Mila nació en la provincia D. Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, ella tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene tres hijos. 

Luz Mila radica desD. hace varios años en la ciudad del Cusco y donD. realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a elaboración D. tejidos y platería artesanal, ella tiene un  pequeño taller y está equipada con las necesidades básicas. Ya son 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.

En esta oportunidad Luz Mila requiere el préstamo para comprar lana D. alpaca y alambre D. cobre. Su sueño D. Luz Mila es abrir una tienda donD. pueda vender sus productos.  
  
El Banco Comunal “Comuzone IV” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Luz Mila was born in the Puacartambo province in the Cusco department. Currently, Luz Mila is 48, married, and has three children.

Luz Mila settled in Cusco city several years ago. There she makes weavings and silverwork. She has a small workshop which is equipped with the basic necessities. She has had this business for seven years and it is going very well for her.

Now, Luz Mila needs this loan for the purchase of alpaca wool and copper wire. Luz Mila's dream is to open a store where she will be able to sell her products.

The “Comuzone IV” Communal Bank meets every month in Cusco city (Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristy and commercial zone, and for the traditional Inti Raymi festival. It is also known for being home to one of the seven wonders of the world: Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool and copper wire.

loans.name: Joseph Orudo

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old and married with a five month old son. He describes himself as hardworking and he provides very quick service to his customers. For the past year, Joseph has operated a poshomill service where he grinds and sells dried maize. His business is located near a quarry area. Joseph states that his biggest business challenge is insufficient capital to purchase stock. 

Joesph is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase more bags of dried maize. His business goal is to own another poshomill within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to purchase maize directly from the farmers, cutting out the intermediary.

loans.use: to purchase dried maize to grind

loans.name: Deivid

texts.es: El joven Deivid nacido en Santa Cruz, el es  soltero tiene 19 años  vive en la casa junto a sus Padres, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado la comunidad Junta Pirai, su actividad económica es servicio de transporte publico del Torno hacia la Calera con una experiencia de un año, con esta actividad el joven Deivid ayuda a sus Papas con los gastos de l hogar, es un joven muy trabajador y a pesar de su corta edad muy responsable ya que asumió asumir con la responsabilidad de cuidar a sus padres , el destino del crédito es para la compra de una moto ya que esto también le servirá como herramienta de trabajo, se siente muy agradecido con la institución por la confianza puesta en el ya que es un apoyo muy grande para el.
texts.en: Deivid, 19, was born in Santa Cruz.  He’s single and lives with his parents in their house.  He lives in the community of Junta Pirai and his activity is public transportation services on the Torno-La Calera route; he has one year’s experience.  Deivid helps out his parents with household expenses with this activity.  He’s a very hardworking young man and despite his young age is very responsible since he took on the responsibility of caring for his parents.  He will use the loan to buy a motorcycle since this too will serve as a work tool.  He feels very grateful to the institution for the trust placed in him since it’s a very big support for him.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: René Antonio

texts.es: René Antonio, reside en casa propia en la zona paracentral del país acompañado por su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa Patricia que es empleada y su hija de 12 años quien estudia sexto grado en la escuela. René posee en su misma casa de residencia un taller de enderezado y pintura de vehículos desde hace mas de 10 años, tiene dos empleados  y es muy reconocido por clientes como que trabaja muy fino y a bajo costo, esto lo distingue.  René está siendo mayormente demandado con trabajo por sus cliente en estos últimos días y es por lo que decidió apoyarse con INTEGRAL para obtener el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de pinturas, macillas y reparar un compresor que recién se fundió. Espera contar cuanto antes con el financiamiento para satisfacer la demanda y no dejar ir los negocios y así además ofrecer a su familia todo lo que hasta ahora han necesitado y seguir soñando que su pequeña hija realice sus estudios superiores en la universidad
texts.en:
René Antonio lives in his own home in the 'zona paracentral' area of the country, together with his family: his wife Patricia, who is an employee, and his 12-year-old daughter who is in sixth grade.  René has a workshop in his home where he carries out bodywork on vehicles and paints them.  He has been doing this for more than 10 years.  He has two employees and is very well known by his customers because of the very fine work that he does at a low price.  This is what he is noted for.

René has a lot of demand from his customers these days and so he decided to approach INTEGRAL to obtain the money he needs to buy a larger quantity of paints and putties, and also repair a compressor which blew recently.  He hopes to receive this loan as soon as possible so that he can meet his demand and not neglect his business.  This will allow him to continue offering his family everything they need, as he has up to now, and continue dreaming that his young daughter will go on to study at university.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of paint and putties and to repair a compressor that recently blew

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap (pictured above) and her husband, Sophal, have been married since 2006 and have one son who is in grade eight. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River, approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sopheap is a weaver, while her husband now raises cows at home. Sopheap wants to supplement her work with a new business and invest with her neighbor to grow rice, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000.The money will go towards buying seed fertilizer and pesticides to maintain the rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seed fertilizer and pesticides to maintain the rice farm.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is aged 40 and has been in farming for over 20 years. He lives with his family of four children in Murang’a, Central Kenya, where his farm produces tea, milk, poultry, and tomatoes for the local market.
James has made a loan request of 35,000 KES to help him to extend his poultry business by buying more poultry birds. He says the income will assist him in educating his children. James wants to increase his poultry birds to 5,000. He says the main challenge in farming is the high cost of of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children.  Amelita has a shop that sells fish, like sardines, & beverages . She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy fish to sell.  Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Betty Judith

texts.es: Betty comprò productos de belleza y de aseo personal en mayor volumen , con su credikiva ha logrado mejorar su organización administrativa y se han mantenido las ventas por la oferta diversa de productos y el mejoramiento de la atención de sus clientes. Su meta es capacitarse en técnicas de prestación de servicios. Con su futuro credikiva al que esta aplicando, comprará mercancías como productos de estética y aseo personal, además de hacer adecuaciones a su local. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Mil gracias y que Dios se los multiplique, todo lo que están haciendo con nosotros las microempresarios. También un agradecimiento mayúsculo a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, por este apoyo y convencimiento de que las micro y pequeñas empresas, somos una fuerza de economía que crea desarrollo.”
texts.en: Betty used her previous Kiva loan to buy beauty products and personal care products in larger quantities.  She used her loan to improve her business organization and she has maintained her sales thanks to the diverse range of products she offers and the improvements she has made to her customer service.  Her goal is to train herself in service provision.  She will use the Kiva loan that she is applying for now to buy merchandise such as beauty products and personal care products.  She will also make some changes to her premises.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: "A thousand thanks, and may God multiply them, for everything you are doing for us micro business owners.  I would really like to thank Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for their support and for their belief that micro and small business owners are an economic force who create development".

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as beauty products and personal care products, and to make some changes to her premises

loans.name: Perasuna

texts.en:
Perasuna has been practicing crop farming on his land for the last six years. He is 32-years-old, single and supports his parents.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer and be rich.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Manibessibé

texts.fr:
Manibessibe est une femme âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée å un transitaire. Elle a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 4 ans et le dernier a 1 ans.
Manibessibe travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle vend des pagnes, des mèches des casseroles et du charbon de bois pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence.
Manibessibe a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois, des mèches, des pagnes et des casseroles. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Manibessibe voudrait développer son activité en investissant dans d’autres activités. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Manibessibé is a 26-year-old woman. She is married to a freight broker. She has 2 children, one of whom goes to school. The eldest is 4 and the second one is 1.
Manibessibé has been working as a retailer since 2009. From home, she sells pagnes (traditional fabrics), hair extensions, pots, and charcoal to all kinds of customers. She buys those items in Lomé. She works alone. For the moment, her main problem is competition.
Manibessibé is applying for this first loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal, hair extensions, pagnes, and pots. She wants to reinvest in this business.
In the coming years, Manibessibé would like to expand her business by investing in other activites. With the profits, she intends on taking care of her family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, pots, traditional fabrics, and other things.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married and has two sons. She describes herself as a good and principled woman. She has been providing tailoring services for the last two years. She sells clothes such as trousers, shirts, and skirts to new and frequent customers. Her business challenge is the high cost of material used for sewing clothes. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more materials to make clothes. In the next five years, Elizabeth hopes to run a bigger dressmaking shop.

loans.use: To buy more materials for sewing.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 38 year old restaurant owner in Mariakani.  She is a married mother of three.  She has been operating the restaurant for the past twelve years with great success. 

This is Esther’s fifth business loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to renovate her restaurant and purchase more chairs and tables. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.  She hopes to excel in the business and have a happy family.

loans.use: To renovate her restaurant and purchase more chairs and tables

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
She is Petronila, 50 years old, from Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Majority of Filipinos who live in rural areas lack  financial resources to get an education for better job opportunities. But it does not deter them to be resourceful in making a living. 

Petronila is into food business. She cooks and sells banana chips. Bananas is the leading fruit grown in the Philippines and it grows many different varieties of bananas. There are bananas which are not sweet and only used for cooking like "saba" which she uses for chip-making. Her banana chips is among a favorite snack of Filipinos for its sweet and yummy taste. Now that Christmas is just around the corner, there is an increased demand of her banana chips for gift-giving.

She hopes you could lend her funds in the amount of Php 50000 to pay for several kilos of bananas, oil, sugar to make banana chips to sell and meet advanced orders. She is thanking God and you in advance for your valued help and wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas! 

Petronila wishes to undertake a big production of her banana chips so she could achieve her dream to have their own house. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for several kilos of bananas, oil, sugar to make banana chips to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is presently working with her husband to make bread, cakes, and pastries. Since she was a child, she had to work with her mother in the markets, selling vegetables, fruit, and clothes. When she got married, she didn't stop working because she had to support her husband in walking sales. Thanks to the effort of the two of them, they were able to save and bought a piece of land for their home in the Isla Trinitaria neighborhood. The business is located in their home, and they work there every day of the week from 5:00 am to 9:00 pm. In the bakery they also sell other products to go with bread such as: milk, cheese, butter, juice. Rosa also saw the opportunity to sell fast foods, so she goes out every afternoon with her cart and her stove to the corner and brings in more income for her household. Rosa wants this loan because she needs to increase her inventory to make bread. She needs certain utensils, and also wishes to renovate her display case for bread, which will certainly help them increase their income.

Rosa is 59 years old. She has one child who has already finished university. Her husband is her right hand in the business, and he has always supported her in everything. They are a family who come from the mountains, they are very humble, they were never able to go to school which is why they don't know how to read or write but they manage the accounts very well. Their charisma has helped them in dealing with people. Currently they have their house, which at first was made of cane, and bit by bit has been changed to cement. Their greatest satisfaction is to have given their daughter her education. Now she is a professional, who also helps with the business.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Rosa actualmente se dedica con su esposo hacer pan, pasteles y bocaditos, desde niña tuvo que trabajar con su madre en los mercados vendiendo legumbres, frutas, ropa; cuando se caso no dejó de trabajar porque tuvo que apoyar a su esposo en las ventas ambulantes, gracias al esfuerzo de ambos pudieron ahorrar y se compraron un terreno para su casa en la zona de la Isla Trinitaria. El negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio donde acondicionaron su local, lo atienden ambos todos los días de la semana de 5:00 AM hasta las 9:00 PM, en la panadería también venden otros productos para acompañar el pan como: leche, queso mantequilla, jugos. Rosa vio también la oportunidad de vender comida rápida, todas las tardes sale con su carreta y su fogón en la esquina de su casa, estos son otros ingresos para su hogar. Rosa desea el préstamo porque necesita incrementar su inventario para hacer el pan, y ciertos utensilios, a su vez desea renovar su vitrina exhibidora para el pan, esto les ayudara seguramente a incrementar sus ingresos.

Rosa tiene 59 años, tiene una hija que ya terminó su universidad, su esposo es su mano derecha en los negocios, siempre la ha apoyado en todo, son una familia que viene de la sierra ambos son muy humildes, nunca pudieron ir a la escuela y es así que ellos no saben leer ni escribir pero manejan muy bien las cuentas, su carisma les ha ayudado en el trato con las personas, actualmente tienen su casa que al principio fue de caña ahora poco a poco ya esta de cemento, su satisfacción más grande es haberle dado a su hija los estudios, ella ya es una profesional que también ayuda en el negocio.

loans.use: Flour and a display case

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is a mother of 4. She has 15 years of experience in trade. She has been receiving loans since July 2006. She is not only a member of the groups of entrepreneurs that receive loans, but also is responsible for timely collection of loan repayments.

Mahbuba has about $1800 in her turn over and makes $80 of profit per month. The market where she works is a wholesale market, and therefore she sells her goods not only retail but wholesale as well. She has constant clients. As she expands her business she hopes to conduct only wholesale trade. The goods she sells are mostly brought from China. She will use the next loan for new seasonal goods.

loans.use: New season goods

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr:
Born in 1955 in Lomé, Mrs. Dopé L. is married and has six children. She runs a business selling brooms and baskets. Despite her illiteracy, she has a keen sense of management and has mastered perfectly the nuts-and-bolts of her business. Due to the production of condiments on marshy land, the demand for baskets has increased, as well as the demand for brooms. She is asking for a loan of $600 to buy brooms and baskets in the villages in order to re-sell them at the market. Using the income generated by this business, Mrs. Dopé L. will be able to meet her household expenses and thus imrpove her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1955 à Lomé, Madame L. Dopé est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle exerce comme activité le commerce de balais et de paniers. Malgré son état d’analphabète, elle a un sens élevé de gestion et maîtrise parfaitement tous les rouages de son activité. Face à la production des condiments sur les espaces maraîchers, la demande en paniers s’est accrue, de même que celle de balais. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $600 pour acheter dans les villages des balais et paniers afin de les revendre sur les marchés en besoins. Des revenus de cette activité, Mme L. Dopé pourra supporter convenablement les charges de son ménage et améliorer ainsi les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell brooms and baskets

loans.name: Akoua Louise

texts.fr:
Born in Lomé on March 15, 1972, Akoua Louise Y. is married and the mother of two. She could not go far in her studies for having dropped out of middle school. She then got training to become a cashier in a local supermarket that allowed her to help with household expenses. A courageous woman who loves a job done well, she would like to improve her income and to ensure the needs of her children are met.

She thus decided to open her own grocery shop. Her project requires a fair amount of money, and so she is requesting a loan of $800 as capital for grocery items. She has a great deal of experience in this domain.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née à Lomé le 15 mars 1972, Madame Y. Akoua Louise est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfant. Elle n’a pu aller loin dans les études car elle abandonna l’école au cours secondaire. Elle alla ensuite faire une formation et devient caissière dans un super marché de la place. Ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux charges du ménage. Courageuse et aimant le travail bien fait, elle désire améliorer son revenu et assurer efficacement les besoins de ses enfants. Elle décide à cet effet d’ouvrir pour son propre compte une boutique d’alimentation générale. Ce projet nécessite assez de moyens financiers et Madame Y. Akoua Louise sollicite un crédit de $800 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle dispose d’une grande expérience dans le domaine.

loans.use: Opening a food shop

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: I am Kalsoom B. and I was born and brought up in Mian Chunnu ( a small town in Pakistan) and then moved to Multan (a mid-sized city in Pakistan) after I got married. I am the mother of five children all of whom attend school. I make and sell embroidered clothes to the nearby  markets; I have also hired afew women to help me in this business. The business yields approximately $65 a month in profit. My husband works in WAPDA (a government institution that provides electricity) as a lineman for nominal wages. My embroidered clothes are unique in design and the latest in fashion but due to a lack of resources, I cannot produce a large quantity. I need a loan of USD250 to produce more and thereby profit more. I will make savings with these extra profits and plan to buy a piece of land to construct a house on.

loans.use: Expand embroidery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock and buy a deep freezer

loans.name: Vitolina

texts.en:
Vitolina is a married woman who is 47 years old. She is a member of the Saleaumua Center. She has seven children, three of whom are now living in New Zealand. The other four still live at home with her.

Vitolina and her husband have a taro plantation. They work six days of the week. She would like another loan to buy supplies for her plantation. She will use the money that she earns to support her family, especially her school age children.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Maijuma

texts.en: Fast food in Uganda was not common to local towns in the past. However, it is becoming a better choice for a number of people, especially those traveling and others with minimum time to spend eating. The economic demands force people to utilize every minute by eating something small to keep them moving. Having seen this trend, N. started up a fast food outlet in Lugazi. She draws customers from banks, wholesale shops and travelers, since it is located near the highway to Jinja, which continues to Kenya. She prepares chips, fried chicken, samosas, sausages, and pillawo (spicy fried rice). She is a welcoming lady and knows how to handle customers. Having succeeded in the snacks business, she wants to start a salon. She believes she will use her experience to run both businesses well.

loans.use: Maijuma wants to open a salon in Lugazi

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is forty-four years old and she and her husband have two girls aged twenty-two and twenty-six years. Celestina has been selling women’s clothing and men's and women's shoes in her community for more than three years. She says that doing business is the only way she knows to lift her family from poverty. “We can’t wait for others or the government to do something for us; we have to work a lot to earn our living,” she says.

Until now, Celestina has operated her business from her house, but she plans to rent another location someday to make her goods more accessible to her customers. With her loan, Celestina will buy clothing in bulk to continue to build her business.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of clothing for sale

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru:
Sharifa A. lives in the Varzob region of Tajikistan.She is 73 years old, widowed and has 1 child. Sharifa has a high school degree and raises cattle for a living. Sharifa owns a small barn where she keeps her calves. She purchases animals at the market, fattens them and then sells for a higher price. This helps her support herself and her family. Sharifa wants to buy one more calf but for that she needs to take out a loan. Currently the prices on cattle are lower, since the animals are thinner after the winter. Sharifa has been raising cattle for the last 20 years and she is planning to pay back the credit in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Ахмедова Шарифа жительница Варзобского района. Клиентке 73 лет , вдова имеет 1 детей. Образование среднее.Зарабатывает клиентка путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота.Имеет небольшой коровник ,в котором имеются бычки.Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на рынках по более выгодной цене. Это помогает обеспечивать семью.Но клиентка хочет купить дополнительно еще одного бычка, но для этого клиентке нужно получить кредит.Именно сейчас покупка бычка может быть выгодна , так как после зимы животные исхудавшие , продаются по низим ценам. Занимается этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 20 лет. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Pacesa

texts.es:
Ms. Pacesa T. rents a house on Manuel Cofre Street in the Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz. She has been legally separated from her husband for 13 years and has a 15-year-old daughter. Pacesa has been working as a housekeeper at a home in the southern area of La Paz for many years.

She is requesting this loan in order to continue paying for her daughter’s English lessons. This way, her daughter will have more opportunities to succeed in life.

She has good credit history, which approves her for a new loan. She has been our customer since 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Pacesa vive en alquiler en la calle Manuel Cofre de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; está separada del esposo hace 13 y años tiene una hija de 15 años. Pacesa trabaja como empleada domestica por varios años en una casa ubicada en la zona Sur de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito que solicita es para continuar pagando los cursos de ingles de su hija. De esta manera la hija tendrá mayores posibilidades de triunfar en la vida.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Es cliente nuestra desde el año 2007.

loans.use: Continue paying for her daughter’s English lessons

loans.name: Bichitos Group

texts.es:
Sr. Cesar is 30 years old, married, and has three young children. His wife helps him sell clothing so that he can travel into the interior of the country to make sales. (He goes to the small towns of Los Yungas.) Their home is rented, and the family’s sole source of income is generated by this business. It is located on the main street of the busy business area. He is a good member of the organisation.

50 year-old Sra. Ines is married and has two children in a state high school. Her husband works with her. She lives in her sister’s house which has only three rooms. She also is an excellent member of the organisation. Her sales booth is located in the main square of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El sr. Cesar tiene 30 años de edad, casado, tiene tres hijos pequeños la esposa le ayuda en la venta de ropa ya que él viaja a vender al interior (Los pueblos que están ubicados en los Yungas). La vivienda es alquilada, el único ingreso que tiene es el que le genera ese negocio el cual está ubicado en la avenida principal de una zona comercial de gran afluencia. E s buen cliente .

La Sra. Ines es casada tiene 50 años de edad, con dos hijos que están en secundaria en colegio estatal. El esposo le ayuda trabaja juntamente con la ella. Vive en la casa de su hermana, ocupa solamente 3 habitaciones. Es excelente cliente, su puesto de venta esta ubicado en la Plaza principal de la ciudad de La Paz

loans.use: To increase capital and provide a wider range of merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for a small restaurant

loans.name: Los Robles Group

texts.es:
Hi.  We're the Los Robles ("The Oaks") group.  We're merchants, each with his or her own small business which we operate personally.  Thanks to these businesses, we can help our families get ahead and provide higher standards of living for our children.  Given the economic situation of our country, which is becoming more difficult by the day, we have to make our own work and that's why we're looking for help to fund our businesses.  We now need small supplies of goods for our businesses so that we can offer our customers a range of products and, in turn, increase our incomes.  After all, more inventory means more sales.

MIGUEL AGEL D..  My main business is buying and selling produce.  I work as a street vendor, selling my products in the various neighborhoods of our city.  I have several years' experience at this.  I am married and I have 3 children who help me in their spare time.

HUMBERTO R..  I operate a small general store in the center of my neighborhood.  I have several years' experience at this and I've built a good customer base.  I'm a senior citizen.  I'm asking you to help me fund stocks of goods for my business.

VENTURA DE JESUS M..  I operate a small general store at my house.  The business allows me to take care of my husband and children and earn an income to help with family expenses at the same time.  I have two high school-aged children.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
hola nosotros somos el grupo Los Robles, todos somos comerciantes cada uno cuenta con pequeños negocios, los que son administrados personalmente, gracias a estos negocios podemos sacar adelante a nuestras familias y asi poder ofrecer a nuestros hijos un mejor nivel de vida.
