Tomando en cuenta  que la situacion economica del pais cada dia es mas dificil por lo que decidimos trabajar y por tal razon buscamos financiamiento para nuestros negocios.  Actualmente necesitamos surtir un poco mas y asi poder ofrecer a nuestros clientes variedad de productos logrando asi mejorar nuestros ingresos ya que a mayor surtido mayor venta.

MIGUEL AGEL D..  Mi actividad principal  la compra y venta de verduras, las que distribuyo
de  manera ambulante en las diferentes comunidades aledañas a nuestra ciudad. Tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad,  soy casado y tengo 3 hijos los que me colaboran en su tiempo libre.

HUMBERTO R. soy comerciante cuento con una pequeña pulperia hubicada en el centro 
de mi comunidad tengo varios años de experiencia y tengo muy buena clientela soy de la tercera edad y en esta oportunidad estamos solicitando nos apoyen con capital para poder surtir mas mi negocio

VENTURA DE JESUS M. mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con una pulperia en mi casa de habitacion, la que me permite atender esposo e hijos y a la vez puedo generar ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia tengo dos hijos los que estan cursando educacion secundaria.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Lucy's Food Store Group

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has 3 children, ages 2, 7 and 12. She has owned her own food store since 2007. Every day, she begins work at 6AM and finishes at 7PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $40.

Joyce is now requesting a loan in order to buy more items, such as maize and flour. She will also share her loan with her current subgroup members, who have various businesses such as clothing stores and salons.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: El

texts.en: El S., 56, is a widowed farmer who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She grows rice, corn, beans, and peanuts. Normally, she makes US$4 each day. Planting has been difficult, because the weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. She needs a water pump and fertilizer to help her plantation. She is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase the pump and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kupaysin

texts.ru:
Абдуллоева Купайсин, 1951 года рождения. Она начала свой бизнес с продажи женских платьев. Сейчас ее ассортимент товаров увеличился, это разновидность токи (национальные головные уборы), махси (национальные сапоги). Свой товар она закупает у поставщиков из Коканда и продает на Центральном рынке Гисарского района.
С помощью программы Кива хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони для закупа головных уборов.
texts.en:
Kupaysin A. was born in 1951. She started her own business by selling women's dresses. Right now she has a wider selection of merchandise she offers such as different types of toka (Tajik national headdresses) and mahsi (national boots). She buys the merchandise from suppliers in Kokand and sells on the Central market of the Gisar region. With the help of Kiva she wants to get a loan for 3,000 somoni (USD$900) to buy more headdresses.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy headdresses

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 35 años, es soltera, vive en una casa en calidad de cuidadora. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas de forma ambulatoria, desde hace ya 5 años, en un primer momento trabajando para otras personas, pero gracias a su empeño y en base a mucho trabajo, hace un año ha logrado contar con su propio puesto de venta de golosinas, negocio que es su único sustento económico.
La venta usualmente es buena, dándole a María buenas ganancias, pero muchas veces el tener que pasarse todo el día vendiendo sus golosinas le resulta muy cansado, pero las ganas de salir adelante y progresar son mucho mayores que esas pequeñas vicisitudes, haciendo que Maria ejerza su oficio con mucha alegría y fe en el futuro. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma.  Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más golosinas para vender y así obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old, is single, and lives in a house as a caretaker. She has worked selling sweets as a traveling salesperson for 5 years, at first working for other people, but thanks to her effort and based on a lot of work a year ago she was able to have her own stand for the sale of sweets, a business which is her only economic support. The sales usually are good, giving Mara good earnings, but many times having to spend the entire day selling her sweets she ends up very tired. But her desire to get ahead and progress is much greater than these small vicissitudes, making Maria exercise her job with much happiness and faith in the future. This is her first loan with Prisma Microfinance. With the money from the loan she will buy more sweets to sell and through this obtain greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of sweets that she sells

loans.name: Santos Domingo

texts.es: El señor Santos Domingo Hernández tiene la edad de 53 años de edad, habita en el barrio Palestina ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que ella vende frutas y verduras en el oriental, ellos tiene  a su cargo tres hijos, los planes de don Santos es mejorar los cultivo para tener mayor productividad. El tiene veintiocho  años trabajando como agricultor con sus propios esfuerzo y el de su esposa han logrado mantener los cultivos  piña, con la solicitud del préstamo la quiere para invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos y venenos para los cultivos de piña
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Domingo H. is 53 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Palestina located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He works with his wife to pay the household expenses. She sells fruits and vegetables in the east. Together they care for their 3 children. Mr. Santos plans to improve their crops to have higher productivity. He has been working as a farmer for 28 years and with his own effort he and his wife have maintained a pineapple crop. With the loan he wants to invest in agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides for the pineapple crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Maryam Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Maryam baji is a 45 year old married lady who lives in Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She lived there for the past 30 years. She is an uneducated lady because of her father’s lack of financial resources. Her husband's name is A. S., and he is an electrician by profession. He has 20 years of experience in this business. Most people call on him to repair fans and other electrical items. She is the mother of four kids: three daughters and one son. Her son and her elder daughter read in 10th standard. Her next daughter is in 8th standard, and her younger daughter is in 5th standard. Maryam baji has a milk selling business which she handles independently. She does this work to improve the financial situation of her family and pay the school fees for her kids. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk selling business. 

She is a group leader of some more women. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Seema baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle named “Shahzore”. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Salma baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: Jubril

texts.en:
Jubril A. is 44 years old and married with a child. He lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. Jubril prints and publishes books. He hopes to expand his business and needs a loan in the amount of 50,000 naira (USD$350) to purchase more printing materials.

Jubril says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more printing materials.

loans.name: Tochi

texts.ru: Бобочонова Точи успешно закончив свой очередной займ хочет снова получить кредит.Она своевременно погашала свои погашения.Займы помогли ей увеличить оборотный капитал.Благодаря этому она смогла в этом году устроить свою дочь в университет.Также у неё улучшилось семейное положение.
texts.en:
Tochi B. just successfully repaid her last loan and wants to obtain new credit. She timely repaid all her previous loans. The loans helped her to increase return profits. Thanks to this, Tochi has been able to enroll her daughter in a university. Her family situation has also improved.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of towels and table clothes

loans.name: Evgeniy

texts.en:
Evgeniy is married with one son. He sells clothing at the market in Melitopol city. Evgeniy has been self employed for 7 years, working at different types of jobs - driving taxis and selling various products. Finally, Evgeniy decided to sell clothing because it generates the most income.

Evgeniy would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase his inventory. He would use the additional income to improve his family's living conditions. He and his wife dream of selling their one room apartment and buying a bigger home

.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Teresa Vicenta

texts.es: La señora Teresa Y., casada de 43 años de edad, se dedica a le venta ropa típica, en el municipio de San Francisco el Alto, San Cristóbal y Totonicapán, debido a la demanda que tiene, es necesario de ampliar su capital,  por lo que solicita a la Asociación ASDIR un crédito para la compra de mas ropas típicas ya que con ello podrá comerciar mas productos y tendrá surtido el negocio. La cual la persona podrá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa Y., is married and is 43 years old. She sells traditional clothing in the municipality of San Francisco el Alto, San Cristóbal and Totonicapán. Due to the demand, it is necessary to increase her capital, for that reason she is requesting a loan from the ASDIR Association to buy more traditional clothing since she can trade it for more products and have a variety of merchandise for her business. She will be able to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce (increase capital)

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Сокиев Фируз проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 23 года . Холост. Живет с родителями.Кроме них в семье живут брат со своей семьей. Семья большая. фируз работает в своей столовой , которая находится на периферии между городом Душанбе и Вахдат.Работает там уже около трех лет. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить продукты питания. Сделав запас продуктов длительного хранения ,он сможет обеспечить клиентов большим ассортиментом предлагаемых блюд.
texts.en:
Firuz S. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 23 years old and not married. He lives with parents. Besides him his brother with his wife also live in their big family. Firuz works in his eatery which is located in the periphery between Dushanbe and Vahdat. He has been working there for about three years. He plans to get a loan to buy food stuffs. By stocking up with food for long term storage he will be able to provide his customers with a bigger variety of dishes.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria Y. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijos, ya que es madre soltera.
La señora Gregoria es cocinera, vendiendo almuerzos en la parada de transporte publico de su zona. Ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
Con el crédito anterior realizo la construcción de dos habitaciones en obra gruesa.
El crédito solicitado es para la conclusión de la construcción de las habitaciones que proporcionarán a su familia de ambientes adecuados para su diario vivir.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Gregoria Y. is a single mother who lives in her own house with her two children, in the Pasankeri neighborhood on the west side of the city of La Paz. She is a cook and she sells lunches at the transit stop in her neighborhood. With her earnings, she is able to support her family. She used her previous loan for the rough construction of two bedrooms. This loan request is to finish the construction of these rooms and to furnish them with the basic necessities for her family's everyday life. This is the second time that they have sought a loan. The socio-economic analysis provided reflects favorably on them and they will be approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of two bedrooms in her house in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Bareaa

texts.en:
Bareaa is a 46 year old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon with her husband and their child.  Bareaa works as a seamstress.  She specializes in wedding and long dresses.  She requested a loan for 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to buy thread and accessories for her work.  She also wants to purchase a television for her house. This is Bareaa's first loan request.
 
Bareaa is special in her work because she does it well.  Her clients are wedding shops.  When she first started her business, she had difficulty building a network. Bareaa decided on doing her business because of her previous experience.

loans.use: Bareaa will use the loan to buy thread and accessories for work, along with purchasing a television for her house.

loans.name: Armando Salomão

texts.pt:
Armando Salomão N.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material de construção  
Montante de Empréstimo: 10,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Armando de 46 anos nasceu na cidade de Maputo, estudou até sexta classe. Casado e pai de cinco filhos dos quais três são maiores e dois menores. Para além da esposa e filhos sustenta uma irmã estudante.
É alfaiate de profissão e é proprietário de uma alfaiataria e têm empregado duas pessoas.
Tem um rendimento liquido mensal de 5,000.00MT.
É segundo empréstimo com HLUVUKU e já vinha trabalhando com Procredit, mas acabou abandonando pela distancia entre sua residência e este banco de micro finanças que acarretava mais custos.
Com o empréstimo pretende melhorar as condições de habitabilidade da família e sonha solicitar outro empréstimo para equipar sua casa.
texts.en:
Armando, 46 years old, was born in the city of Maputo and attended school until sixth grade. He is married and is a father of five children, of whom three have reached the age of majority and two are minors. In addition to his wife and children, he provides for a sister who is a student. Armando is a tailor by profession, the owner of a tailor shop with two employees. He has a monthly liquid income of 5,000 MT. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. He used to deal with Procredit, but he wound up discontinuing that because of the expenses incurred due to the distance between his home and that microfinancing bank. With this loan, he plans to improve living conditions for his family, and he dreams of requesting another loan to furnish his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material to build family home.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice F. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Since 1999 Alice has sold groceries and gari, a flour that she prepares herself by processing milled cassava. Her business is based at Kormantse, near Cape Coast. Alice uses her income for feeding her family and paying the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more groceries for her store and cassava for processing into gari. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alice plans to take care of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her store and cassava for processing into gari

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita D., 66, is one of the pioneering members of the CCT Credit Cooperative in Caloocan-5. She owns a glass and aluminum fabrication workshop along the national highway of Malaria, Caloocan City. She has been a widow for years and lives with her youngest son and a granddaughter. She is shown in the picture above with her son and an employee.

She has been in this business since 1975 and started with just a small space in Tondo, Manila. When her family moved to Malaria, Caloocan in 1981, her customers continued to work with her because of the good quality of her work. Her clients know Lucita as a loyal and friendly business person. She gets good contracts with large construction companies for setting up aluminum and glass windows for commercial buildings. She recently hired three glass setters to meet the growing demands of her clients.

She has applied for a loan of P 30,000 to purchase additional aluminum railings, glass panels, rubber sidings and a stockpile of adhesives for her growing number of projects. She looks forward to employing more people in her aluminum and glass supply store, which is a strong provider of jobs in the community. Lucita believes in giving back her blessings to the community.

CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions. www.cct.org.ph

loans.use: Additional supplies of glass, aluminum, rubber and adhesives

loans.name: Elza

texts.es: Elza tiene 53 años, como madre, sola tuvo que educar a sus 5 hijos, a quienes trató de ofrecer las mejores condiciones de vida. Desde joven trabajó en múltiples actividades, ahora se dedica a la venta de dulces en la puerta de su casa. Sus hijos ya son mayores, entonces ahora sólo requiere lo necesario para sus necesidades personales. Esta actividad le viene respondiendo de manera favorable, ya que su domicilio está ubicado en una de las avenidas más transitadas de su comunidad. Aprovechando esta concurrencia, Elza desea instalar un puesto de comida en la esquina de su casa, donde las personas ya están acostumbradas a visitar, para ello trabajaría durante todo el día, ya que la venta de dulces sólo la realiza por las tardes, cuando los escolares salen de sus centros de estudios; pero con el puesto de comida tendría la posibilidad de incrementar sus ganancias diarias. Es así que sus deseos de progresar la motivan a seguir trabajando como hasta el día de hoy. Lleva 5 años trabajando con MFP, donde ya tiene 9 préstamos y lo que más le gusta es el entusiasmo y compromiso que hay en cada una de sus compañeras por salir adelante y ver el progreso de su banco comunal. Los 1500 soles que solicita le permitirán adquirir los productos e ingredientes necesarios para seguir trabajando en su negocio y para la pronta posibilidad de tener su puesto de comida.
texts.en:
Elza is 53 years old and is a mother who educated her five children and always tried to offer them the best possible living conditions. Since she was very young, she has worked in a variety of activities, and she is now selling sweets from the door of her home. Her children are now adults, so she only needs to earn enough to pay for her personal needs. This business has been going quite well, since her home is located on one if the busiest streets in her community. Elza wants to take advantage of the location by opening a food stand at the corner near her house, where people are already used to stopping by. She currently only sells sweets in the afternoons, since that's when children get out of school, but she plans to start working all day long selling food in order to increase her daily income. Her desire to get ahead in life inspires her to keep working as she has up to this point. She has been working with Microfinanzas Prisma for five years now, and has already taken out 9 previous loans. Her favorite part is the enthusiasm and commitment displayed by her fellow group members to getting ahead and seeing the group make progress. The requested loan of 1,500 soles will allow her to buy the products and ingredients necessary to continue selling sweets, and open up the possibility of starting her own food stand soon.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make sweets

loans.name: Tobietha

texts.en:
Tobietha is a member of the maendeleo borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 12,7 and 3 years.she also cares for other 3 dependents.

Tobietha started her own food business selling fruits and vegetable 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 450,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Tobietha second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more fruits and vegetable.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Tobietha hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To ensure schooling costs are covered for his children

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Jacinta es casada, tiene 60 años y 6 hijos, Jacinta viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas, lanas y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Jacinta necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada.
Los sueños de Jacinta son construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de trigo, cebada.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: M. Vincent has four small children and he is a widower. He is 46 years old and specializes in farming as a business. He started this business in 2006 after he lost his job with a security firm. His main priority is to educate his children since he, himself, never got a chance to go to school. M. requires a loan of 20,000 shillings which he plans to use to expand his farming area in preparation for the oncoming season. It is his priority to make sure his children get the best of education and life.

loans.use: To expand and prepare farming area and restock seeds

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is fifty years old. He is married and has seven children who are all in school. Joseph lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. Joseph is a trader. For four years he has been trading in cereals – maize. He supplies to food vendors in his community and also sells at the market square. Joseph also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. He buys his goods from nearby towns. He is requesting a loan of $500 so he can buy larger quantities of maize in bulk and earn more profit for his efforts.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Liily

texts.en: Liily is 25 years old, single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Liily has been a trader in artificial hair for the last three years. She sells it from a shed in the community's market square, and also treks to other communities to sell on their market days. She also supplies artificial hair to hairdressers in her community. Liily wants a loan facility to procure goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair in bulk

loans.name: Jean Nepomuscene

texts.en:
Jean Nepomuscene is 23 years old and is married with one child who is six months old. He lives in the Gicumbi district which is in the Northern Province of Rwanda, approximately a one hour drive from Kigali, the capital city.

Jean Nepomuscene has been a proven entrepreneur using a motorcycle-taxi since 2006. He works very hard at his business - the hours he operates his job are from early in the morning until late in the night every day of the week. He enjoys his job as he serves his community through transporting them to and from the border between Rwanda and Uganda where many entrepreneurs go to purchase different goods for sale.

After realizing that motorcycle-taxis are still in short supply in this area and that they are so useful to entrepreneurs, Jean Nepomuscene had the idea of purchasing a second motorcycle to rent to others for them to earn a living so that he can make a profit as well. He thinks like a true entrepreneur!

In order to purchase this motorcycle, Jean Nepomuscene is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. With this second motorcycle, he will create another job for one person and above that, he will increase his monthly profit as well. With this profit,he will create some other sources of income which will help him to save the money needed to build the house he has dreamed of owning for many years.

loans.use: To buy another moto-taxi

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth Rodríguez es una mujer dinámica y optimista, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 57 años, madre soltera de 6 hijos, de los cuales cuatro son mayores de edad. Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de golosinas, actividad que realiza en su casa. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fuè 300.00 nuevos soles que invirtió en la compra de golosinas. 
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1200.00 nuevos soles que invertirá en golosinas e ingredientes, ya que vende menús en el colegio Santa Rosa. 
La meta de Elizabeth es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida y seguir mejorando económicamente.
texts.en:
Elizabeth R. is a dynamic and optimistic woman. She lives in the district of Manantay, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 57 and is a single mother of 6 children, four of whom are adults. Elizabeth works from her home selling candies. She has been involved with the “Las Divinas” Community Bank for two years. The first credit she received was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she invested in buying candies. Now she needs a credit of 1200 Peruvian soles to invest in candies and ingredients, because she also sells prepared meals at Santa Rosa School. Elizabeth's goal is to expand her food sales business and continue to better he economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will invest one part of the loan in candies and the other part in ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna G. is from the village of Linabo. She is 55 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Edna owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling ready-to-wear clothes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Vanessa Claire

texts.en:
A seaman’s wife with a passion for cooking and food processing is our featured entrepreneur in this story. She is Mrs. Vanessa Claire L., 29 years of age, married and a resident of Maloro, Tangub City. They were blessed with two children, one who is now three years old and the other only nine months. 

Vanessa is skilled at cooking, so she decided to open a restaurant at the city food court. At the same time, she provides catering services for birthdays, weddings, anniversaries and other occasions. 

For her, it is better to earn on her own rather than depending on her husband’s allotment every month. For seven years she has been able to manage her business, and now she is earning an average net income of not less than $220 a month. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC two years ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and in our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao. Paglaum MPC received an award for being the Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006. 

As a 5th cycle loaner, Vanessa has the privilege of borrowing 50,000 PHP to add to her capital for her eatery business and catering services. She is hoping that her business will continue to prosper. She is also happy that she was able to give employment to jobless friends and relatives.

loans.use: Additional capital for her eatery business and catering services

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia E. is 59 years old and a member of ASHI. She lives with her daughter, son in-law, and two grandchildren in one of the villages of the remote municipality of Pandan in the Antique province. As a mother, Eufemia’s dream in life is simple. She did not receive a formal education, but she has truly rich dreams. When her daughter was young, she dreamed of sending her to college, so she could graduate and have a better career. However, because of poverty she cannot blame her daughter for deciding to not pursue her own education. Instead of being upset and frustrated, Eufemia continuously supports her daughter and her family, hoping that her grandchildren will have a better life than what their mother had.

Now that Eufemia has joined ASHI, she is requesting her second loan, so that she can continue to grow the hog-fattening business she started with her first loan. After raising her hogs for four months, she will sell them, and the larger the hogs are, the higher price per kilo of pork she will receive and the greater the profit she will earn. She will then be able to achieve her dream little by little.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for her fattening business

loans.name: Unidos Para El Exito Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL UNIDOS PARA EL ÉXITO
La Alcancía Comunal “Unidos para el éxito” está representado por la señora Vilma y conformado por 10 miembros los cuales son muy emprendedores y trabajadores. Todos cuentan con negocios propios, algunos en sus domicilios y otros en el mercado.

Como es el caso D. la Sra. Carmen, ella se dedica a la venta D. menú hace 3 años, pero eso no es suficiente para ella así que por las noches venD. salchipapas y pollo broaster en la puerta D. su casa. Con la ganancia pueD. aportar con los gastos familiares, ya que está separada D. su esposo, y tiene 2 hijos que mantener.

La presidenta Sra. Vilma se esfuerza por mantener su bodega D. abarrotes y salir adelante, es una persona muy responsable y comprometida con el grupo. Ella tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales solo 1 está bajo su cuidado. Con el préstamo obtenido podrá comprar algunos productos que  necesite para atender a sus clientes.

Hilda se dedica a la venta D. gaseosas y dulces en su casa, además para obtener ganancias extras aprendió manualidades y venD. tejidos a crochet como son carteras zapatos y otros productos a elección del cliente.

Este grupo es muy unido y solidario ya que son personas muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante; es por eso que los préstamos recibido lo invertirán en la compra D. productos e insumos que les permitan brindar una buena atención a sus clientes.
Todos los integrantes están agradecidos a EDAPROSPO Y KIVA por la confianza brindada al otorgarles créditos.
texts.en:
ALCANCIA COMMUNAL UNITED FOR SUCCESS The Communal bank "United for the success" is represented by the lady Vilma and consists of 10 members which are very enterprising and industrious. They all have their own businesses, some in their residences and others in the market. In the case of Señora Carmen, she has been dedicated to the sale of foods for 3 years, but that is not sufficient for her so at nights she sells salchipapas (a native dish with sausage and fried potatoes) and roast chicken in the door of her house. With the profits she can contribute to the family expenses, since she is separated from her husband and has 2 children to maintain. The president, Señora Vilma endeavors to maintain her convenience store and do well. She is a very responsible person and works well with the group. She has 5 children of which only 1 is under her care. With the loan she obtains, she will be able to buy some products that she needs to serve her clients. Hilda is dedicated to the sale of carbonated drinks and candies in her house. In addition, to obtain extra profits she learned handicrafts and sells crocheted items such as handbags, shoes and other products at the choice of the client. This group very is united and supportive since they are very hard-working people with many desires to do well. That is why the loans they receive will be invested in the purchase of products and supplies that permit them to offer good service to their clients. All the members are thankful to EDAPROSPO AND KIVA for the confidence shown them in giving them loans.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for resale, such as foods and supplies for making handicrafts

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a dos de sus cuatro hijos en el sector Collique Alto del distrito de Zaña, una zona rural que vive de la agricultura y que está ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde que tenía 18 años de edad a la crianza y venta de animales. Cuando empezó a vivir junto a su esposo, este negocio pasó a ser una fuente importante de ayuda para sostener la economía de la familia, ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no bastan para sustentarlos.

Maria Esther suele criar pavos, patos y cerdos en la parte posterior de su vivienda y los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona regularmente. Su cría ha aumentado y los corrales están quedando pequeños para los animales que actualmente tiene, por ello es que ella desea ampliar sus corrales, pero como no posee el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María Esther es uan mujer entregada a su familia y a su pequeño negocio. Su mayor anhelo es poder seguir adelante para apoyar a su esposo y brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
María Esther is a mother, 45 years old, who lives with her husband and two of her four children in the Collique Alto sector of the Zaña district, a rural area where people make their living in agriculture, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Since she was 18 years old, María Esther has worked raising and selling animals. When she moved in with her husband, this business became an important contribution to the family's economic support, since her husband works as an agricultural laborer and his income does not suffice to maintain the family. Maria Esther usually raises turkeys, ducks and pigs in the area behind her house, and she sells them to traders who regularly visit the area. The numbers of animals she is raising has increased, and the pens are becoming too small for the animals she currently has. For this reason, she would like to expand her pens, but since she does not have sufficient capital to undertake this project, she has found it necessary to request a loan for the first time. She is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1200 Peruvian new soles, which will help her achieve her goal. María Esther is a woman who is devoted to her family and to her small business. Her greatest desire is to get ahead so that she can help her husband and give her children the opportunity to have a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her animal pens

loans.name: Nawuli

texts.en:
Nawuli M. is currently in the business of selling and brewing local alcohol and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials like yeast, pipes, etc to brew more alcohol.  Nawuli is 40 years old and is a widow. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a family house and pay the school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more brewing materials

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius M. M. is seventy years old. He is married and has been blessed with eight children. His business is located in the entrance of the busy jogoo market in Nairobi. He sells soft drinks to the people who have businesses within jogoo market and also walk-ins who come in to shop from the market. 

He has been in this business for the last forty-seven years and he says that this kind of business also needs to be marketed. He is using his loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more soft drinks to sell to people and expand his business. He does not plan to change this business as it it something he has grown to love doing. He is hardworking, humble, and ambitious.

loans.use: Soft drinks

loans.name: Eyirba

texts.en: A. Eyirba sells spices and soap, she sells by going from one house to the other in and around Akotokyire.  A. has received junior high education.  She is married to a carpenter and has two children.  A. has been selling spices and soap for about a year now. She helps her husband in feeding the entire family. Her loan will be used to buy other soaps and spices for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build on a piece of land inherited from the family.

loans.use: buy other soaps and spices for sale

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
El señor Benedicto tiene 47 años de edad se encuentra casado con la señora Martina López tiene tres hijos uno de 15 años el otro de 18 años y el ultimo de 10 años de edad, viven en la comunidad de Kuluyo de la provincia de Sacaba de la ciudad de Cochabamba él es agrícola ya hace como 20 años el trabaja junto con su esposa en sembrar diferentes tubérculos como papa  la oca como también verduras entre ellos arvejas y habas.

Benedicto es un persona muy trabajadora el de niño tuvo una vida muy difícil al ser el mayor de cinco hermanos tuvo que sacarlos adelante a todos  ya que cuando eran niños su padre murió en un accidente en el trabajo (albañil) se cayó de la construcción de un edificio y la madre se volvió alcohólica   al encontrarse sola con sus hijos , Benedicto se puso a trabajar y a ayudar a sus hermanos el dejo la escuela  no podía trabajar en el campo con los sembradíos de sus familiares y los de su padre y estudiar ya que la escuela del pueblo solo funcionaba en la mañana .

Benedicto solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas porque ya empezara la época de la cosecha de papa y otras verduras, el necesita comprar las semillas y el abono que es especial para la cosecha  y de esa manera el tendrá más ingresos, porque su esposa al mismo tiempo se dedica a la producción de quesillo que lo realiza para poder vender en el pueblo, porque ellos trabajan de esta manera para que sus hijos puedan tener una vida mejor  puedan terminar el colegio y hasta poder realizar alguna carrera Benedicto sueña con que su  hija pequeña pueda estudiar para ser profesora y poder ayudar a los niños que viven con padres alcohólicos como un día fue él y así no dejaran esos niños de estudiar  y tendrán un futuro mejor el está muy orgulloso de su familia y de sus esposa porque ella siempre la va apoyando en todo momento y cuidad a su familia que es lo más importante.
texts.en:
Benedicto is 47 years old and is married to Martina Lopez with whom he has three children who are 10, 15, and 18 years old. They live in the Kuluyo community in the Sacaba province of the city of Cochabamba. He has worked in agriculture for the past 20 years; he works with his wife growing crops like potatoes, peas, and beans. Benedicto is a hard-working person who has had a difficult life since he was a child; he was the oldest of 5 children and he had to take care of his family after the death of his father. His father worked in construction and passed away when a building fell on top of him; Benedicto's mother became an alcoholic after being widowed with her 4 children. Benedicto started to work and he left school to help his siblings; he couldn't work in the fields and study at the same time because the school only ran in the mornings. Benedicto is seeking a loan to buy seeds as planting season for potatoes and vegetables is approaching; he needs to buy seeds and fertilizer which will help his crops and improve his income. His wife works making cheese which she sells in the town. They both work hard so that their children can have a better life, finish school and hopefully find better work in the future. Benedicto dreams of helping his young daughter to study to become a teacher who can help teach the children of alcoholic parents--just as he used to be. In this way, these kids won't have to stop studying and will have a better future. He is very proud of his family and of his wife because she is always supporting him; taking care of his family is the most important thing in his life.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 20 años se dedica al comercio de alfalfa. Para lograr su labor  arrienda terrenos cultivados de alfalfa  y extrae el producto, que luego comercializa a  los vendedores de alfalfa, al por menor, su trabajo diario consiste en extraer y repartir la alfalfa entre sus clientes  y sus hijos la ayudan, durante sus ratos libres. Este negocio le ha permitido  tener un ingreso beneficioso  para su familia porque es un producto  muy demandado por su comunidad ya que vive en una zona rural. Para mas adelante  desea  incrementar su capital de trabajo para arrendar más  terrenos cultivados.Es la octava oportunidad que tiene un crédito con  MFP, y promete ser  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Lourdes tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de más extensiones de terrenos cultivados de alfalfa y así espera continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and their two children in her own house. She has worked in the alfalfa business for 20 years. To do her work she rents alfalfa fields and gathers the product. She later sells it to people who sell alfalfa at retail prices. Her daily work consists of getting the alfalfa and delivering it to her customers. Her children help her during their free time. This business has allowed her to have income, which is beneficial to her family. It is a product in much demand in her community because she lives in a rural area. Later on she wants to increase her working capital to rent more cultivated land. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She promises to be very responsible with her payments. She is also grateful to all of the people who made the loan possible. It will be very useful to the progress of her business. Lourdes plans to use the requested money to buy a larger expanse of cultivated alfalfa land. That is the way she plans to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hectares of alfalfa land

loans.name: Kashi

texts.en: Kashi A. C. is a married woman with four children who do not attend school because she cannot afford to pay pay their school fees. Her husband is old and can’t help her in raising their children. Kashi has been selling food, mainly dumplings made of flour, in an open air market just outside her house for the past ten years. This  business is her only source of income. Her major business challenge includes seasonality as she says that she cannot sell at the open air market during rainy seasons. She hopes one day that her business will grow and support her family comfortably.  She owns a home with electricity but no piped water. Her major expenses are high food costs.She is requesting a  KShs 40,000 loan to buy wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: Toy  buy a sack of wheat flour, 20 litres of cooking oil and 50kgs of sugar

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Fuad A. is 22 years old, a passionate young man who is engaged in cattle breeding. He has been running his business since 2009 and thanks to the best practice of his father, he learned very fast how to properly look after animals. He breeds calves, fattens them, and sells them to butcher shops and in the livestock bazaar. Fuad has applied for 500 AZN to purchase two calves.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou S. est une femme de 51 ans, elle est veuve et vis avec ses deux enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a 06 fois de suite reçu de crédit qu'elle a bien géré et remboursé à temps. Elle développe un petit restaurant dans son village où elle sert régulièrement les repas du jour. Son prêt lui permettra de mieux s'approvisionner en denrées afin de développer son activité de restauration et de fidéliser sa clientèle. Son objectif est de répondre aux besoins de santé, de nourriture, de vêtement de sa progéniture et pouvoir se prendre en charge tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Aïssatou S. is a 51 year old widow with two children. She is a member of the Village Bank of KANDIA since June 1, 2007 and has since borrowed six times, and with good management has repaid on time. She is developing a small restaurant in her village where it serves daily meals. The loan will allow her to better supply food products in order to develop the restaurant activity and retain customer loyalty. Her objective is to meet the needs for health, food, clothing of her offspring all the while maintaining her level of savings.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capital

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy V. is from the town of Banga. She is 33 years old. Cristy is married and has 2 children aged six and two. To make a living, Cristy owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is from planting and harvesting rice, which she later sells. She hopes to grow her farming business and raise pigs. Cristy has been farming for over 8 years.

A few years back, she opened a sari-sari store to generate daily income. She says she is very thankful to have the store because it helps her to meet her daily needs.

Cristy joined CEVI to access financial services so she can improve her business and living situation. Cristy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Cristy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She also plans to purchase piglets to raise.

This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cristy from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds. She also plans to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey P. (shown in the photo), 34, and her husband, Mr. Sochea Tep, 38, have been married since 1996 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. All of them are attending school. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Srey has been a silk weaver for 21 years. Her husband has been driving a motor taxi for 2 years. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $300 to purchase silk material for her business.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Kejiyo

texts.en: Kejiyo A. sells cooking oil, beans, simsim, and rice at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and beans to sell.  Kejiyo is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has four children, and her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo tiene 46 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la ceja de la selva peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa. A Máximo siempre le ha gustado sobresalir en cualquier actividad que se le presente, es así que cultiva café, ya que en el valle donde vive, crece de manera natural, además por ser uno de los productos que mayor demanda tiene en el mercado y por tal aprovechó para dedicarse a este negocio. Se siente contento por las buenas ganancias que le genera y eso le favorece para la manutención de su familia. Otro de los negocios que también se dedica es la producción y comercialización de piña, de esa manera diversifica ante sus demás competidores. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposa, sin embargo cuando es temporada de sembrío y cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones, que le ayudan en la extracción de su producto final, siendo estos vendidos en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción de café y piña con la necesidad de que pueda apalear futuras demandas y de esa manera tenga un posicionamiento fuerte en esta actividad. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además está contento con su banco comunal, debido al buen desempeño de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café y piña, para ello adquirirá insumos y abono.
texts.en:
Máximo is 46 years old and married with two children. The family resides in their own home on the edge of the Peruvian jungle in the town of Quimbiri. Máximo has always enjoyed excelling in any opportunity that presents itself. For example, coffee grows naturally in the valley where he lives, so that's why he grows coffee. It is one of the most sought after products in the market so it is advantageous to engage in the coffee growing business. Máximo favors growing coffee because its sales produce good earnings in order to support his family. He is also involved in other businesses such as producing and marketing pineapple, thus diversifiying his products to keep ahead of other competitors. Máximo is usually self-employed, but he sometimes gets help from his wife. However, when it is sowing and harvest season, he has workers to help him harvest the crop, which is later sold in the collection centers in the area. This is Máximo's fourth loan with MFP and he is committed to completing his payments on time. He is also happy to work with his community bank because of its good performance. With the requested loan, he plans to invest in properly maintaining his coffee and pineapple plantations by purchasing agricultural inputs and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his coffee and pineapple plantations

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is from the village of San Isidro. She is 56 years old, married, and has five school-age children.  Veronica owns a business that makes  general household furniture which she sells to local businesses and community members. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Veronica joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase raw materials to make more furniture. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Veronica from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Abunzubumwe Sake No1 Group

texts.fr:
Venant M., naquit à Sake  l’Est du Rwanda, il a 52 ans, il est marié et il a 8 enfants, son ainé a 26 ans et son cadet a 3 ans, son niveau d’étude est troc commun secondaire. Il vit avec sa famille à Sake Bugesera. 6 de ses enfants vont à l’école.
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé ABUNZUBUMWE SAKE NO1,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  commerçants et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Venant et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie, mais Venant, c’est pour acheter les fruits(ananas) et les fournir, dans l’avenir elle souhaite former une coopérative et travaillent ensembles en vue de profiter d’avantage. Les bénéfices venant de leur commerce seront réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et épargner afin de préparer pour le bon futur
texts.en:
Venant M., born in Sake in the east of Rwanda, is 52 years old, married and has eight children. His eldest child is 26 years old and his youngest three years old. He was educated up until secondary level. He lives with his family in Sake Bugesera and six of his children go to school. 

He is part of the solidarity group, Abunzubumwe Sake No 1, whose members are businessmen and they mutually guarantee one another. Venant and his group work to provide a livelihood for their families by improving their living conditions. Venant does this by buying fruit (ananas) and supplying them to shops. The group would like to form a cooperative in the future and work together in order to gain a greater benefit from it. The profits which they make from their business will be reinvested in order to maintain the group's financial stability and saved in order to prepare a good future for themselves.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit (pineapple) in order to supply shops

loans.name: Patricia Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad, se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

La señora Patricia es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gustan las reuniones ya que en ellas aprende mucho. Tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 2 años, la mayor esta en séptimo año de educación básica. Su marido es taxista.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos puso un pequeño comedor en un local que arrienda en el cual trabaja tres días de la semana, en las mañanas prepara el delicioso encebollado y en las tardes almuerzos y meriendas. Trabaja desde las 5 am hasta las 19 h00. Además en los otros días trabaja en un restaurante que es de su suegra en el centro.

Este crédito es para comprar productos que se requieren para la preparación de los alimentos. Su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que vive en casa de la suegra.
texts.en:
The Ilusiones communal bank meets every 15 days in the El Progreso area of the city of Portoviejo. It is a marginal, crowded urban area in the city known as “the prison sector” because the Portoviejo women’s prison is located in this area.

Patricia is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes the meetings because she learns a lot at them. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children, 11 and 2 years old. The oldest is in 7th grade of elementary school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

She is a housewife but to make her own earnings, she set up a small dining area in a place that she rents. She works there three days per week from 5am to 7pm. In the mornings she makes encebollado (a popular Ecuadorian dish) and in the afternoons she makes lunches and afternoon snacks. In addition, the other days she works at her mother-in-law’s restaurant in the center.

This loan is to purchase products that she needs to prepare the foods. Her dream is to have her own house because she currently lives in her mother-in-law’s house.

loans.use: To purchase supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SACSAYHUAMAN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; La socia tiene 40 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos ella se dedica a la artesanía la socia repara niños de yeso, ella trabaja desde hace 20 años reparando niños manuelitos, la socia trabaja junto a sus conyugue y son muy cotizados en estas épocas navideñas, la socia desea el dinero para poder comprar todos los materiales y continuar con sus trabajo para tener listos  a los niños manuelitos para la noche de navidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y pintura de color piel para reparar a los niños de manuelitos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the “Sacsayhuaman” Communal Bank, located in the Huanchac district of the province and department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has 2 sons.  She is dedicated to her artisan craft, repairing plaster dolls.  Alejandrina has spent nearly 20 years repairing child-like dolls called “manuelitos”.  She works with her husband and their work is much in demand during Christmas season.

Alejandrina requests this loan to purchase all needed materials, including skin-color paint, in order to continue her work and have the “manuelitos” ready for Christmas Eve.  She appreciates and values the loans available through this means and, at the same time, she commits herself to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS AND SKIN-COLOR PAINT FOR REPAIRING CHRISTMAS DOLLS

loans.name: Rosmira

texts.es: Rosmira Chávez es una mujer de 44 años que vive en el barrio Simón Bolívar, con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 15, 21 y 24 años que inició el negocio de miscelánea , desde muy joven cuando apenas estudiaba técnicas para hacer muñecos de trapo, en una pequeña mesa en su casa donde exhibía para la venta de estudiantes y amas de casa, las muñecas productos de su aprendizaje, cuadernos, colores, lápices, sacapuntas , en fin todo a buen precio. Poco a poco su negocio aumentó, y así mismo sus clientes y fue agregando una a una de las vitrinas que tiene y así mismo empezó a estudiar en un centro de capacitación formación técnica para aprender diversas técnicas que a ella le gustaban , así fue como hizo el curso de confección de ropa intima, manejo de maquinas planas  y modistería en general y una vez aprendió se fue a trabajar  en un taller donde perfeccionó sus arte, pero aun seguía teniendo las vitrinas en casa ayudada por su familia, con ello apoyó mucho la gestión del hogar, especialmente en lo relacionado al estudio de sus hijos;  hoy se siente satisfecha de sus logros, pero con el firme propósito de seguir creciendo personalmente y también de continuar  fortaleciendo su emprendimiento. Este es su primer financiamiento el cual aplicará a su microempresa  hoy llamada “Variedades Rosmy” , que se ha especializado en la venta de cerámicas, muñequería, papelería, e insumos de la confección; con su credikiva comprará materiales para elaborar muñecas de trapo, , cerámicas alusivas a la navidad y también se preparará para la época escolar del mes de Enero,  e invertirá en papelerías. Su gran sueño es lograr algún día exportar las muñecas de trapo que ella fabrica con sus manos,  para sentirse feliz cuando a cualquier parte del mundo alegre la vida de un niño  con una hermosa muñeca, que es  algo de si misma y que fabrica con mucho amor
texts.en:
Rosmira Chávez is a 44 year-old woman who lives in Simón Bolívar neighborhood with her husband and three children aged 15, 21 and 24.  She started her business when she was very young.  She studied techniques for making rag dolls on a small table in her home and displayed the dolls for sale to students and housewives together with exercise books, pencils and pencil sharpeners, all at a good price.

Little by little Rosmira's business increased as did her customers and she added the display cases she now has one by one.  She also studied at a technical training center, learning a number of techniques which she liked.  She did a course on making underwear, using sewing machines and dressmaking in general and when she'd finished learning she went to work in a workshop where she perfected her art.  She still had her display cases in her house, however, helped by her family.  She managed to support her household very well in this way, especially as regards her children's studies.  She currently she feels very satisifed with her achievements but she fully intends to continue growing as a person and she wants to continue strengthening her business.

This is Rosmira's first loan and she will use it in her small business which is called “Variedades Rosmy” and specializes in selling ceramics, dolls and accessories, stationery and dressmaking supplies.  She will use her Kiva loan to buy materials to make rag dolls and Christmas-decorated ceramics.  She will also prepare for the back-to-school period in January and will invest in stationery products.  Her big dream is to some day manage to export her hand-made rag dolls.  She will feel happy when in some part of the world a little child's life becomes brightened as they receive a beautiful doll which is something she made herself with a lot of love.

loans.use: To buy materials for making rag dolls, Christmas-decorated ceramics and also to prepare for the back-to-school period in January

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun S. is 36-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in Kompong Cham Province. She farms a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. 

She grows rice on her land, and she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. 

This couple has three lovely children who are all studying at public school. 

This rice harvesting season, Yun S. hasn't harvested her rice crop yet. So she would like to ask for a loan to hire the domestic labor needed to harvest.

loans.use: To hire the domestic labor to harvest

loans.name: Munguntsetseg

texts.en: Munguntsetseg D. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence, in the Yaarmag of Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband operates a taxi service, while her oldest daughter works as a salesperson. Munguntsetseg operates a photography business in Suhbaatar's square, Ulaanbaatar's central area, where she takes people's pictures. Both she and her husband earn a minimum of 20,000 MNT profit per day. She has been working as a photographer since 1994 and has gained much experience. Munguntsetseg is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to improve her husband's car.

loans.use: To improve her husband's car

loans.name: Sherlie

texts.en:
Sherlie R. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Sherlie is single. To make a living, Sherlie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling mechanical & engine products like gasoline & fluids for motors in the local community. Sherlie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Sherlie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Sherlie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like motor oil & gasoline. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Sherlie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like motor oil & gasoline

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Mrs. Tum T. lives in Chheu Teal Phluoh Village in Takeo Province, and she was born in 1954. She and her husband, Mr. Laiy Norng, are farmers who own a 3.5-hectare plot of land where they grow rice and vegetables for selling to support their family. In the crop field, she has some problems because the soil in her field is infertile, it is far away from an irrigation system, and it has a lot of insects. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Tum T. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a laborer, while two are farming laborers, and the fourth is attending local public school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita C. is from the village of Montol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children.

Elenita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 13 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In April 2010, Elenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Elenita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP that will be used as capital to buy hypo (calcium hypochlorite, a disinfectant) for sale. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy hypo (calcium hypochlorite, a disinfectant) to sell.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ALLIN MUJU”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Luzmila; La socia tiene 46 años de edad, la socia es conviviente,  y tiene 3 hijos (25,22,12); la socia se dedica a la elaboración de repostería, la socia realiza pasteles, tortas, empanadas y bocaditos para fiestas, y también ella confecciona uniformes y en esta época que los alumnos vuelven a clases la socia desea tener un capital para invertir en la compra de materiales para confeccionar uniformes, telas, botones, cierres, y otros, la socia ahora que es campaña escolar está muy interesada en invertir en este negocio. La socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de materiales para la confección escolar.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Luzmila is a member of the Communal Bank “Allin Muju” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 46 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 25, 22, and 12). Luzmila makes desserts such as pastries, cakes, turnovers, and snacks for parties. She also manufactures uniforms since students are currently returning to classes. Luzmila wants to secure capital to invest in the purchase of materials to make uniforms such as fabrics, buttons, zippers, and other items. She is very interested in investing in her business because of the school year. Luzmila will invest her loan in the purchase of these materials for making school uniforms.

She is happy with the loan that was provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making school uniforms

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor P. is from the town of Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. He is 52 years old. Victor is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Victor plants and harvests rice for sale. Victor has been engaged in his business for over 19 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Victor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Victor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Victor is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Victor from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Gloria tiene 36 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte desde hace más de 5 años, su esposo es el conductor del carro y ella es la que controla el kilometraje de recorrido así como los ingresos diarios. Considera que este trabajo es muy beneficioso para su tener una estabilidad económica ya que con ello puede cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Adicionalmente tiene a su disposición otro vehículo del que es conducido por un chofer contratado, para cubrir la misma ruta de transporte. Su gran ventaja es no tener competencia en este rubro, por ello hace lo posible por hacer un buen servicio y que hasta el momento lo ha hecho con éxito. Es su crédito número 3 con MFP y considera que ha sido una muy grata la experiencia haber trabajado de manera grupal en su banco comunal a pesar de los conflictos que atravesaron y permitieron fortalecer su grupo, en la actualidad se siente contenta de ser parte de este grupo humano. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en al compra de algunos repuestos para su carro y el pago del mantenimiento mecánico.
texts.en:
Gloria is 36 years old and lives with her husband and children in her home.  She has run a transportation service for 5 years.  Her husband is the driver and Gloria manages travel mileage as well the daily income.  She also has another vehicle which is driven by a contracted driver who services the same route.  She feels that this is a very beneficial job in terms of her economic stability as she is able to cover cost of living.  

A great advantage she has is that there are no competing transportation agencies.  Therefore, she does what she can to offer a good service and she has been able to do so thus far.  

This will be her third loan with MFP and she has been very pleased with her experience in working with the communal bank members, despite some challenges that, in the end, strengthened her group.   She is very happy to belong the group.  

She plans to use the loan to invest in a few auto parts for her car as well as in mechanical maintenance

loans.use: To purchase auto parts and carry out mechanical maintenance.

loans.name: Ma De Lourdes

texts.es: Mi nombre Lourdes, yo me dedico a hacer recuerdos para eventos, alguna boda, XV años, bautizos etc. Por lo general me piden que haga servilleteros con los nombres de la personas festejadas, tambien vendo bordados hago un poco de todo para que venda un poco mas, los desafios que enfrento es que espero que mi trabajo les llegue a buscar a la gente porque de eso vivo, por eso procuro hacer las cosas muy bien y que queden bonitas, tambien yo creo que me hace falta mas anuncion para mi trabajo y consiga mas clientes para que me vaya mejor, mis sueños son colar mi casa para que vivamos un poco mejor, soy casada pero mi esposo no vive conmigo y me tengo que hacer cargo de mis tres hijos que  estudian, tengo 37 años y 18 años de casada.
texts.en: My name is Lourdes and I work making souvenirs for events like weddings, quinceañeras, baptisms, etc.  I normally get requests for napkin holders with the names of the people celebrating events.  I also sell embroidery work.  I do a little bit of everything so that I can sell more.  One challenge I face is hoping that my work attracts more customers because this is how I make a living.  For this reason I try to make things very well so that they turn out pretty.  I would also like to advertise my work more to get more customers and improve my life.  I dream of pouring a concrete floor in my home so that we can live a bit better.  I am married, but my husband does not live with me.  I have to raise my three children who are now studying.  I am 37 years old and have been married for 18 years.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread, tablecloths, and make souvenirs for events

loans.name: Jose Hector

texts.es:
José es un joven de 19 años de edad, él es soltero, no tiene carga familiar directa, vive con sus padres. José vive en caserío “El Arenal”, en una comunidad pequeña de  aproximadamente 100 familias, cuenta con los servicios básicos (agua y energía eléctrica); esta ubicada  en el distrito de Túcume, ciudad turística que presenta  restos y pirámides arqueologías   en el norte de Perú.

José se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir (pantalones) y brinda este servicio en diferentes comunidades desde hace mas de tres años ,además José cuenta con ingresos económicos adicionales ya que realiza el trabajo de transporte de pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehiculo de transporte público que consiste en una  moto y una cabina para el transporte de personas).

José está solicitando un préstamo a  Edpyme Alternativa  de  S/. 2000 para que el pueda implementar su taller de costura con una máquina remalladora industrial, maquinaria que se utiliza para dar acabos finales en las telas, esta herramienta le será muy útil para la elaboración de las diferentes prendas de vestir que el necesite confeccionar.

José, es un cliente antiguo con buen historial crediticio, pues de muy joven sen su comunidad lo reconocen como un joven trabajador y responsable.
texts.en:
José is a 19 year old young man.  He’s single and doesn’t have a family to support.  He lives with his parents in the “El Arenal” settlement.  It’s a small community, located in Túcume, a tourist city in northern Peru, with a population of only about 100 families.  It has basic services, such as water and running water and features pyramids and archeological ruins.

José is asking for this loan of 2,000 PEN, though Edpyme Alternativa, so that he can start his sewing shop.  He wants to buy a commercial detailing sewing machine, which he will use to put the finishing touches on fabrics.  This will be very helpful in making the various articles of clothing that he needs to complete.

José is a longtime client with a very good credit history.  He’s been known in his community as being very responsible since he was very young.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Merlinda
