texts.en:
Merlinda is 52 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like milk, shampoo, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Merlinda has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for 25 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

Merlinda aspires to save enough money for business expansion and home renovation.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is 37 years old and a widow, who has been working as school teacher for people with special needs and learning difficulties for almost a year now.

Before finding this job, Sahar always dreamt of helping people with special needs in their life, and since it is expensive to send those kids to a special needs school, she started giving private lessons at her house, specially to people who have learning difficulties.

Now Sahar has both jobs, one at the school and the other at her house after work. Since she has experience on how to approach her students, she added giving English lessons as one of her services.

Now Sahar has applied for this loan to enhance the teaching area at her house so she can provide the best service for her customers.

loans.use: To enhance the teaching area at her house.

loans.name: Reebok Group

texts.en:
Matagiri, who is in his mid 40s, is married. He has five children who are still going to school. He has been running a business of selling perfumes from door to door since 2000. He works from 8.30am to 8pm daily and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Matagiri's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to repair his house by repainting, put a month floor and better doors.  He also bought more perfumes to sell and during that time he started a catering business. So he bought utensils for the catering business. He has paid back all his loans successfully and wishes for a loan to buy more perfumes to sell.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Reebok", which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es:
La señora María Irma, vive en Coapilla Estado D. Chiapas México, es casada con el señor José, con quien procreo tres hijas: Iris del Rocío D. diesi siete  años, Jania Margarita D. tres años y la más pequeña es Jimena Marisol D. un año D. edad.

    Ella esta vez invertirá el préstamo en la compra  D. hojas  tamaño carta y darle mantenimientos a las maquinas D. su civer café, en donD. lleva  dos años  y  tres  meses, en lo que cometa que le va bien ya que con ello está teniendo un mejor ingreso en su hogar.

    Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad es su familia y su esposo ya que el es ingeniero en sistemas y le comento que si quería tener una actividad en la que acepto muy contenta pero que fuera un  civer ya que es una actividad que deja buenas ganancias.


    Su más granD. deseo es que con esta actividad pueda sostenerse junto con su familia y con el préstamo apoyarse a tenerlo en buen estado y sus clientes estén satisfechos con la atención que ellas les brindan.
texts.en:
Maria Irma lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Jose, with whom she has three daughters: Iris del Rocio, 17; Jania Margarita, 3; and the youngest is Jimena Marisol, who is 1 year old. 

This time she will invest the loan in the purchase of letter-sized paper and performing maintenance on the computers at her internet cafe, where she has been working for 2 years and 3 months. She says that it's going well and is bringing in more income for her home. 

She was motivated to begin this activity by her family and her husband, who is a systems engineer, and who told her that if she wanted to have a business that maD. her happy she should have a cyber cafe because they bring in good earnings.

Her greatest wish is that with this business she will be able to take care of herself and her family, and the loan will help her to keep it in good condition and keep her customers happy with the service she provides.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of letter-sized paper and to maintain the machines at the internet cafe.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 44-year-old single mother of 2 children, aged 17 and 23. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years in her hometown in eastern Kenya. Her farm currently produces milk, potatoes and cabbages, which she sells to the local market. She depends solely on the income from her farm to provide for her family's basic needs.

Jane has requested a loan of 36,400 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her to acquire a quality cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will be used to pay her child's school fees. Jane's biggest challenges have been insufficient water for irrigation and poor weather conditions. She plans to buy 4 quality dairy cows and expand her farming project from half an acre to one acre in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es: Lesbia Maria es una madre de familia de 59 años, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el municipio de Nagarote. Lesbia tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en este negocio y además de realizar financiamientos con Fundación León 2000 ella se dedica a una pulpería, ubicada en su vivienda para su mayor seguridad y comodidad, además puede atender a sus clientes a cualquier hora. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, jugos, detergentes, fósforos, sal y granos básicos con la intención de que se incrementen sus ventas para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lesbia Maria is a 59-year-old mother. Her home has running water and electricity and is located in the Nagarote municipality. Lesbia has worked in this business and taken out loans from Fundacion Leon 2000 for a long time. She runs a convenience store in her home, for better security and comfort. This also means that she can serve her customers at any time. She has requested a loan for the purchase of candy, pop, bread, juice, detergent, matches, salt and basic grains, with the intention of increasing her sales in order to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase candy, pop, bread, juice, detergent, matches, salt and basic grains.

loans.name: Eveleen

texts.en:
Eveleen is 32 years old and married to Julius. They are blessed with three children, age 7, 5 and 1 and a half. She has been operating her salon for the last ten years with a monthly profit of KES 6,000. She has been loaned KES 30,000, with which she plans to purchase stock like chemicals, weaves, extensions, oils and shampoos and expand her business.

With the anticipated profit, she plans to open another salon in Kitengela in the near future. She hopes to be a very successful entrepreneur within and out of Isinya.

loans.use: to purchase stock like chemicals, weaves, extensions, oils and shampoos and expand the business.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
Ingrid integrante del Banco comunal “Trabajando Juntos” perteneciente a la comuna de Estación Central, ciudad de Santiago. Ella se dedica a vender loza desde hace 3 años. Su mercadería la ofrece a domicilio y en ferias libres. Los días martes y sábado. Ingrid comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, ya que tiene bastante demanda por parte de sus clientes. Durante la temporada de navidad, cuenta con un puesto y permiso de comercialización en una feria artesanal, para vender loza.
Su mercadería la compra en una distribuidora en el centro de la comuna de Estación Central. Ingrid compra bastante mercadería y a bajos precios, de ésta manera puede vender más barata su mercadería y captar mayor número de clientes. Específicamente su mercadería son vasos, azucareros, tazones, platos, entre otros. 
Con el crédito comprará más loza.
Sus metas en su negocio son instalarlo en un local establecido, espera que éste se ubique cerca de su casa, ya que sufre de artritis y debe evitar el ejercicio y traslados de mercadería.
Ingrid vive junto a su esposo  y sus tres hijos de 20, 18 y 17 años de edad, todos ellos estudian. Su marido es quien la ayuda en el traslado de mercadería.
Sus sueños son brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y educación. Por tanto su motivación de continuar con el negocio se debe a generar mayores ingresos para cumplir sus expectativas.  
Ella está contenta y agradecida de la ayuda que le brindado Fondo Esperanza, además comenta que el grupo es muy unido y no han tenido ninguna dificultad, además las reuniones se realizan en su casa.
Respecto a las capacitaciones estas le han servido para registrar y distribuir gastos e ingresos.
Estación Central es una comuna emplazada en el área céntrica de Santiago (capital de Chile), que debe su nombre a la Estación Central de Ferrocarriles, que data del año 1887, declarada Monumento Nacional en 1983. En sus inicios esta estación, junto con la estación Mapocho, fueron la entrada a la capital en el tramo Valparaíso -  Santiago y también desde la zona sur del país.
texts.en:
Ingrid is a member of the communal bank “Trabajando Juntos”. She lives in the municipality of Estacion Central, in the city of Santiago. She has been selling crockery for the last 3 years. She sells her merchandise at home and in street markets. Ingrid says that on Tuesdays and Saturdays she does very well as there is a big enough demand from her clients. During the Christmas season, she has a stall at a crafts fair with a license to sell crockery.

She buys her merchandise at a dealership in the centre of Estacion Central. Ingrid buys enough goods at low prices so that she can sell them cheaper and attract more customers. Specifically she sells glasses, sugar bowls, mugs, plates and the like.

With the loan, she will buy more crockery.

Her primary goal with regards her business is to set it up in permanent premises, hopefully close to where she lives, as suffering from arthritis she should avoid exercise and the moving of heavy merchandise.

Ingrid lives with her husband and 3 sons, aged 20, 18 and 17, who are all students. Her husband is the one who helps her move the merchandise. Their dream is to provide their sons with a better life and education. The desire to generate more income and realize her dreams is what motivates her to continue with the business.

She is happy and grateful for the help provided by Fondo Esperanza and says that the group is very united and has not had any difficulties. The communal bank meetings take place in her home The training given has helped her record and distribute income and expenses.

Estación Central is a municipality located in the downtown area of ​​Santiago (the capital of Chile), which owes its name to the Central Railway Station, which dates from 1887 and was declared a National Monument in 1983. In the beginning this station, along with the Mapocho station, was the gateway to the capital from Valparaiso and also from the south of the country.

loans.use: to buy more crockery.

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
Wilberto, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 17, 14 y 11 años de edad, ellos administran como familia una tienda, donde todos colaboran en la atención a los clientes, llevan 5 años en el negocio.
Él está por el momento solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, como jabón, detergentes, aceite, arroz, frijoles, pues quiere mantener una tienda surtida y brindar un buen servicio a los clientes.
El propósito de él es darle mantenimiento al negocio, que sus ventas no decaigan y que los clientes siempre encuentren lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Wilberto lives with his wife and three children who are 17, 14 and 11 years old. The family has a store and they all work together to deal with the customers. They have had this business for five years.
At this time, he is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise like soap, detergent, oil, rice and beans.He wants to maintain a well-stocked store and offer his customers good service. 
His aim is to maintain this business so that his sales don’t fall and the customers always find what they need.

loans.use: purchase soap, detergent, oil, rice and beans for the business.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa sells onions and other types of vegetables at Jukwa Market near Abura. She is married and blessed with six dependants. As part of her responsibilities she supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan, when received, will be used to obtain bags of onions to meet the demands of her customers. Any form of increase that may come as a result of the loan will be ploughed back into the business.

loans.use: to obtain bags of onions to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Gregorio Eliut

texts.es:
Gregorio, vive junto con su esposa y una hija, él tiene una tienda de productos básicos (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz) inicio el negocio por iniciativa propia, hace tres años, todos los días trabaja, no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para crecer más su tienda y comprar más mercadería como: azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite y detergentes,de esa forma su negocio estara fortalecido.
El sueño de Gregorio es, incrementar  sus ventas y  tendrá más variedad y cubrir sus obligaciones y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Gregorio lives with his wife and daughter. He has a commodities store selling rice, beans, sugar, corn. He started the business on his own inititative 3 years ago. He works every day and does not have a fixed schedule.

He will use the loan to his expand store and buy more goods such as: sugar, rice, beans, oil and detergents. In this way his business will be strengthened.

Gregorio's dream is to increase sales and have more variety as well as meeting with his obligations and getting ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil and detergents for the business.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 56 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for almost two years. 

Esperanza is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell in the store

loans.name: Mok

texts.en:
Mok is a 37-year-old married woman, who lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has a life partner in her husband with three single children. 
All of her children are attending a public school in the province. Mok earns a living by growing rice and vegetable crops on her own farmland, making a profit of $1.5 per day. 
Mok’s husband has just registered to work as a security guard. To start this work, the security company requires all new staff to pay in advance for membership, training, clothes and food, but Mok doesn’t have enough money to pay for that. So now she would like to ask for $200USD from HKL and Kiva, to spend mainly on fixing her present house. In addition, the rest of this fund will be used to pay for her husband’s new work. In the future, she plans to continue supporting her children until they finish high school.

loans.use: to mainly fix her present house and to pay in advance for her husband’s new work.

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en: Isaack used his previous loan of  50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chairs and buckets.  This loan really boosted his business and helped him get more customers. He now hopes to become the major distributor of plastic chairs, buckets and basins in his region, and has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more plastic buckets and basins.

loans.use: to buy more plastic buckets and basins.

loans.name: Adrie

texts.en:
Adrie, age 38, owns and operates a general store. She and her husband have a seven-year-old child and also take care of Adrie's older sister. In her store, she sells various goods such as biscuits, water, toothpaste, and soap. She has operated her business for one year and works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily. She currently employs one person to help her.

Adrie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase goods to sell in her store. With the expected profits, she is confident that she will be able to reinvest in her business as well as to pay for medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is 52 years of age and blessed with two children. He is a farmer in their community who has been operating his farming business for ten years.  Because disastrous typhoons occur in their province, his expected crops did not mature. They were easily destroyed because of high location of his corn field. For this reason he’s in need of additional working capital to renew his corn field. He is asking for a loan amount of P25,000 to buy corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers. Hopefully, this time he can yield much so that he can save for the future of his family as well as to his business.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.en:
Gladys's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Gladys is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Gladys has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells various kinds of clothes. 

To help expand her business, Gladys has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Gladys to generate greater profits and educate her children. Gladys hopes that in the future she will be able to build a good, permanent house. 

Gladys is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Gladys's future prospects by helping her to educate her kids and to learn how to save.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a widow and has nine dependents. Aba cooks kenkey for sale at Efutu. She is mixing the dough she uses in preparing the kenkey.  As a single parent, Aba is responsible for feeding, clothing and paying the school of her children. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize for kenkey preparation. With her new profits, Aba will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for kenkey preparation.

loans.name: Mame Diarra

texts.fr: Madame Mame Diarra est une femme qui habite à environ 70 km de la capital, elle évolue dans l'artisanat depuis plus de 7anset dispose de son propre atelier à la maison. Elle sollicite un prêt d'un montant de 300.000F pour acheter deux (02) machines à coudre afin de renforcer son activité artisanale et générer plus de bénéfices. Elle commence sa journée à 8 pour la terminer à 19h. Elle est célibataire sans enfants et ses principales charges sont la facture d'électricité de son atelier et la participation à la nourriture de sa famille. Mame Diarra souhaite à l'avenir augmenter ses revenus pour pouvoir diversifier son activité.

loans.use: Acheter une machine à coudre pour renforcer son atelier de couture

loans.name: Estrella Marie

texts.en:
Estrella Marie was able to sustain her direct-selling business and doormat making business through the financial support of KIVA and its lenders. She is thankful that she was able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

Now that Christmas is just around the corner she has already received numerous advanced orders of her personal products. In view of this she would like to again request for a PHP 20000 loan to buy clothing and beauty products from popular direct-selling brands. She will also use part of the loan to buy fabrics and thread for her doormat-making business. She hopes for your positive response and wishes everyone an advanced Blessed Christmas! 

Estrella Marie dreams of expanding her business and aims to give her children the best education to allow them better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

loans.use: To pay for more items needed in her direct-selling business and cloth for her doormat making.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry has a small shoe-making workshop. Henry started his business with the help of his wife and with $100 capital. Now he continues to sell sandals and shoes for all ages.

Henry will use this loan to invest in materials to make shoes and sandals for ladies and gentlemen. He also aspires to construct a location in his home for the workshop, and to be able to give work to those who need it. He has faith that with these new products, the business will grow.

Henry is the father of one son, he is married and is 29 years old. He has the hope that, with this loan, he will improve the quality of life for his family and give stability and growth to the business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer) Henry tiene un pequeño taller de calzado. Henry empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposa y con un capital de 100 dólares. Se inicio vendiendo sandalias a sus amistades y familiares. Ahora el continua vendiendo sandalias y zapatos para todas las edades. Henry usara el préstamo para invertir en material y confeccionar el calzado y sandalias para damas y caballeros. El tiene la aspiración de construir un local en su vivienda para el taller y poder dar trabajo a personas que lo necesiten. El tiene la fe que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecerá. Henry es Padre de 1 hijo, esta unido, tiene 29 años. Henry tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le dará estabilidad y crecimiento al negocio.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in materials for his sandal making operation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stocks for his vegetable and charcoal selling business

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Widowed for more than four years, Mrs. Afi A. is solely responsible for her six children. Her business is palm oil production, but her earnings scarcely suffice for food and school fees for her children. In attempting to improve her financial situation, Afi has asked for and obtained several small loans to further her business activities. She has had no difficulty in reimbursing these loans.

Afi buys palm nuts and wood for fuel to produce her palm oil. She produces such a good quality of oil that demand for her product is greater than her ability to produce it, given her limited capital. For that reason, she is asking for a loan of US$ 900 so that she can satisfy her customers' needs. Her initiative deserves support so that she can improve the living conditions of her family and do well by her children.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Veuve depuis plus de quatre ans déjà, Madame A. Afi assure seule la responsabilité et la charge de ses six enfants. Elle a pour activité la production de l’huile de palme. Son revenu suffit à peine à l’alimentation et à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Pour mieux faire face à cette situation, elle a demandé et obtenu de petits crédits pour promouvoir son activité. Elle n’a eu aucune difficulté à les rembourser.

Elle achète des noix de palme et du bois de chauffe pour la production de l’huile. La qualité de l’huile qu’elle présente sur le marché fait qu’elle a une demande plus forte qu’elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire parce qu’elle ne dispose pas assez de fonds de commerce. Elle sollicite donc un crédit de $900 afin de pouvoir mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Cette initiative mérite d’être soutenue pour améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille et une prise en charge effective de ses enfants.

loans.use: Buying palm nuts and wood for fuel to produce palm oil

loans.name: Zaib

texts.en:
“My husband makes furniture and earns about $82 per month. We have six children and the eldest of them is employed. We were not able to send him to school because of the high cost of living but we would like to give our other children this opportunity. Through this loan we will purchase wood needed for the expansion of our furniture business, which is our family business. We hope that expanding the business will double our monthly income and allow us to send our other children to school.”

Zaib B., Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase raw material i.e wood for our furniture business

loans.name: Lumateh Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian was the second wife of Gideon N. who, because of a family misunderstanding, separated from her.  She is a mother of four children, three who are of schooling age.  Her separation from her husband has been a challenge to her as she now has the responsibility of taking care of her four children with very little support from their father.

With a loan of $100, she plans to invest in her tailoring business through which she plans to sew and sell dresses.  The profit will be used to pay school fees for her children and provide other basic needs for her children.

She plans to repay the loan in 15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, sewing thread and pay workshop rent

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith always knew what she wanted to be as a grown-up, and now dedicated to cosmetology, her great passion is obvious to all her clients who recognize the quality of her hands, her great creativity and her diligence. Her dream is to own her own beauty salon, dream which has been postponed many times as her home is very young and many things are needed there. She has a three-year-old daughter who she adores and therefore she and her husband make a special effort in each of their activities. Edith’s plan is to buy, little by little, the material she will need for her beauty salon and that way save money to be able to purchase her own business in a short time. She is asking for funds so she, together with her family, can plan how to reach her goal. Please help this young woman to turn her business into a beauty center with an outstanding attention for all the ladies of Pichanaqui. We hope to count on the support coming from your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Edith, siempre supo lo que quería ser de grande y ahora convertida en una cosmetóloga, muestra su gran pasión por esta actividad con todas sus clientas, quiénes reconocen la calidad de sus manos, su gran creatividad y su diligencia.Su sueño es tener en algún momento su salón de belleza propio, sueño que ha tenido que postergar muchas veces debido a que su hogar es muy joven por lo que requieren de muchas cosas.Tiene una pequeña niña de tres años a la cual adora y por quién se esfuerza junto a su esposo en cada una de las actividades que desempeñan.Su plan es comprar poco a poco algunas cosas para su pequeño espacio de belleza y así ahorrar para adquirir su local propio en poco tiempo, razón por la que solicita una suma de dinero en calidad de préstamo que le permitirá empezar a estructurar estas metas junto a su familia. Ayude a esta soñadora mujer que quiere hacer de su negocio un centro de belleza con un servicio espectacular para todas las damas de Pichanaqui, esperamos también pueda contar con la ayuda de su noble corazón

loans.use: Purchase material for a beauty salon in order to offer better attention to the clients.

loans.name: Perise

texts.en: Perise is a married mother of five children, one of them has a job in town but the rest are all unemployed. Her business is taro plantation. Before joining SPBD program in 2004, her family depend only remittances from overseas (New Zealand, Australia.), that was the reason she needed help from SPBD, her last loan was used to fixed the floor of her house and other stuff for her business. To maintain and to improve her business, she is now applying for another loan to buy more stuff for her business so she can serve and to satisfy needs of her customers everyday, not only that but also to help out with her family remittances.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her taro plantation

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru:
Anar B. was born in 1981 in the Agsunisky region. He recently got married. He has been breeding livestock for the past four years. This young man is seriously involved in his business. In 2007 he applied for a loan from Normicro. Anar hopes that this loan will help him expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бабакишиев Анар родился 1981 году в Ахсуниском районе. Недавно женился. Уже четыре года подряд занимается скотоводством. Этот молодой человек серезно занимается этим бизнесом. 2007 году написал заявление в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Анар надеятся получив кредит расширять свой бизнес.

loans.use: To increase livestock

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly has always devoted her attention to working in a grocery store. When she was a girl, she helped her aunt in the business that she ran. This is how she learned everything relevant to maintaining a grocery store. Once she got married, she decided to open her own store that today, after twelve years, fills her with pride. Although it has caused her a lot of effort, it also has filled her with satisfaction.

Today, her two daughters of twenty and eleven years learn from her and help her whenver they can. Thanks to the success of her business, she has been able to finish building her house and educate her daughters. In the future, she wants to open a beer distributing company in another location. Her plans for this year are to convert her store into a bazaar and to start selling school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde siempre, Magaly se dedicó a la atención de una bodega. Cuando niña, ella ayudaba a su tía en el negocio que esta manejaba. Es así que aprendió todo lo referente al mantenimiento de una bodega. Una vez que contrajo matrimonio, se animo a abrir una tienda que hoy, después de doce años, la llena de orgullo. Pues, aunque le causo mucho esfuerzo también la ha llenado de satisfacciones.

Hoy, son sus dos hijas de veinte y once años quienes aprenden de ella ayudándola cada vez que pueden. Pues, es gracias al éxito de su negocio que ella ha podido terminar de construir su casa y darle educación a sus hijas. En el futuro ella quiere abrir una distribuidora de cervezas en otro local. Por ahora, los planes para este año es convertir su bodega en bazar, implementándola de útiles escolares.

loans.use: To convert her grocery store into a bazaar.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
Bahtiyor K. Hakimovich lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 35 years old, is married and has a High School education with professional specialization. He is a turner by profession, however being a turner is more of a side job for him. His main source of income is agriculture. He rents land, plants wheat and potatoes on it and when the crop is ready, keeps a small portion for his own family while selling the rest on the market. Right now is the perfect time for planting. Bahtiyor would like to borrow money in order to purchase high quality seeds, which will in turn result in a high quality crop. The quality of the product will attract additional clients and will help sell the crop with no leftovers. He plans to repay the credit in a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Кенджаев Бахтиер Хакимович житель города Вахдат. Возраст клиента 35 лет. Не женат. Образование средне-специальное. По профессии токарь .Подрабатывает токарными работами , но основным видом деятельности и основным источником дохода его семьи является земледелие. Он берет землю в аренду , засеивает пшеницей и картофелем.После того как он получает урожай , часть его он оставляет своей семье, а остальную часть продает. Сейчас самое время посевных , поэтому клиент нуждается в деньгах для покупки семян картофеля , пшеницы и удобрений.Поэтому он запланировал получить кредит. Это поможет ему закупить качественные семена и получить качественный урожай, что поможет привлеч новых клиентов и без остатка реализовать свою продукцию. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase wheat seeds, potatoes and fertilizer.

loans.name: Benny Margarita

texts.es:
Señora Benny Margarita Álamo P. is 27 years old and has one son who is still dependent on her. She lives in the neighbourhood of Aurora Díaz, Salaverry district, in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad department, Peru.

She started out by selling frozen treats like snow cones in the summer. In the afternoons she sold fruit desserts, stuffed potatoes, oatmeal, and fried bread. She slowly saved enough to open a small store that she still has, and from where she sells a wide variety of products such as groceries, candy, and drinks. Just before the school year starts, she sells school supplies, and she also prepares lunches for the local children. In addition to these activities she is responsible for looking after a family-owned internet place.

Her first loan of S/. 300.00 obtained from the Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Auroras en Acción” was used to buy a liquidizer so that she could make juices, and she also bought fruit at wholesale prices. With the S/.1000.00 loan she will buy more stock for her store, as well as school supplies at the beginning of the school year. She plans to pay back the loan within six months. Her biggest dream is to expand her store and to buy a mobile van from which to sell hamburgers in the evenings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Benny Margarita Álamo P. tiene 27 años de edad, tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella.Vive en el sector Aurora Díaz en el distrito de Salaverry en la provincia de Trujillo departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Su negocio se inicia vendiendo marcianos en temporada de verano, por las tardes vendía mazamorra, papa rellena, avenas y cachangas. Poco a poco fue ahorrando para poner una pequeña bodega que ahora la tiene con mayor variedad de productos. Vende abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas y por campaña escolar aprovecha en vender útiles escolares. Además prepara loncheras para los niños de su barrio. Aparte esta encargada de administrar el alquiler de cabinas de Internet que es un negocio familiar.

Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que obtuvo en el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Auroras en Acción” lo invirtió para comprar una licuadora la cual le ha servido para preparar jugos y también compro frutas al por mayor. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual será canceldo en un periodo de seis meses comprará más mercadería para surtir su tienda, además de útiles escolares aprovechando la campaña escolar. Su mayor sueño es implementar su tienda y comprarse un carrito sanguchero para preparar hamburguesas para vender por las noches.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes and slippers for resale.

loans.name: Hafizan's Group

texts.en:
Hafizan baji is a wife of A. K.. She has been married for 20 years. She lives in Vehari, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children, three sons and three daughters. Her eldest son is a welder. Her other son, Zulfiqar, has a shoe shop. Her first daughter is married.

Hafizan baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan for her son's shoe shop.

This is a group loan. Hafizan baji has been joined in her loan group by a few more members. Kosar baji and Salma baji want a loan for their garment businesses. Arifa baji wants a loan for her shoe business.

In a group loan, the loan funds are distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

NOTE: "Baji" (elder sister) is an Urdu term of respect for women.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 48-year-old wife and mother of five children who are in school. She has been a food vendor for three years. She prepares and sells banku (locally dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of local soups). It is a delicacy most Ghanaians eat every day either as breakfast, lunch or dinner. Janet’s business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. She therefore wants to use the loan to buy more maize grains, vegetables and assorted meat for her operation. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings for the children’s fees. Janet is a member of the group called “Nyame ye odo” (God is love). Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, vegetables, assorted meat, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad Halam

texts.en:
Mohammad Halam is responsible for his father and mother as well as his own family. He is married. He is busy in agriculture. He learned this business from his father, but now his father is unable to work in agriculture. Mohammad Halam works hard at growing his crops and he has plenty of land for cultivation but he is unable to make use of it all.

So Halam wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghani with a term of 12 months to complete his stock and buy more seeds to plant all his land and get ready for next year's cultivation. This is the season to prepare their lands for cultivation next year. He wants to make a better life for his family in the future.

So Halam is very happy that with this loan he can further his business and help his family in the future. His father and all his family want to thank those that help people through making Kiva loans.

loans.use: To be able to cultivate all his land

loans.name: Kouy

texts.en:
Kouy S., born in 1962, has been raising poultry in her home for the last nine years, earning an income of $5 per day to help support her family. Her husband, Him Choo, has been a policeman for many years and makes $3 each day in his local commune. They have three children, one who is married, one who is still too young to attend the local school, and one who is employed by a casino, earning $130 each month to help the family's income. 

Kouy S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase additional feed for her chickens and other poultry. She intends to spend about $500 on the feed and use the other $300 to purchase a motorbike to be used both for business and personal transportation.

Kouy S. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband is pictured above.

loans.use: To purchase feed for poultry and a motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Hoevi

texts.fr:
Née en 1959 à Séwatsikopé, madame H. Hoevi est une veuve très active. Après le décès de son mari, elle compte à sa charge deux personnes. La vente du maïs est son activité. Elle achète le maïs dans la partie centrale du Togo et revient le revendre à Kpémé.

Possédant tous les rouages de son commerce, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter de maïs qu’elle mettra sur le marché. Après la vente, les bénéfices lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins des personnes à sa charge.
texts.en:
Born in 1959 in Séwatsikopé, Ms. Hoevi H. is a widow who is very active. With her husband having passed away, she counts two persons in her care. Her work involves selling corn. She buys the corn in central Togo and comes back to resell it in Kpémé. Knowing all the ins and outs of her business, she is requesting this loan to buy corn, which she will offer in the marketplace. After the sales are made, the profit will enable her to meet the needs of those in her care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell corn

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is married with a 4-year-old daughter. She is from Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Tetyana owns a vending kiosk in the central city marketplace of Ivano-Frankivsk and sells children’s toys. Her business is well-known for affordable prices and a good selection of merchandise. Tetyana has been in trade for 10 months. Presently, she has about 4,000 Grivnas of income a month.   

Tetyana is always on the run. She combines entrepreneurial activity with household chores and family. Tetyana loves owning her business and is hoping to gain more experience in her entrepreneurial endeavors. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnas to purchase assorted plastic toys for further retail sales. Tetyana is hoping to invest generated profits in the purchase of two more vending facilities.

loans.use: To open a third vending facility and increase the assortment of plastic toys

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Don Santos tiene 63 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Es agricultor desde hace 50 años, y le sigue agradando trabajar en sus terrenos  donde produce frutos cítricos, plátanos, y ahora está incursionando en el cultivo de  arroz, siendo el proceso de siembra lo que más le agrada realizar dentro de sus diversas actividades. Gracias a que la cosecha de plátanos es quincenal, puede comercializarlos frecuentemente, y esto le favorece, además, que este producto es constantemente demandado por los comerciantes, aunque lo difícil sea trasladar sus productos a los depósitos de fruta donde revenden sus productos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Don Santos está dispuesto a invertir en lo que ahora es su prioridad, el arroz, por ello requiere que su terreno esté debidamente cuidado y abonado.
texts.en:
Don Santos is 63 years old, and lives with his wife and his children. He has been a farmer for 50 years, and he continues to enjoy working in his fields where he produces citric fruit, plantains, and now is exploring the cultivation of rice, the process of seeding being the most gratifying to realize among his other diverse activities. Thanks to the fact that plantain crops are bi-monthly, he can commercialize them frequently. This is favorable, furthermore, because this product is in constant demand by traders, and it is very difficult to transport his products to fruit depots where they resell them. This is his first loan with MFP. Don Santos is ready to invest in what is now his priority, rice, for this requires that his land is properly cared for and fertilized.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare his land for the cultivation of rice.

loans.name: Mrs. Koen Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fifteen people located in Kandal Kraom Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Koen M. is the village bank president and was selected by the group members. She sells clothes in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fashion clothes to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Noeun Socheat, is a goldsmith in the local market. Mrs. Koen M. is 30 years old and the mother of a young child.

loans.use: To buy more fashion clothes to resell.

loans.name: Ally

texts.en: Ally K. M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. He is married and he runs a tailoring mart at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. He makes various clothes of different designs for different people, including school uniforms. He has been in the business for four years. Business materials are purchased from Kariakoo and Karume wholesale shop and sometimes from retailers. He meets his family's daily needs from his business income. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business materials.

loans.use: To buy more business inventory

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti K. has two sons who attend middle and high school. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law and mother-in-law. Jayanti already owns one cow, and she has been selling milk in the area. In Nepal, pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for its nutrition.

Jayanti lives in a growing neighborhood, and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing. She carries her milk containers and sells door to door, daily in the morning and evening.  Because of the rising demand, she wants to buy another cow to increase the milk production.  So she is requesting a loan of Rs. 20,000.00 to purchase a jersey cow, which produces more milk than normal cows.  She has grassland of her own, so she does not have to buy food for her cows.

loans.use: To buy a jersey cow

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak A. is a 36-year-old nurse at the central hospital in the town of Isfara. Together with her husband, who is currently working in Russia, Muborak has raised three children. In addition, she has run a drug store for eight years, selling certified medicines. The drug store is located in the town center, so it attracts many customers. Muborak is requesting $600 USD to expand her business. With the consequent increase in income, she is planning to educate all of her children through higher education. Being very precise by nature, Muborak would like to assure lenders that she is able and ready to repay the loan in nine months. This loan will help her accomplish her goals in a short time. Your generosity can change lives. More about Tajikistan Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. More about IMON International Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase medicines in order to expand the business

loans.name: Maricela Evangelina

texts.es: La Señorita Maricela Evangelina B.   con 24 años de edad, soltera, de oficios Sastre “elaboración de ropa para bebes” cuenta con un taller pequeño  habita junto a su madre, lleva 5 años de elaborar  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chuipachec, cantón juchanep, Totonicapán, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, actualmente la demanda de su clientela es muy poca el cual es obligado a cambiar de oficios la condiciones  económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda incrementar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia para la confección para ropa de bebes y de esa manera poder ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Maricela Evangelina B., 24, single and living with her mother, is a taylor of baby clothes and has a small workshop. She has been making apparel for five years at her home in Paraje Chuipachec, Junachep district, Totonicapan, department of Totonicapan, Guatemala.

The current demand of her customers is very little which is forcing her to change her occupation, and her economic conditions are not enough to increase her capital; this is the reason why she went to ASDIR association, to ask for a loan to purchase raw materials for baby clothes and in this way help support her family.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw material for baby clothing

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi N. is forty-seven years old and married with seven children. She sells secondhand clothing. She purchases the clothes from Cotonou to sell in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is asking for a loan of $550 to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Atoumane

texts.fr:
Atoumane GUEYE est un charretier. Il offre de services pour le transport de marchandises et autres produits moyennant 500 F à 2000 F CFA la prestation.
Ce pére de famille est un grand débrouillard, il demande ce crédit pour renforcer son activité.
Son quartier général est à côté de la caisse de Ziguinchor.
texts.en:
Atoumane GUEYE is a cart driver. He offers services for transporting merchandise and other goods and average 500 to 2,000 francs CFA for each trip. This is a father of a family who is very resourceful. He’s asking for this loan to bolster his business. He is head-quartered next to the Ziguinchor bank.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cart service

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a 25-year-old married woman living in Kamed El Louz, in the Bekaa Valley. She has been working as a beautician for the past two years. Today, Salma is requesting to borrow US$ 500 to purchase beauty products.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Iolanda Felismina Doira

texts.pt:
Iolanda Felismina Doira M.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material de construção  
Montante de Empréstimo: 13,200.00MT
Início: 20/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Iolanda de 41 anos nasceu no distrito da manhiça, Província de Maputo, estudou até nona classe. Viúva e mãe de três filhos de 22, 19 e 10 anos, respectivamente. Todos estudam.
Transferiu-se da vila da Manhiça para Boane em 1987 quando casou.
Trabalha na Associação Khidlimukaa 5 anos como secretária executiva com horário das 7:30 às 15:30, tem como salário mensal 3,000.00MT e vive na casa própria.
É quarto empréstimo com a Hluvuku, tendo desembolsado 6,000.00MT, 7,300.00MT e 10,000.00MT, respectivamente, todos foram para habitação.
No futuro sonha concluir a sua residência e comprar mobiliário.
texts.en:
Iolanda, 41 years old, was born in Manhiça district, Maputo province. She studied until ninth grade. She is a widow and mother of three children, 22, 19 and 10 years old respectively. They're all in school. She moved from Manhiça to Boane in 1987 when she got married. She has worked for the Khidlimukaa Association for five years as an executive secretary. Her hours are 7:30 a.m. until 3:30 p.m., and she receives 3,000 MT a month as her salary. She lives in her own home. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. She has received 6,000 MT, 7,300 MT and 10,000 MT respectively, all were for housing. In the future, she dreams of finishing her home and buying furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel es una persona muy empeñosa y dedicada a su familia, quien está muy contenta por contar con un padre y esposo tan responsable que les brindó una casa propia y un hogar agradable donde habitar. Desde que era joven trabajó en múltiples obras de construcción como albañil y la experiencia que adquirió le dio la posibilidad de acceder a un trabajo bajo el orden público (del estado) donde  se ocupa desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, tiempo que labora con mucho agrado pues desempeñarse en la labor que tanto le gusta lo motiva. Sin embargo, desea tener un negocio propio donde pueda obtener ingresos adicionales, realizando construcciones independientes. Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y muchas ganas de continuar siendo parte de su banco comunal por mucho tiempo. Los 3000 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para realizar sus trabajos independientes como albañil.
texts.en:
Miguel is very dedicated and devoted to his family. They are very happy to count on a responsible father and husband who provided them with their own house and a nice home where they live. Since he was young, he worked on many construction sites as a bricklayer and the experience he gained gave him the possibility to work for the state. He works from 9 in the morning to 4 in the afternoon, time which he labors with much enjoyment, as working in a field that he likes so much motivates him. Nevertheless, he wants to have his own business where he can obtain an additional income, working on independent construction projects. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas PROSMA, and he is eager to continue being a part of this community bank for a long time. The $1000 (3000 PEN) loan which he asks for will be invested in the purchase of construction materials in order to perform independent work as a bricklayer.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials and tools

loans.name: Ganiya

texts.en: Ganiya is 29 years old and married with a child. She sells frozen foods. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Pai

texts.en:
Mr. M. Pai, 29, has been a driver for a company for six years. His wife just started selling vegetables in 2009. He is asking for his first loan of $400 to in order to repair the house where he lives.

M. and his wife, Mrs. Savorn Ngin, 26, live along National Road No. 1, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 2000 and have two children: one son and one daughter. All of their children are in school.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 30 years old and sells second-hand shoes in the Gikomba market of Nairobi. Richard has been in this business for 4 years, and previously worked as a shoe shiner.  He has requested his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to increase his stock of shoes. He would like to become an importer one day.  In the future, he would like to educate his children and buy his family a home. Richard describes himself as social and determined. 



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing corn

loans.name: Love Each Other Group

texts.en:
Hawanatu K., Zainab M. B., Aminata K. and Alie T. have formed a group, which they call "Love Each Other." They are entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka, which is about fifteen miles from Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone.

Hawanatu K. (left) is 22 years old, a native of Magburaka and the leader of the group. She is divorced and has one child who is in nursery school. Hawanatu has been selling bowls, buckets, dishes, bags, and sandals for three years now.

This will be Love Each Other's first loan from SMT/Kiva. They will use the funds to expand their businesses and to increase their income, which will allow them to take better care of themselves and their children.

loans.use: To expand the businesses and increase income.

loans.name: José Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo José  son originarias de la comarca  El Jocote zona rural del Masaya. Además todas ellas comercializan sus productos en el mercado de Masaya.  

Alma del Socorro C. tiene quince años vendiendo especie como manzanilla, romero, clavo de olor, canela, chilla y otros tipos de productos. Ella ocupara el crédito para adquirir productos que no tienen y los que ella ya comercializa. 

Cándida Rosa J.  y  Reyna Isabel M. ambas tienen un pequeño tramo cada una de frutas y verduras y el sueño de ellas es poder seguir trabajando y seguir con Adim porque es más seguro y económico.

loans.use: para comprar productos como manzanilla, romero...etc

loans.name: Bhawani

texts.en:
Bhawani B. is a resident of Bhatkepati, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and three children – two sons and one daughter. Both her sons are studying in primary school and her daughter is in pre-primary school.

Both Mr. and Mrs. B. are engaged in poultry and agricultural farming. The couple opened their poultry farm two years ago. They buy all the small chickens and grain feed for the chickens from dealers. The poultry farm has been successful and they earn a good profit from it. Now they are seeking a 25,000 NPR loan to buy more small chickens to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more small chickens

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 52 years old and is married with six children between 25 and 35 years of age. None of her children goes to school. She owns a five-roomed house where she resides with 10 people. Amina takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and eats three meals a day. Amina incurs additional transport costs to and from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda.

Amina works in Owino market, which is in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a stall selling second-hand shoes at both retail and wholesale levels. Amina works seven days a week and has an average of 20 customers a day. Her major business challenges include defaulters, the ever-increasing prices of second-hand shoes, and the rainy season, which hinders her customers ability to reach her. Amina’s monthly expenses include monthly market dues of 40000UGX. She has been in this business for over six years and with MCDT for seven years, servicing her fourteenth loan working with the same group mates. Amina joined MCDT because it was near her home and also was giving loans to poor women .She wants to use this loan to buy more pairs of second-hand shoes. She aspires to a larger business on the wholesale level only.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase the capital in her business of making and selling furniture

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La señora MARIA ESTHER S. D. A. tiene  50 años, cuenta con estudios tècnicos en corte y confecciòn , tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales 3 dependen D. ella econòmicamentey vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II y se dedica a  la preparación y venta D. menús y paralelamente a la siembra d alfalfa, camote y choclo en las chacras que tiene cerca a su casa.
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò  arroz, azúcar, papas, fideos, aceite, menestras, etc.  para la elaboraciòn D. los menús. 
Ahora con su próximo crédito D. 800.00nuevos comprará también 2 sacos D. arroz, 1 saco D. papa y fertilizantes para arar sus chacras.
Ella sueña con tener un restaurante campestre donD. pueda vender platos típicos D. Moche.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Esther Sigueñas D. A. is 50 years old and has taken technical courses in sewing and dressmaking. She has 7 children of whom 3 are still financially dependent. Maria lives in the District of Moche, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú.

She is a member of the Communal Bank Siempre Adelante II (Always Ahead II) and engages in preparing and selling food. At the same time, she grows alfalfa, sweet potatoes, and corn in the fields she owns near her home. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy rice, sugar, potatoes, noodles, oil, dried vegetables, and other ingredients for preparing meals.

Maria is now requesting her next loan of 800 soles to buy two sacks of rice, one sack of potatoes, and fertilizers for her fields. Her dream is to open a rustic style restaurant where she can serve traditional dishes of the Moche region.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her food business & fertilizers to apply to her fields

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred A. lives the village of Mabini, Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mildred owns and operates a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells a range of products to people in her community. She has been in business for more than three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2009, Mildred joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. She has applied for a loan for 5,000 PHP, her first, to buy materials from which to make products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell in her store

loans.name: Guinassoa

texts.fr:
Cette femme a une formation de secrétaire, mais son revenu étant insuffisant, elle a abandonné son emploi en 2006 pour se lancer dans le commerce de détail de pagnes, chaussures, sacs dames, mèches et autres. Ce commerce lui a réussit très bien et elle a gagné de nouveaux clients grâce à son dynamisme. Elle fait face en ce moment à une demande élevée. Pour pouvoir satisfaire tous ses clients elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 05 lots de pagnes Hi Target, 15 sacs dames, 20 paires de chaussures, 03 lots de mèches et divers.
Elle est mariée et a un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman who was trained as a secretary, but her income was not sufficient. She quit her job in 2006 in order to start a business selling "pagnes" (colorful African cloth), shoes, women's handbags, hair extensions, and other items. This business is succeeding very well for her and she has gained a lot of customers thanks to her dynamism. She's currently facing high demand. In order to satisfy all her customers, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy five batches of pagnes "Hi Target", 15 handbags, 20 pairs of shoes, 3 batches of hair extensions, and various other items. She's married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 batches of pagnes, 15 handbags, 20 pairs of shoes, 3 batches of hair extensions, and other items

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo tiene 51 años está casado con doña Marina Alba Gonzales, tienen 3 hijos (25, 22, y 19) años, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos, la hija mayor estudiaba una carrera profesional (Auditoria), pero la necesidad la obligo a salir del país para trabajar, se fue a trabajar a España, por lo tanto dejo de estudiar.

El señor Pablo y su familia viven en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de la maica central, tienen una pequeña casa propia con solamente 2 cuartos, en la todos de alguna manera tienen que estar cómodos.La actividad principal es la producción de la leche cruda, actualmente tienen 6 cabezas de ganado lechero, cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la producción de deferentes productos lácteos.

El préstamo será destinado para compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, con lo cual incrementara la producción de la leche cruda y con ello el nivel de ingresos aumentara y mejorara el nivel de vida.
Entre sus metas y sueños es realizar una construcción nueva de su casa en la cual tenga más habitaciones para que sus hijos puedan estar más cómodos, aumentar la cantidad de ganado lechero y que su hija vuelva de España y pueda terminar de estudiar su carrera.
texts.en:
Pablo, 51, is married to Marina Alba Gonzalez. They have three children (25, 22, and 19). They are a family with scarce economic resources. Their oldest daughter studied for a professional career (Auditor), but necessity obligated her to leave the country to work. She went to Spain to work, and therefore left her studies. Pablo and his family live in the city of Cochabamba in the Maica Central community. They have their own small house with only two rooms in which all of them somehow have to be comfortable. His main activity is producing raw milk. He currently has six head of dairy cows. He delivers his product to a business that produces different dairy products. The loan is to buy a dairy cow, which will increase his raw milk production. This will increase his income and improve his standard of living. Among his goals and dreams is to rebuild his house to have more rooms so that his children can be more comfortable, get more dairy cows, and have his daughter return from Spain and be able to finish her career studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mrs. Mach Pet Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eighteen people who will each use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Mach P. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members who are all located in Veay Chhneah village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Mach P. and her husband, Mr. Trey Mork, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow rice to support their family. However hard this family tries to work, they earn less income than needed. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Mach P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise.

Mrs. Mach P. is the mother of three children, two of whom are waiters in a restaurant, while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Giovanna,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia D. Urubamba ubicada en el departamento D. Cusco a 1 hora D. la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene  34 años D. edad, la socia es conviviente, y tiene 1 hijo D. 4 años; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con la artesanía, la socia manifiesta que este año se casara con su pareja, porque ya pudieron ahorrar un poco D. efectivo; Nuestra socia trabaja en un taller D. artesanía, con más D. 50 empleados elaborando diferentes etapas D. la realización D. la artesanía este taller, abre sus puertas a los turistas para ver todo el proceso desD. la materia prima hasta el proceso final del producto antes D. la venta, al final del recorrido hay una galería para comprar los productos; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para terminar con los acabados D. sus casita propia.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Giovanna is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Solidarios”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, which is in the Department of Cusco and located an hour away from the City of Cusco.

Giovanna is 34 years old, living with her partner, and has a four year old child. She divides her time between her household activities and making handicrafts. Giovanna says that she and her partner will get married this year since they were able to set asiD. a bit of savings. She works at a craft shop with more than 50 employees who are involved in various stages of producing artistic works. The doors of her workshop are open to tourists who can watch the entire process from raw material to the completion of the final product before purchasing an item. At the end of her tour, customers walk into a gallery to buy the products.

Giovanna is requesting a loan so that she can complete the finishing touches on her house. She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete the finishing touches on her house

loans.name: Joao Antonio

texts.pt:
João António D. nasceu no Distrito de Inhassunge, Província de Zambézia, centro de Moçambique tem 42 anos de idade casado e pai de 4 filhos de 13, 8, 5 e 2 anos de idade. Os 3 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais um sobrinho que vive com ele.
Saiu de Zambézia para Cuba quando teve bolsa de estudos em 1983, regressa a Moçambique 8 anos depois e veio directo para Maputo. Trabalha no Ministério do Interior há 18 anos, como técnico processador de dados, não possui empregado e tem um salário mensal de 6.800.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimo no Banco Milenium Bim e não continuou, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus sogros. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, barrotes, chapas de Zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra de construção da sua residência. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 10.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo também para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para iniciar um negócio próprio.
texts.en:
João António D. was born in the District of Inhassunge, Province of Zambezia, in the center of Mozambique. He is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 13, 8, 5 and 2 years old. The older 3 are in school. João studied through 12th grade but didn't continue with his studies because of a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own house with his family, and also takes care of a nephew who lives with them. João left Zambezia for Cuba on a scholarship in 1983. He returned to Mozambique 8 years later and went to Maputo. He has worked at the Ministry of the Interior for 18 years, as a data technician. He doesn't employ any helpers and earns a monthly salary of 6800.00 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also saves some in his bank account. João had taken out loans before with the Banco Milenium Bim, but he decided not to continue with them. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through his parents-in-law. This is his 2nd loan, for the amount of 15,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, sand, support beams, zinc plates and other items) in order to continue working on his home construction project. His earlier loan was for 10,000.00 Meticales and was used for the same purpose. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to start his own business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, support beams, zinc plates and other items)

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan G. is 20 years old and single. She is currently in the business of selling bedsheets and dresses at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets and dresses to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a hotel.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bedsheets and dresses to sell

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús es una persona alegre y optimista, tiene 42 años, y está felizmente casado con Olga de 30 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos y juntos viven en su domicilio propio. Tiene 10 años desempeñando la labor de agricultor, en donde siembra cacao, achote, frutas cítricas, paltas y plátanos, y con ayuda de su hijo el trabajo le es menos pesado. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar paltas, puesto que le gusta este fruto y más aún si estas provienen de sus propias chacras. Hace algunos años quiso generar utilidades para su familia, es por ello que instaló una fabrica de escobas, elaboradas con hojas de árbol, que son muy resistente, vendiéndolas en la tienda de su madre. Ahora quiere enseñar a las personas de su comunidad a criar aves sobre todo una raza de gallina “Ginea”, caracterizado por tener un lindo plumaje; de igual manera desea criar pavos, para que así pueda tener ingresos adicionales y pueda ofrecer mejor beneficio a sus hijos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y considera que le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal, por estar integrado por personas compresivas y unidas que piensan en su progreso como grupo. Con los quinientos soles que solicita, comprará comida, especial para aves y algunos sacos de maíz.
texts.en:
Jesús is a happy, optimistic person. He's 42 years old and happily married to Olga, 30. They have five children and live together in their own home. He's been working as a farmer for 10 years, growing cacao, annatto, citrus, avocados, and plantains, and his son helps him and lightens his workload. His favorite is harvesting avocados, since he likes to eat them, especially if they come from his own farm. A few years ago he wanted to produce more profits for his family, so he set up a broom-making workshop, making the brooms out of strong dried leaves and selling them in his mother's store. Now he wants to show the members of his community how to raise Guinea hens, known for their lovely plumage, and he'd also like to raise turkeys to bring in more income and offer a better life to his children. This is fifth loan with MFP. He likes working with his communal bank, since its members are sympathetic team players who think about how to move forward as a group. He will use the 500 soles he's requesting to buy feed for his fowl, as well as a few sacks of corn.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed and sacks of corn

loans.name: Amigas De Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es:
Justina Mayta de 32 años, vive en la Zona German Busch de la ciudad de El Alto, hace 3 años aproximadamente, ella se dedica a vender  pescado, tiene su propio lugar de venta en Río Seco, frente a un surtidor y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas como: la venta de pescado, sombreros, comida, ropa, calzados, tejido de polleras (falda para mujer originaria), tejido de alfombras y confección de mantas.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir y mejorar sus negocios
texts.en:
Justina Mayta, age 32, lives in the German Busch area of the city of El Alto. She has been selling fish for approximately three years. She has her own place where she sells. It is in Río Seco in front of the gas station. She needs the loan to buy merchandise. The other members of this communal bank have economic activities like selling fish, hats, food, clothes, footwear, knitting “polleras” (skirts worn by indigenous women), weaving carpets, or making blankets. They all need the loan to invest in their businesses and to improve them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en: Four people from Preak Raing village in Kandal province make up this group loan. All the members will use the loan for different purposes to help improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Somaly S. is the group leader, and she has been selected by all the members. She is a house wife who makes delicious food to support her family and to help her husband, Mr. Kim Sang Yeng, who is a security guard. Her problem is that her motorbike is too old to use. So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Somaly S. is seeking a loan to buy a new motorbike. She is a mother and her child  is enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia R. is from the coastal town of Talim, Binangonan, Rizal. She is 52 and married and with three children. Ofelia sells fish in her village and nearby town. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a week. In 2008, Ofelia joined ASHI to secure access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASHI which was used to purchase fishing equipment. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fishnets and bamboos. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ofelia from ASHI. She plans to use the additional proceeds to develop her business. She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and KIVA, she can reach her ambition to move out from poverty, expand her fishing business, and pay for the education of her youngest daughter.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishnets and bamboos.

loans.name: Fauza Judas

texts.pt:
Fauza Judas S. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 6 filhos de idades entre 11 e 26 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez o ensino primário não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 3 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.
