Saiu de Maputo para Boane quando ficou viúva do seu primeiro marido. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 25 anos de venda de tabaco em fardos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 12.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (sacos de tabaco) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram no valor de 12.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na melhoria do seu negócio.
texts.en:
Fauza Judas S. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is married and has 6 children, who are between 11 and 26 years old. All of them go to school. Fauza only completed elementary school; she did not continue due to a lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her family and supports 3 nieces and nephews who live with her. She left Maputo for Boane when she became widowed after the death of her first husband. She has had her own business selling bundles of tobacco for more than 25 years. She does not have any employees and earns about 12,000 MZN each month, which she uses to pay for expenses. She is even able to save some in her bank account. Fauza never has had loans with other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her 3rd loan, which has a value of 20,000 MZN. She plans to use it to buy products (sacks of tobacco) to increase her stock. The previous loans were for 12,000 MZN and 15,000 MZN, both for the same purpose. She promises to pay back the loan on time so that she will be able to have access to others. In the future, she intends to request more loans to help improve her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products (sacks of tobacco)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase leather, cowhide, iron and acid

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly A. is from the village of Olango. She is 42 years old and is married with five school-aged children. Merly owns and operates a business providing recycling services, hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Merly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase used bottles and newspapers to sell. Merly is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase used bottles and newspapers to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used bottles and newspapers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married woman and mother of one young child. She lives in Lebanon.  She has established an accounting business to help provide various types of reports for members of her community and for some companies. With the US $700 she requested from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., she will purchase a laptop to better market her services and increase the liquidity of her business. She’s certain that with the new laptop, she will deliver her services faster to her clients. She is expecting to expand her business and is very confident that she will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming years. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase a laptop

loans.name: C4509 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Josiane is 29 years old and is married with four children. She is the leader of this group called Abizeranye which is well-known in the business of sewing different styles of clothes. Their business hours are from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day.

Josiane and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company and they really hope that, once this loan is disbursed to them, they will be able to purchase more clothing items and sewing machines. If successful, they will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow them to keep expanding their business till they become financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing items and additional sewing machines

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 34 años de edad, convive con su actual pareja, y fruto de ellos tienen tres hijos; Tany, Roy y Jhon, de 14, 7 y 2 años respectivamente. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de san francisco, donde tienen su propia casa. Raúl asegura que las técnicas de riego y de cultivo que aprendió de sus padres lo ayudaron mucho y por tal se muestra agradecido con ellos, ya que le permitió mejorar la calidad de piña que cultiva, y eso le da mucha ventaja para su comercialización, Está feliz por los buenos resultados económicos que sigue recibiendo, por ello desea adquirir nuevos terrenos para aumentar la producción de piña. Normalmente trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja, pero en temporada de cosecha, tiene a cargo de sus peones con la finalidad de que lo puedan extraer y trasladar su producto de piña, hacia los centros de acopio de su misma localidad, para su respectiva venta.  Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera oportuna, además tiene un buen concepto de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en darle mantenimiento a sus plantaciones de piña, con el propósito de que preserve la calidad de su producto.
texts.en:
34-year-old Raúl lives with his wife and their three children: Tany, Roy and Jhon aged 14, 7 and 2 respectively. They live in the beautiful Ayacuchana jungle, in the town of San Francisco, where they own their own home. Raúl maintains that the irrigation and farming techniques that his parents taught him have helped them a lot. That’s why he has been very grateful to them. They have allowed him to improve the quality of the pineapple he grows, giving his business an advantage.
He is happy with his business’s continued success, which is why he wants to acquire new land to increase his pineapple production. He usually works together with his wife, but at harvest time he hires labourers to pick and transport his produce to the local collection centres to then sell on.
This is his first MFP loan, which he is committed to repaying on time. Furthermore, he respects and is committed to his communal bank. He plans to invest the requested loan in maintaining his pineapple crops in order to preserve the produce’s quality.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his pineapple crops

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a dairy farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. He has been farming for the last 10 years. His mixed farm produces milk which, he sells through Kenya Cooperative Creameries, and tea which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority. He is 37 years old and married with a nine-year-old child who is currently in school.

John has requested this loan of 60,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter and a water pump. He says that these assets will help save time looking for animal feed and water so increasing production. His biggest challenges are poor markets and lack of enough funds to purchase a pure breed since they are very expensive. In future, he hopes to process and package his own milk.

He comments that Juhudi is doing a commendable job with small-scale farmers by funding their projects.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter and a water pump.

loans.name: Jackline Akinyi

texts.en:
Jackline is married and they have three children whom they support.

Jackline joined KADET through other group members. She is servicing a third loan and has been repaying successfully.  She has been in the clothing business for 10 years with a good income at the end of each month. With this loan, Jackline plans to purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes for her stall.

With the profits, Jackline will open another clothes outlet. She hopes her business will succeed so that she can meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, estado civil casada, grado de instrucción segundo de primaria, con cuatro hijos de y uno a su cargo.
Elvira viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace seis años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de s/. 300.00 nuevo soles,  el cual invirtió en la compra de insumos para preparar el delicioso jugo de Quinua que a diario vende.
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá comprar los insumos por mayor para su negocio de venta de jugo de quinua.
Su sueño es tener una librería.  Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la unión y los regalos que se compran por navidad y por día de la madre.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the Communal Bank “Gran Poder” (Great Power), which is located in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and has a second grade education. Elvira has four children, one of whom is still in her care.

She started working with Manuela Ramos six years ago. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 300 PEN, which she invested in the purchase of supplies for preparing the delicious quinoa juice that she sells every day.

Elvira is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 1000 PEN so that she can buy supplies in bulk for her quinoa juice business. Her dream is to open a bookstore. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the unity and the gifts that are exchanged for Christmas and Mother’s Day.

loans.use: Purchase supplies in bulk

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 21 años, vive en casa de sus padres al lado de sus padres y su hermana. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte con el carro que alquila diariamente  y luego por las noches devuelve el carro a la cochera del propietario. Él dispone todo el día para trabajar, incluido los fines de semana, es muy prudente con el trabajo que realiza, siempre respeta los límites de velocidad, además ofrece un buen trato a su clientela que le permite tener mas ganancias y mayor  tiempo de trabajo útil del auto que maneja. Su deseo es tener su propio carro y con el tiempo tener una flota de autos donde pueda administrar y ganar más. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento del carro en el que trabaja.
texts.en: Jesus is 21 years old and lives in his parents' home with his parents and his sister. He has been providing transportation services for 3 years with a car that he rents daily. In the evenings he returns the car to the owner's garage. He works all day including weekends and is very careful in the work that he does. He always respects the speed limits. In addition, he treats his customers well which allows him to obtain greater profits and to spend more useful time in the car that he drives. He wants to have his own car and to eventually have his own fleet of cars that he can manage and thus earn more. This is the first loan he has obtained through field partner MFP. He is happy to know that he can count on their financial support and it makes him glad to be part of his community bank because all of its members are responsible and supportive. He thanks all the people that will fund this loan as it will be very useful in his business' progress. He will invest the loan he is requesting in purchasing spare parts for his car's maintenance.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his car.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma Ramirez F. is a 64-year-old mother of four who lives with her husband and daughter in Limón, located in the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. She has a business selling natural medicinal products containing vitamins. This loan will go towards the purchase of various types of items, an example of which can be seen in the picture.

In the mornings Irma performs her housekeeping duties such as cooking, cleaning, etc. Then in the afternoons Irma dedicates herself to her business: making sales, collecting repayments or purchasing merchandise. The majority of her clients are friends, acquaintances and neighbors from her community. Irma makes sales from door to door, but also has clients come visit her at home.

The loan consultant that has been working with Irma over the years describes her as an amicable, hardworking and humble entrepreneur. The majority of household expenses are covered by the income of her husband and daughter. This has allowed Irma to reinvest the revenues from her business into her business.

With the support of her husband and children, Irma has reaped the benefits of a successful business. In the past, Irma has proven to be an exemplary client, punctual and responsible with respect to loan repayments. This will be her fourth loan with Fundación Mujer.

loans.use: For the purchase of natural medicinal products

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 45 years old. She operates Ebenezer, a business that houses several businesses like tailoring, dressmaking, and embroidery. This business is eight years old and is located in a busy environment. 

She is requesting a loan of 25,000 KES to add stocks of fabric for 10,000 KES, a knitting machine for 10,000 KES and knitting thread for 5,000 KES. She is polite and humble and hopes to own a tailoring and dressmaking college in the future. Since joining Faulu, Rose's business has grown since Faulu has given her loans to buy machines for her business.

loans.use: To buy fabric, a knitting machine, and knitting thread

loans.name: Maria Riza

texts.en:
Maria Riza B. is from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 24 years old. Maria Riza is single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Maria Riza owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling semi-gold-plated products such as necklaces and bracelets in the local community. Maria Riza has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maria Riza joined the Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Riza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maria Riza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Tanatar

texts.en:
Tanatar K. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home and fence. His oldest son works while two younger children both attend a local school. 

Tanatar operates a small wooden products production business in his home where he produces a variety of wooden items such as beds, chairs, tables and doors. He has been engaged this business for the past eight years and has gained significant experience during that time. In the future, he says, " I want to establish my own carpentry factory." 

He plans to buy a large amount of wood and timbers for the production of his wooden items, so he is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies and materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and materials

loans.name: Reymon

texts.en:
Reymon D. R. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 22 years old. Reymon is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Reymon owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services to local community members. Reymond's wife sells fish like milkfish and sardines in the public market. Reymon has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Reymon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reymon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Reymon is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Reymon from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Sinh

texts.en: Sinh T.  V. is 58 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are married. She makes a living by running a small restaurant where she makes and serves breakfast. She started this business in 2004, after securing her first microfinance loan from our organization. Her business is doing well, and she is applying for a new loan, for 6,233,000 VND to buy the equipment she needs to expand her restaurant and serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for a small restaurant.

loans.name: Mavluda's Group

texts.en:
Our next creditor is a young mother with big ideas and ambitions but small opportunities. She believes in her potential to set her life on a new stage and a new path. 

Mavluda T., 25, is the leader of this group. She’s a resident of a very small town in the southern Kyrgyzstan, Nookat, with a population of over 13,000 people. She was born and grew up here and wants to spend the rest of her life here because she knows it’s the best place for her children. Mavluda’s husband Dastan is a successful musician and the main breadwinner of the family. 

They feel blessed to have two daughters of 5 and 3 years old. Last year when the kids were accepted to a daycare, Mavluda needed an occupation to devote her whole daytime. Being a mother has taught her good lessons of choosing the right products for her girls. So she ended up with the idea of selling children’s clothing. She can easily find common language with other mothers who look for the best clothing for their children. The business was started from 1, 000 soms taken from a family’s savings. For now Mavluda receives 7,500 soms of profit every month, most of which she puts back into goods circulation. Mavluda requested a loan from Kiva with intentions of satisfying her consumer needs. In the nearest future the family would like to renew the apartment lease.

       --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To meet her customer's needs and also help pay her lease.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
La señora Kelly, es socia del banco comunal La Lupuna, del Distrito de Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y está gestando de su primer bebe y eso le da más fuerza para seguir trabajando, para poder darle lo mejor a su hijo.
Lleva tres años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela  Ramos y se dedica al servicio de taxis (transporte)  porque en el distrito que vive, el taxi en motocar es un buen negocio.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/.2,000.00 se comprará un motocar de segunda mano, para ponerlo también a trabajar y poder pagar las cuotas a Manuela Ramos.
Manuela Ramos le dio la oportunidad para poder iniciar un negocio y lo ha sabido aprovechar muy bien, su esposo es docente en un Colegio de la zona y juntos están trabajando para esperar al bebe que viene en camino y darle todo lo que necesite.
texts.en: Kelly is a member of La Pupuna comunal bank from the district of Manantay, a department of Ucayali.  She is 31 years old, married, and is pregnant with her first baby which gives her more strength to continue working in order to be able to give the best to her child.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos loans for three years and works providing taxi service (transport) because in the district where she lives, motorcar taxi is a good business.  With this new loan of 2,000.00 (PEN) she will purchase a used motorcar and also put it to work in order to be able to pay her Manuela Ramos loan.  Manuela Ramos has given her the opportunity to start a business and she has known how to take good advantage of it.  Her husband is a teacher in a school in the area and together they work as they await the baby that is in route in order to give it all it needs.

loans.use: Purchase a used motorcar

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran, who resides in Jaranwala, a small city of Punjab Pakistan known for its agriculture industry, has been living with her family in a two-room brick house in the area called Sultan Park for the past three years. Having given birth to two sons, neither of whom is yet old enough to attend school, she spends her time at home discharging her household responsibilities.

Bashiran's husband operates an animal-selling business, purchasing and raising young goats and sheep and then selling them to butchers for profit. Bashiran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband to buy more goats and sheep, confident that the investment will enable his business to grow.

A regular loan user of Asasah, this is Bashiran's fourth loan application. She is a responsible client and has a good credit record.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bashiran.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for her husband's animal-sales business

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina, de 40 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Rolando de 41, quien es agricultor,  y de sus 2 hijos menores, de los 3 que tiene, debido a que el mayor estudia en la ciudad y es independiente. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura, siembra flores como el gladiolo, asimismo lechuga y arvejas, junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Todos los días las faenas agrícolas son muy tediosas, pero dice que el trabajo le gusta mucho porque sabe bien todas las técnicas para sembrar en cantidad y con calidad; lo que no le gusta mucho es que muchas veces toda una siembra se pierde por las plagas, pero con la practica se aprende como sembrar cada vez mejor. Dice que cuando es tiempo de cosecha trabaja más para recoger toda la producción, pero como es una labor conjunta con los miembros de su familia se hace en menos tiempo. Como es una dama muy emprendedora que siempre ha trabajado para salir adelante, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, pues quiere aumentar sus ganancias. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además dice que esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo, pues esta compuesto por  mujeres trabajadoras como ella, que buscan salir adelante a base de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Albina tiene pensado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono, así como semillas de flores de gladiolos, que necesita para la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Albina, 40, lives in her own house with her husband, Rolando, 41, who is a farmer, and their two minor children.  They have three children total but the oldest is studying in the city and is independent.

This hard working woman is a farmer.  She grows flowers, like gladiolas, and also lettuce and peas with her husband and children.  The daily farm chores are very tedious but she says that she likes the work very much because she knows all the planting techniques needed to plant in quantity and in quality.  What she doesn’t like very much is that the crops are sometimes lost due to infestations but with practice one learns how to plant better each time.  She says that during harvest time she works more to gather the entire crop but, since it’s a job done together with her family members, it’s completed in less time.  Because she’s an enterprising woman who has always worked hard to get ahead, she plans to plant larger amounts in the future because she wants to increase profits.

This is her 4th loan with MFP and she is very grateful to the people who made the loan possible that will allow her to continue working.  She also says that she’s very satisfied with the work of her group because it’s made up of hard working women like her who seek to get ahead through their own efforts and work.  Albina plans to use the requested loan to buy manure and gladiola seeds that she needs for the next planting cycle.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and gladiola seeds.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La señora María dolores  P. L., es madre soltera con un hijo a su responsabilidad de nombre  Deiser  de veinti tres años de edad que  también la apoya con los ingresos de la casa.

      Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su mini tienda de abarrotes, en la que lleva  diez a años y ocho meses, que con eso que saco adelante a su familia, dando les una buena educación para que puedan sostenerse.

     Ella comenzó con esta actividad por su propia  voluntad ya que quería darles lo mejor a sus hijos que venían creciendo  y gracias adiós le fue bien porque sigue con su pequeño trabajo  que comenzó de poco en poco y ahora lo ve mejor.

     Lo que más desea es tener un lugar más amplio para  poder surtir mejor su negocio con cosas que su clientela requiere comprar.
texts.en:
María Dolores P. L. is a single mother responsible for her 23-year-old son named Deiser. He also helps with the household income.

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock her mini-grocery store. She has had this business for 10 years and 8 months and uses it as a means to get her family ahead in life, providing them with a good education so that they can support themselves.

She started this business herself because she wanted to give the best to her children who were growing up. Thanks to God, she did well because she continues with her small business that she started little by little.

What she wants most is to have a larger space to be able to better stock her business with items that her customers need to buy.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like oil, beans, flour, sugar, etc. to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Norsiana

texts.en:
Norsiana, a 27-year-old married mother of two children who are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. The operator of a buy and sell crab/shrimp business in the Philippines. Norsiana is requesting a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more crab and shrimp to sell.

Norsiana has been in this business for five years and would like to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more crab and shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Manolita

texts.en:
Manolita is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 66 years old, married and has 6 adult-aged children. Manolita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages,  shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Manolita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Manolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manolita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and beverages. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Manolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 21 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Prossy has a pig production business, which she has run for three years. She also has a second business making mats.
To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more pigs for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her access more capital, which has improved her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for resale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 46 años reside en el caserío de Antabamba, se caracteriza por ser un padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Aquilina de 42 años y sus 4 menores hijos, a quienes protege y cuida con mucho amor. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Víctor sale a trabajar en sus campos, para él no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente en el cuidado de sus cultivos para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son, papa y arveja, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus sembríos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que afectan a sus plantaciones. Para el futuro, desea comprar un carro con el cual pueda transportar sus productos. Además de ayudarle en el trasladado de su mercadería de compra y venta de granos verdes en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Según cuenta cuando llega esta temporada los precios de venta son muy altos, por ello comercializa los granos verdes en la capital del país donde obtiene un mejor pago por la venta de los mismos. Su principal dificultad es conseguir capital para invertir la mayor parte de su ganancia en la siembra y en su negocio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los pinos de Antabamba” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo financiero para el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Víctor de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ganados como: toros y vacas, aprovechando que esta temporada no hay cosecha,  para poder criarlos y cebarlos para lograr revenderlos a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Victor, age 46, resides in the village of Antabamba. He is known as a humble and hardworking father. Victor lives in his own home with his wife Aquilina, age 42, and their four young children who they protect and care for with much love. Every day, early in the morning, Victor leaves to work in the fields. For him, there are no days to rest because he must work continually to care for his crops so that he can have good production. His main products are potatoes and peas, which he sells in bulk in the city of Tarma. What he enjoys most about his job is the freedom he experiences working among his crops. He is able to freely enjoy a stroll through his green fields. Victor has been farming for 30 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting his crops from swarms of insects that can affect their growth. In the future, he wants to buy a car so that he can transport his products to the wholesale market in Tarma. According to Victor, when prices are the highest, he sells his vegetables in the capital so that he can obtain the most earnings. His main difficulty has been setting aside enough capital from his earnings to invest in the planting season and in his business.

Victor is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Pinos de Antabamba” (The Pines of Antabamba) and will be receiving his sixth loan with MFP. He hopes that this financial support will help him achieve his goals. Once again, he promises to complete his repayments on time just as he did with his previous loans. Victor is pleased to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. With this support, Victor will invest the money he requested in the purchase of cattle including bulls and cows. He plans to take advantage of this season to raise and fatten cattle since there are no crops to harvest. Victor hopes to resell the cattle at a good price.

loans.use: to purchase a bull and a cow.

loans.name: Salvador Antonio

texts.es: Salvador Antonio tiene 43 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de repuestos de vehículos usados. Es un hombre muy responsable por lo que disfruta de obtener un medio de ingreso desde  hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindar un buen servicio a  sus clientes. Ha sido con el paso del tiempo y con la ayuda de los financiamientos que ha logro salir adelante pues han sido de gran apoyo para su negocio. Actualmente el solicita este financiamiento para la compra de llaves, llantas, baterías, caja de cambios, tablero y otros productos. Su deseo es remodelar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Salvador Antonio, 43, sells used car parts for a living.  He is a very responsible man who has enjoyed working in this business for over seven years, always giving his customers good service.  Over time and with the help of the loans, which have been a great support for his business, he has been able to get ahead.

He plans to use the current loan to buy keys, tires, batteries, a gearbox, boards and other products.  His goal is to renovate his house to improve living conditions.

loans.use: To buy keys, tires, batteries, a gearbox, boards and other products.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 29 years old, is a cake seller. Her husband is an ice-cream seller and their combined income is $6 per day. They have two children, 1 and 4 years old. Every month, Sokha spends $25 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on transportation and $10 on other expenses.

Sokha would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike to sell her cakes. Sokha plans to repair her house when she can save enough money. She wants to send her children to study at university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to sell her cakes

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, tiene la edad de 31 años, está separada  y vive con sus 2 hijos y que son su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de alimentos para la crianza de cerdos. Ella cuenta con un proyecto de cría de cerdos para su posterior venta a nivel local. Ella quiere tener los animales con buen alimento para engordarlos antes del tiempo establecido. Ella quiere generara ganancias con la ventas de sus cerdos para tener un bienestar familiar mejor y un nivel de vida mejor con sus hijos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Silvia, 31, is separated and lives with her two children who are her greatest priority.  She intends to use the loan to buy feed to raise pigs.  She has a project to raise pigs for subsequent sale locally.  She wants to feed the pigs good feed to fatten them up more quickly than usual.  She wants to generate profits from the sale of her pigs to have improved family wellbeing and a better standard of living with her children.

This is the first loan she’s gotten from Fudecosur.   She has not had any loans previously from state banks but Fudecosur provided a loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one school-aged child. He has been working as a mechanic for the past eight years. In 2007, he opened his own garage. He is specialized in repairing car body-work. He is the main income provider of the family. 

With his requested loan of $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will purchase mechanicA. tools and supplies. He has stated that the loan will help him increase his profits by 10%. He is very positive and hopes to be able to better support his family financially.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical tools and supplies.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with a grown son. She lives and runs her business in the central market of her home town of Pavlograd. She sells office supplies, household items and other retail items. Her kiosk is located right at the entrance to the marketplace, which makes it a favorable spot for many potential customers. Ludmila has been working in this sphere of trade for six years. Presently, she has 40,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. 

Ludmila has proved to be a reliable borrower with a stable business. She is always very customer-friendly. This time she is requesting a 17,500 Grivnya loan to purchase assorted merchandise for the coming school season. Ludmila owns two vending locations and is hoping to re-stock them with inventory using the current loan.

loans.use: to purchase assorted merchandise for the coming school season

loans.name: Espiga Y Luna Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Espiga y Luna está conformado por la señora Marlen va a comprar con su crédito ropa interior para dama y caballero, la señora Lucia va a comprar garrafones de agua, la señorita Miriam Karina va a comprar ropa Americana por paca, la señora Armanda va a comprar zapatos por catalogo para dama, caballero y niño. La señora Lucia tiene 34 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria. Ella es casada tiene 2 hijo un varón de 15 años de edad y una niña de 13 años de edad ellos estudian la secundaria, ella vende garrafones de agua purificada, ella solicito su crédito para comprar garrafones de agua, ella inicio su negocio hace 8 meses le dan credito de una semana, como su esposo trabaja en la embotelladora de agua, ella le dijo que le llevara garrafones de agua para vender. Su negocio es importante porque vende bien los garrafones de agua, es un trabajo honrado y está en su casa puede atender a sus hijos y a sus sobrinos que también viven en su casa. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que sus hijos estudien y que su negocio siga creciendo, ella está contenta con su préstamo por la oportunidad de crecer su negocio comprando más garrafones de agua. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos sus préstamos gracias a ustedes podemos realizar nuestros sueños de crecer los negocios”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is  called Espiga y Luna. It is  made up of: Señora Marlen who with her part of the loan is going to buy ladies' and men's underwear; Señora Lucia who is going to buy demijohns of water; Ms Miriam Karina who is going to buy used clothes by the bale; Señora Armanda who is going to buy ladies', children's and men's shoes by catalogue.

Señora Lucia is 34 years old. She studied up to third grade of high school. She is married and has two children, a boy 15 years old and a girl 13 years old. They both attend high school. She sells demijohns of purified water. She is asking for the loan to buy demijohns of water. She started her business 8 months ago. As her husband works at the water bottling factory, they give her a week's credit so she told him to bring her some demijohns of water to sell. Her business is important because the demijohns of water sell well; it is honest work and allows her to work from home so she can take care of her children and nephews who also live in her house. Her hopes and dreams are that her children study and that her business continues to grow. She is happy with the loan and for the opportunity of growing her business by buying more demijohns of water. 

The group members want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad that they "are grateful for your loans as because of you we can realize our dreams of growing our businesses" (“les agradecemos sus préstamos gracias a ustedes podemos realizar nuestros sueños de crecer los negocios”).

loans.use: to buy demijohns of purified water.

loans.name: Los 4 Fantasticos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  los 4 fantásticos , L. mayoría D. sus integrantes  son vecinas D. L. misma localidad .L. representante D. este grupo es L. señora  Dulce Esperanza   D. 42 años D. edad esta felizmente casada con el señor Victoriano Hugo  , se hizo D. su negocio para poder sacar a delante a sus hijos y prepararlos para el futuro.
L. señora Dulce Esperanza  fue quien invito a las otras personas a formar parte  D. este grupo ; elL. se dedica a L. venta D.  D. ropa desD. hace aproximadamente cuatro años  , tiene su  local  y  brinda sus servicios desD. las 10:00 D. L. mañana hasta las 6:00 D. L. tarD.  D. lunes a sábado vente ropa para  caballero niñas y niños .
Tiene L. cantidad D. tres hijos  una mujer y dos varones.
Estudio hasta L. secundaria terminada , los domingos venD. cenas en su casa como son: tacos dorados, quesadillas y sopes, es una señora muy trabajadora le gusta salir adelante y esforzarse para lograr sus sueños .
ElL. pidió el préstamo para  comprar mas ropa  como es : pantalón para caballero, camisas, bermudas , short y vestidos .
Uno D. sus sueños es seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que terminen una licenciatura y puedan cumplir sus sueños.
Las integrantes que forman parte D. este grupo son:
Marco Antonio- se dedica a L. venta  D. carne.
Juan -  se dedica a L. venta D. ropa.
Magdalena – se dedica a L. venta D. borrego.
Geronimo- se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes.
Victorio- se dedica a L. venta  D. refrescos.
Josefina - se dedica a L. venta D.  abarrotes.
Esperanza – se dedica a L. venta D. antojitos mexicanos.
KeiL. Ibeth - se dedica a L. venta D. carne .
Martha- se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes.
A Le dan las gracias a fundación realidad por el apoyo que las ha dado para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y por ser parte D. este milagro para tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
This group calls itself the fantastic four. Most of the members are neighbors from the same area. The representative from this group is Dulce Esperanza, 42, who is happily married to Victoriano Hugo and they have 3 children, one daughter and two sons. She started her business to be able to help her children get ahead and prepare them for the future. She finished high school. 

Dulce Esperanza invited the others to form this group. She has been selling clothing for 4 years. She has a store that is open from 10:00am to 6:00pm Monday through Saturday. She sells clothes for men and children. On Sundays she sells dinners out of her home like fried tacos, quesadillas and soups. She is a very hardworking woman who likes to move forward and work hard to achieve her dreams. 

She asked for this loan to buy more clothing like: men's pants, shirts, bermuda shorts and dresses. One of her dreams is to keep supporting her children until they get a college degree and can achieve their dreams. 

The other members of the group are:

Marco Antonio- sells meat
Juan -  sells clothing
Magdalena – sells lambs.
Geronimo- sells groceries.
Victorio- sells sodas.
Josefina - sells groceries.
Esperanza – sells Mexican snacks.
KeiL. Ibeth - sells meat.
Martha- sells groceris.

They thank the Fundacion Realidad for the support it has given them to get ahead and achieve their dreams, and for being part of this miracle in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to sell pants, bermuda shorts, shirts and dresses.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is a married woman with two children, one attends school while the other one is still young for school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a cereal selling business, supplying retail to schools and retail shop operators. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Rodah dreams of establishing a cereals shop in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase eight sacks of beans to resell. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase eight sacks of beans to resell.

loans.name: Diamoral Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 29 MAI 2001. Il est composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le même village. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Fatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de dix enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge un enfants confié par son frère.

Elle s’active dans la vente de poissons séchés. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de six ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'accroitre ses revenu en achetant plus de marchandises (poissons séchés)

Les bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was set up on 29th May 2001. It is made up of 15 women who live in the same village. Their main activity is trading.

Fatou, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is in charge of the group. She is 54 years old, married and mother to ten children. She also has another child entrusted to her care by her brother.

She has a fish-selling activity and has good experience in this domain having done it for more than six years.

This loan will enable her to increase her income by buying more stock (dried fish). The profits she makes will allow her to help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish

loans.name: Chansom

texts.en: Chansom, 27 years old, is a grocery seller who earns $6 per day. Her husband works for the government and earns $3 per day. They have three children; all are studying. Every month, she has to spend $77 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fee, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $300 to add to her money to buy a small car for her husband to travel to work and for other uses for the family. She plans to extend her grocery store to sell more kinds of products.

loans.use: To buy a small car for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Saybi

texts.ru: Сайби проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Возраст, 58 лет. Вдова. У нее двое детей. Уже шесть лет как она занимается торговлей на рынке. Сайби занимается торговлей тканей. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей.
texts.en: Saybi lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube.  She is 58 years, a widow and has two children.  Saybi has been involved in retail sales at the market for six years and sells fabrics.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a twenty-three year-old lady from Kilgoris County, Kenya. She is married to John and they have two children between two and four years old.

She operates a cereal selling business at a Megwara location and has been doing this for the last two years making a profit of Kes 10,000. She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD and will use it to buy more cereal for sale. 

Her profits will go towards buying basic needs for her family like foodstuff, clothing and providing good shelter.

loans.use: to buy maize cereal to sell.

loans.name: Weoya Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Weoya SHG Group in Western Kenya! James is the facilitator of the Weoya SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

James takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family and be able to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure proper yield from his farm. In the recent 2011 season, James had a very good maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, James was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to James  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, James will educate his children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Weoya SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

James is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Robin

texts.en:
Robin is a hardworking father. He and his wife have three young children. Two attend elementary school.

He cultivates a two-hectare rice field in Carilucud, Solana, Cagayan. Together with his wife, they plant rice seeds and sell to traders upon maturity and harvest. They are both involved in this business as the only source of their income. They did not even seek other employment so they patiently do farming activities.
 
He is now asking for a loan to pay for field plowing and to buy seeds to grow. He needs PHP 30,000. He hopes that this loan will be granted to him as the way to improve his business and his family's standard of living as well.

loans.use: to pay for field plowing and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Domina

texts.en: Domina is 29-years-old and married to a driver. She has 3 children aged 3 to 7. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for 4 years. Domina would like a loan to buy beans and sorghum to sell in her shop. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children and to create savings. She dreams to one day own a motorbike to help her business.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for selling.

loans.name: Maternidad

texts.en:
Maternidad is a widow with 8 children. Maternidad is 74 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Maternidad is a farmer and grows rice and corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers. 

Maternidad has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells "Akyikie", a local food made out of maize. She lives at Benkyadze with her husband who is a farmer and their seven dependents.   Ekua has been doing this work for some time now. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general up-keep of their family. 

Ekua will use her loan to purchase maize for the preparation of her "Akyikie" for sale. With the new profit Ekua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize for the preparation of her "Akyikie" for sale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is forty-four years old. She is single and a mother of two children, and she sells clothes in Oloitoktok. Nancy has been in the business for eleven years now and gets a monthly income of eight thousand shillings.

This will be Nancy’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more clothes for sale, and with the profit that she will get, she wants to expand her clothes shop. 

In future she wants to expand her business into a boutique.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 40 years old. He is married with 4 children aged 13 and 20 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a goat.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Wilmar Orlando

texts.es:
Wilmar es un joven campesino de 22 años que recién ha egresado de prestar el servicio militar a la Republica de Colombia. Luego de haber realizado esta valerosa labor con nuestra patria llega a casa de sus padres, una pequeña parcela con alta potencialidad para el desarrollo de un proyecto turístico el cual consiste en un balneario y lugar de recreación, esparcimiento y descanso para los habitantes de la región, dada su ubicación estratégica en un corredor turístico donde se encuentran paisajes naturales, riachuelos y fincas ubicadas a unos 3 kilómetros de la población urbana.
Teniendo en cuenta esta oportunidad de negocio, Wilmar y su familia han iniciado lentamente el desarrollo de su proyecto, acondicionando los terrenos y realizando el aprovechamiento de la fuente hídrica que por allí pasa, convirtiendo su parcela en un lugar agradable para las actividades antes descritas.  Como valor agregado esta familia pretende ofrecer a los visitantes el servicio de restaurante con menús típico de esta región como son el sancocho de gallina criolla y pescado preparado en diferentes recetas; los cuales son criados dentro de la parcela y preparados a sus clientes.
Aunque las instalaciones no son las más adecuadas, esta familia ha venido desarrollando sus actividades en la medida en que los ingresos percibidos les ha permitido hacerlo, pero actualmente se presenta una gran necesidad, la cual consiste en adecuar y ampliar la cocina, siendo esta la principal localidad para el servicio de restaurante, ya que las condiciones de diseño afectan la seguridad, higiene y salubridad del proceso de preparación de los alimentos, y no se cuenta con el recurso económico suficiente para emprender dicho trabajo.

loans.use: Para construir  una cocina adecuada para la preparación de los alimentos ofrecidos en su negocio, por ende el   mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de WILMAR y su familia.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Joseph. He is 76 years old, married and a father of 5 children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training.
He is a mixed farmer where he farms maize, beans, peas, cassava, vegetables and tomatoes. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide in order to increase his production hence more income. He will use the anticipated income to provide for his family’s basic needs such as food and clothing. 
Joseph is grateful to kiva and its lenders for the financial help and promises to repay promptly

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides that will lead to increase in production hence more income to provide food and clothing for his family.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena lives in the community of Santo Domingo in the state of Nuevo Leon. Ten years ago she started her small business selling clothes, as her husband abandoned her, and back then her three kids were still under age. She found herself in need and looked for a business that would generate the necessary income to raise her children, as an aside from her other job working in a company. Years later, Maria Elena's children have professional careers and they help her purchase merchandise. She has managed this with a base of great effort, integrity and the love of her family.

The daily struggles have not been easy in any way, but nonetheless she managed to reach her goal with the moral support of her children. Now she requires a loan in the amount of $1025 that she will use to purchase merchandise in greater quantities and keep her business growing. Do not wait. Support Maria Elena. She will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Elena vive en la comunidad de Santo Domingo, en el estado de Nuevo León , ella hace 10 años comenzó con un negocio pequeño de venta de ropa, pues su esposo la abandono, en ese entonces sus tres hijos aún eran menores de edad y ella se vio en la necesidad de buscar un actividad que le pudiera generar los ingresos necesarios para poder mantener a sus hijos, además del salario que ganaba en su trabajo de planta, pues con éste no era necesario. Después de muchos años transcurridos, los hijos de María Elena son profesionistas y le ayudan a surtir la mercancía para le venta de la ropa, y esto lo ha logrado a base de esfuerzo , enteraza y amor a sus familia.

La lucha diaria no ha sido fácil en ningún sentido, sin embargo ella ha sabido lograr sus objetivo con el apoyo moral de sus hijos, ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por una cantidad de $ 1025 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para comprar una mayor cantidad de mercancía y continuar creciendo con su negocio. No lo dudes más y apoya a María Elena, ella te lo va a agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Maa Nora sells tubers of yam in large quantities to her customers. She is a hardworking client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is seeking a Kiva loan of $800.00 to enable her expand.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Yao T., a young barber aged 23, is unmarried and has no children. He does, however, have two younger brothers to care for. Having recently opened his barbershop, he is not able to outfit it at this point. His parents, who are farmers and live in the country, are not able to help him.

Yao is asking for a loan of $300 so that he can outfit his barbershop and attract more customers. Achieving this goal will allow him to take better care of his younger brothers.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Jeune coiffeur de 23 ans, Monsieur T. Yao est un célibataire sans enfants. Mais il a deux petits frères à sa charge. Ayant nouvellement ouvert son atelier, il n’a pas assez de moyens pour l’équiper. Par manque de support car ses parents sont cultivateurs dans leur village.

Il vient solliciter un apport financier de $300 afin de mieux équiper son atelier et attirer la clientèle. La réalisation de ce projet serait pour lui un atout qui l’aidera à assurer ses responsabilités de grand frère vis-à-vis de ses petits frères.

loans.use: Outfitting his barbershop and buying clippers

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
“I am Farzana B. and live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I have five children, four boys and a girl. I want to educate my children but face severe financial constraints. My husband is a tailor. With our current income, we are unable to manage the high cost of living in Lahore. Now my husband wants to start his own business, he wants to purchase a sophisticated sewing machine. We currently rent the machine, but if we can buy it, it would eventually reduce our cost of doing business. Therefore, I need a loan and I hope that our increased income will enable us to educate our children”

Farzana B., Lahore.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for my husband

loans.name: Sut

texts.en: Mrs. Sut S., age 29, runs a grocery store out of her home. Her husband works hard to raise and sell pigs, earning $2.50 per day. They have one small child that she looks after. She would like to borrow $300 to purchase a motorbike for her grocery business as transportation to bring products from the wholesaler back to her house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her grocery business as transportation

loans.name: Tereza Perez

texts.en: Tereza is thirty years old, married, and operates a small ice cream shop in her home.  All of the ice cream is homemade and Tereza takes great pride in her sweet creations.  She plans on using her loan to buy a larger freezer to accommodate a greater quantity of ice cream that, in turn, will be sold to more customers.  Tereza also hopes to buy more of the ingredients she uses to make the ice cream and increase her offerings.  Tereza aspires to own a big ice cream shop with plenty of seating, and dreams the entire community will enjoy her ice cream.

loans.use: Purchase of a new ice cream freezer

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: I am Mumtaz B., wife of Mr Faryad. My age is 35 years and I am a resident of Lahore. I and my husband want to start a business of selling bangles. I plan to sell bangles from my house to the women of my area, whereas my husband will sell bangles from his shop. We need $425 for this purpose. By doing this we would be able to meet our household expenses better, save something, and improve our living standard.

loans.use: Start a business selling bangles (bracelets)

loans.name: Mirembe Kinaawa (A) Group

texts.en:
Lydia is 30 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a medical researcher. She has a retail shop business. She wants to use the extra profits to expand into a wholesale business. Mary and Rita sell used clothes and intend to increase their stock with the loan. Rosemary has a canteen business while Jennifer sells raw foods.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in stock in the retail shop.

loans.name: Leticia Verónica

texts.es:
Leticia is a young entrepreneur of 27 years of age. She has been interested in business all of her life and had the chance to start her own small business 5 years ago, which consists of selling a variety of clothing for men and women, perfumes and cosmetics as well as school books. This entrepreneurial initiative has been very helpful in covering her family’s expenses, being that with it she has managed to live in a dignified manner and bring up her 2 small children, offering them a higher quality of life.

She sells her products as a peddler, visiting office centers, banks and universities, where she counts with a strong customer base. At this time, the business requires her to increase the amount of products available, being that she has some orders of men’s clothing in which she needs to invest. In the future, she wishes to have her own store so that she does not need to leave her home, and so she can be closer to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Leticia es una joven empresaria de 27 años de edad, toda su vida le ha gustado los negocios, hace 5 años tuvo la posibilidad de emprender su micro negocio, el cual consiste en vender ropa variada para hombres y mujeres, perfumes,cosméticos, así como también libros escolares, esta iniciativa de negocio le ha sido de mucha aporte para enfrentar los gastos familiares, ya que con su negocio ha logrado vivir dignamente y sacar adelante a sus 2 pequeños hijos ofreciéndoles una mejor calidad de vida. Ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante, visita centros de trabajo, bancos y universidades, en donde cuenta con un buen número de personas que le compran. En estos momentos el negocio requiere aumentar la cantidad de productos, ya que la señora tiene ciertos encargos de ropa de caballero en donde necesita invertir. En un futuro desea llegar a tener su tienda en la cual ya no tenga que andar fuera del hogar y así estar más cerca de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, cologne, shirts, jeans, shorts and women's undergarments.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 39-year-old father of two. Ali lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He is a car metalworker, welder and painter. This is the fourth time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs to buy material to sustain and develop his business. With the increased income generated from the credit he is planning to buy a television and a table for his house.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Ayidego Ahouandji Group

texts.fr:
The group AYIDEGO was created in 1992 in the small village of LISSEKON. It specializes in the conversion of palm nuts and manioc. It is composed of 5 dynamic women who work to improve their quality of life through wealth-bringing initiatives and the creation of revenue-generating business activities. They are asking for a loan of 400,000 francs ($975), which will allow them to buy 8 tonnes of palm nuts. This loan will allow the members of the group to increase their production capacity and improve their quality of life.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le groupement AYIDEGO est crée en 1992 dans le petit village de LISSEKON. Il est spécialisé dans la transformation de noix de palme et du manioc. Il est composé de 5 femmes dynamiques qui oeuvrent pour l’amélioration de leurs conditions de vie à travers des initiatives porteuses de richesse et de création d’activités génératrices de revenus. Le crédit sollicité est d’un montant de 400 000 francs et permettra d’acheter 8 tonnes de noix de palme. Ce financement permettra aux membres de renforcer leur capacité de production et d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy 8 tonnes of oil palm nuts

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hồng, 33 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. She farms and tends livestock for living. They did not have either much land or livestock so the main income was coming from her husband’s construction job. In 2005, she joins the TYM Fund and takes out loans to invest in livestock. The business is prosperous, family’s economy is better and she can provide more to her children’s education. She is applying for a loan of 375USD to buy pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng, 33 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Công việc chủ yếu của chị là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Diện tích ruộng không nhiều, vốn đầu tư cho chăn nuôi ít nên thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chủ yếu từ chồng làm thợ xây. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ vào năm 2005, có thêm vốn đầu tư nên thu nhập từ chăn nuôi tăng lên đáng kể. Đời sống gia đình được nâng cao, 3 con chị Hồng được mẹ cho ăn học tử tế. Với sự hỗ trợ từ phía chồng nên việc hoàn trả của chị Hồng rất thuận lợi. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 375USD để đầu tư nuôi lợn.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Rahmat Allah

texts.en: Rahmat Allah lives in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated and married, and has a small electronics store where he works to support his family. He wants to enlarge his store, so he is requesting an individual loan to complete his stock and make his business more successful. He hopes that he can do it and he is pleased with the loan. He would like to thank Kiva lenders that are helping people, especially in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock.

loans.name: Hermanas Unidas Group

texts.en:
Estama M. has found a unique niche in her local community juS.outside of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. When someone has an old or broken piece of furniture, they take it to her. She has begun a small business repairing chairs, sofas, beds, and other furniture. Left by her husband several years ago, Estama has found herself in the same position as many women here in the Dominican and in her home country, Haiti. She is left to provide for her two boys (ages 14, 16) with whatever means she can. The money from this loan will go towards purchasing paint, sand paper, various tools, as well as several old beds that may be refurbished and sold. She aspires to continue growing her business, so that someday she might be able to own her own shop that she can work out of.

Estama is one of the leaders of the 10 person micro bank Hermanas Unidas, which means "United Sisters". All ten women in the bank are Haitian immigrants who have come to earn a living in the Dominican informal sector. These unique entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, promising to cover one another if someone fails on a payment, thus allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting due to the strong peer pressure from their fellow bank members. As these 10 women embark upon their firS.ever loan from Esperanza, we are confident that they will all succeed in bettering their lives and the lives of their families with this loan. Their businesses are simple, but offer a stream of income that could never have been accomplished without such a loan for initial capital. Several of the women sell clothes and shoes in the street, and a couple of them will offer housecleaning services and beauty supplies.

On behalf of Estama M., the Hermanas Unidas group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference

loans.use: To purchase, paint, sandpaper, tools, and several old beds to be refurbished and sold.

loans.name: Sorng

texts.en:
Mr. S. Sorng and Mrs. Chhem May are farmers who live in Trean Commune, Kampong Cham Province. They are married and have two young children. Sorng is the head of the family so he has to work hard every day to support his family’s expenses. He has many jobs to generate income such as fishing and growing a rice crop.

For his rice crop, he faces the obstacle of renting expensive equipment to plow his farmland. He and his wife decided to request a loan to purchase two oxen to plow his farmland. Sorng is requesting a loan of $300.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen to plow his farmland

loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Eam H., 64, is an elderly rice farmer who lives with two of her children. Living in Kampong Cham, she and her husband are able to make around US$ 1.50 per day. One of their sons works selling firewood to the local people.

Mrs. Eam would like to borrow through Kiva to increase the quantity of wood for sale for her son. This will allow her son to make more profit to support the family. In the future, she plans to open another business selling groceries.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of wood for sale for her son

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida tiene 20 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su madre.  Es una joven emprendedora, se dedica a la venta de libros y material de librería desde hace un año atrás, para solventar sus gastos económicos.  Ella ha trabajado desde muy joven en diferentes labores, una de ellas, como la de empleada del hogar, pero su meta personal es estudiar y tener una profesión, para lo cual necesita trabajar mucho.  Dedica toda la mañana y parte de las tardes a atender su negocio, ya que quiere estudiar por las noches en la universidad local, a Zenaida no se le hace difícil la labor diaria, está acostumbrada a trabajar desde muy joven, pero cree que se le hará difícil estudiar y trabajar a la vez, pero está decidida a superarse y ser una gran profesional.  Su motivación es forjarse un mejor futuro, y sabe que con conocimientos, todo es posible, por ello que se empeña en estudiar para tener una profesión.  Con el dinero del préstamo Zenaida quiere comprar más cantidad de papelería y libros para poder vender y así tener mayores ingresos y solventar sus estudios con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 20 years old, unmarried and lives at home with her mother. She is a young entrepreneur and she has dedicated herself to the sale of books and library materials for a year to support her economic costs. She has worked since she was young in different tasks, one of them working in a home, but her personal goal is to study and have a profession, for which she needs to work a lot. She spends every morning and part of the afternoon attending her business because she wants to study at night at the local university. For Zenaida it is not difficult to work everyday, she has been used to working since she was young, but she believes it will be difficult to study and work at the same time. Despite this she is determined to overcome that and become a great professional. Her motivation is to forge a better future, and she knows that with knowledge, everything is possible; for this she is trying to study to have a profession. With the money from the loan Zenaida wants to buy larger amounts of stationery and books to sell to have a higher income and support her studies more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the stationary materials and books that she sells

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Hilda es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Hilda tiene una mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte urbano para lo cual tiene un chofer, además Hilda tiene terrenos en la selva ayacuchana en donde cultiva café, cacao, la época de mayor cosecha es abril y mayo, sus productos los vende en el mismo lugar.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su mototaxi.
Hilda sueña con construir su casa, comprar un carro para realizar transporte publico.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Poder (Power) Community Bank. She lives with her partner, is 26 years old, and has one son. Hilda has a motorcycle taxi with which is used for transportation in the city; a driver operates it. In addition, Hilda has land in the Ayacuchana Jungle, where she grows coffee and cocoa.
