The time for the best harvest is April and May. She sells her products in the same place. Hilda needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the repairs of her motorcycle taxi. Hilda dreams of building a house and buying a car for public transport.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repaird her motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo José Luis D. 43 años, el cual es chofer, y sus hijos Jeaneth D. 19, Mariela D. 16 y Karen D. 7 años. Los esposos José Luis y Candelaria son un verdadero equipo, mientras Candelaria cocina los alimentos que ofrecerán, José Luis atienD. a los comensales, haciendo que su pequeño negocio resulte muy atractivo al público, quien ya prefiere la sazón D. Candelaria. El negocio va muy bien y creciendo en clientela, a ellos siempre les ha gustado la cocina y piensan que en este rubro, en el cual ya están 7 años, será su ventana para lograr el éxito. Candelaria se encuentra en el segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero comprará sillas, algunas mesas y accesorios para mejorar su negocio, además D. ingredientes para preparar sus ricos platos.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 41 years old. She lives with her husband, José Luis, who is 43 and a driver, and her children Jeaneth 19, Mariela 16 and Karen 7 years old. José Luis and Candelaria are a real team. While Candelaria makes the meals that they offer, José Luis attends to the diners, making their small business very attractive to the public who prefer Candelaria´s cooking. The business is going well and growing in clientele. They have always like cooking and think that this line of work, which they have been in for 7 years, will be their window to success. Candelaria is now in her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With this money she will buy chairs, some tables and accesories to improve the business as well as ingredients to prepare her delicious meals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy some furniture and ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Srey Aonn

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Aonn R. lives in Ta Sen village in Kampong Cham province. She is a fruit seller. Her husband, Mr. Thy Ra, is a motorbike taxi driver. The couple does not earn enough income to support their household. To improve their living conditions, Mrs. Srey Aonn R. decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets and start a business breeding pigs. She would use the rest of money to purchase pig feed. She is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is with her on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy some piglets to start a business, breeding pigs..

loans.name: Sabanalamarino Unido Iii Group

texts.en:
Angela L. is the bank coordinator for Group 3 in the Sabanalamarino Unido Bank of Hope in Hato Mayor. Her group has five members. She has two small children, ages 4 and 8. She has a clothing business where she sells both new and used items. Her business is in her own house and most of her customers live in her neighborhood. She has already received five loans from Esperanza and is about to receive her sixth loan.

With these loans she has been able to invest in refurbishing her business. Her immediate purpose with this loan is to expand her business to selling snacks such as juice and cupcakes. She thinks this has good potential in her neighborhood. On a longer term, she would like to have her business in a location separate from her home, where she can have a clothing store and a bakery. She hopes that her business profits will help her to keep providing for her two children and achieve her dream to have a house of her own. On behalf of Esperanza and this Bank of Hope, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase new merchandise for clothing business and expand to snack-selling

loans.name: Rajabbi

texts.ru: Юлдошева Раджабби живет в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 53 года, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Работает поваром в столовой. Помещение арендует. Данный бизнес работает уже 10 лет. Теперь для того, чтобы улучшить качество обслуживания , она планирует получить кредит и закупить новую посуду  и скатерти. Это поможет привлечь новых клиент.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabbi U. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 53 years old, married, and has two children. She is a cook with a cafe. The facility is rented. The cafe has been in business for 10 years. In order to improve service, she decided to request a loan to buy new dishes and tablecloths. This will help attract new customers. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dishes and tablecloths

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice D., 35, is a bona fide resident of Adtuyon in the Pangantucan municipality. She has been a Zamboanga dried-fish retailer for one year. Alice and her husband were farming before but due to insufficient finances with the increasing price of inputs (chemicals and fertilizers), they shifted to retailing of dried fish.

They started to purchase 4 to 5 kilograms of this foodstuff until it increased. They display their dried fish ("tabo-tabo") in the market and in various municipalities utilizing a cousin's four-wheel drive vehicle.

An additional capital of PHP9000 is now her concern to purchase dried fish. She is hoping that somehow she could own a multi-cab to maximize their time in peddling activities and, most of all, she could directly buy the dried fish in Zamboanga - the famous producer of quality, cheap dried fish in Western Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase 8 kg of  dried fish for sale

loans.name: Eriberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Eriberto se desempeña en una constructora de arca de mantenimiento , trabajo que desde hace cuatro años labora para esta institución, tiene 56 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa tiene su propio negocio una pulpería que es de mucha sastifaccion para su familia sus hijos están casados. Con este crédito quiere aumentar el tamaño del cuarto ya que es pequeño y le resulta incomodo para eso va a comprar materiales de construcción y da las gracias  Afodenic por ser parte de sus metas alcanzadas, este es su décimo crédito y espera tener la oportunidad de seguir mejorando su vivienda para digna.
texts.en:
Eriberto works for a construction company. For four years Eriberto has worked for this institution. He is 56 years-old and lives in the neighborhood Memorial Sandino in the city of Managua. His wife has her own business, a grocery store that is of much satisfaction to the family. Their children are married. With this loan, Eriberto would like to increase the size of a room since it is small and uncomfortable. For this reason, he is going to buy construction materials. He gives thanks to Afodenic for being part of the goals he has achieved. This is his tenth loan, and he hopes to have the opportunity to continue improving his home for the best.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build an annexed room

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Mrs. Lita C. is 62 years old, married and lives in Labo, Aloran, Mis. Occ. Her husband is a fisherman. She has three children. With a desire to help her husband, she ventured into bread-making and snack vending, starting up with a capital of only PHP 500. Her primary customers are her neighbors and friends and co-members of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

She joined the co-op in order to avail herself of their credit facilities. She was thankful to Paglaum MPC that her purpose of obtaining additional capital was realized. Now, she applies for PHP 14,900 to buy flour and ingredients for bread-making. She dreams to own a parcel of land someday.

loans.use: To buy flour and ingredients for bread making

loans.name: Junks Centers Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu K. and Aminata S.. They named their group Junks Centers.  Here in Sierra Leone, second hand clothes are referred to as junks. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have created significant impacts on the lives of these entrepreneurs. They use the proceeds of their businesses to look after their children by feeding them, sending them to school, and meeting their daily financial challenges. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of SLL 1,000,000 each to further strengthen their businesses.

Kadiatu (right) is the leader of this group. Kadiatu was born in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age 37, and married to a businessman.  They have four children. Three of their children are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Kadiatu sells second-hand clothes for children (junks). She has been in this business for three years now. With this loan, Kadiatu will buy two bales of second hand clothes. A bale of used clothes for children is sold for Le 410,000 and she will pay a fare of Le 10,000 to Freetown where bales of junks are sold.

loans.use: Buy two bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline V., 38 years old, is married to Mr. Nestor V., a fisherman. They are blessed with four children; two of them are studying. They live in the town of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Mrs V. is working with her neighbor as a baby sitter; she has a salary of 3,000 php a month. She is a member of Paglaum Co-op and has requested a loan amounting to 15,000 php to finance the needs of her husband's fishing. She is very thankful for the assistance and trust given  her by Paglaum and Kiva. She hopes to improve their family's living conditions and hopes to see her children finish school.

loans.use: To buy materials for new fishing boat and fishing accessories

location.town: Plaridel-Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional seeds for the new harvest.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is a 64-year-old married mother of six children, three sons and three daughters. All of them have finished school and are currently working. Afia lives with her husband and some of her children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Afia and her husband are both traders. Afia has been in business for over 40 years and trades in food items such as vegetables, oil, rice, cereals, etc., which she supplies to food vendors. She buys her goods from Kumasi and nearby communities, and is requesting a loan to buy goods in bulk. Afia aspires to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy food items in bulk

loans.name: Hassen

texts.en:
Hassen J. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts (peanuts) and is requesting a loan to purchase simsim (sesame seeds) to sell.

Hassen is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a project manager in UNDP (United Nations Development Program) Sudan. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase simsim to sell

loans.name: Sedqa Group

texts.en:
Sedqa is the group leader of Sedqa group. There are four members in this group and each of them wishes to take a loan to expand her business.

Sedqa wants to take a loan for her embroidery business.

Fatama wants to take a loan for her husband who has a furniture-making shop.

Salema and Shafeqa want to take a loan for their carpet-weaving businesses.

So they have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani. They are all pleased with this process.

loans.use: To expand her embroidery business

loans.name: Rafickjon

texts.en:
Since 1999, Rafickjon has been a livestock farmer. He breeds calves, cows, and sheep. He is married and has three children whom he supports. He wants to continue to be able to give them a proper education. 

Rafickjon has improved his financial situation since his father was also a cattle breeder, so he has gained rich experience in the livestock business since childhood. Today, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also offer dairy products in his community and surrounding areas. Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows. 

Rafickjon is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living.  

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Agababa

texts.en: Agababa A.  is very demanding in his work, having been a farmer since childhood. Today, as a head of household, he works tirelessly to generate a stable income to provide adequate living conditions for his five children and his wife. He works caring for his animals, getting up very early to gather grasses so he can keep his livestock well-fed. Agababa sells both the milk they produce, as well as their meat. He is seeking this current loan for the purchase of additional cows for expanding his business. Please help support Agababa’s efforts so he can continue to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua E. sells fresh fish: she goes to the sea shore to buy fish for sale at Elmina sea shore.  Ekua has received senior high school education.  She is divorced and has four children. Ekua has been selling fresh fish since1980. She is responsible for paying of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a land to build on.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Pomaa

texts.en: Pomaa is thirty – three years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all in school. Pomaa lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. She is a trader. She trades in utensils – cooking utensils, bowls, etc. She buys sets of plates, bowls, etc. from Kumasi. Pomaa hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Fauzia

texts.en:
Fauzia is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice with stew. She sells on a table top in front of her house.

Fauzia has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Mr. Samuel K.  works as a tailor in his shop in Ibanda town along Jubilee Street. He is 36 years old and is requesting a loan to purchase more material to make different clothing designs in order to attract more customers. He wishes to expand his services so that he can sell as many designs (clothes) as he can for profit. He has been in the tailoring business for almost 11 years. Samuel is a married man with two children aged seven and three. His seven year old is currently in school.

loans.use: To purchase more material to make different clothing designs.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is 34 years old. She is married with five children who are currently in school. She is a trader who sells cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates, rice cookers, microwaves etc. She sells to her customers in working institutions on a credit basis. Vivian is an achiever and her focus is to build a container shop from her savings to enable her to station her sales. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers.

loans.use: To purchase assorted plastics and kitchen sets.

loans.name: Mayubel

texts.en:
Mayubel is 45 years old. She is married to Freddy Chavarría Guillén. Mayubel sells clothing door-to-door in her neighbourhood. Freddy works in construction. The couple lives with their 3 sons in Turrialba, a rural region in the central valley of Costa Rica. Her full-time job is a domestic worker in a household of 3 grown men and one child. Despite the heavy workload of cooking and cleaning for her sons and husband, she is determined to contribute to the family’s income. This is why she dedicates at least 3 days a week, between domestic jobs and when her youngest son is in school, to her clothing business. 

Since 2006, Mayubel has successfully paid back, on time and in full, consecutive loans in the amounts of 100,000, 200,000 and 300,000 colones. Mayubel is now applying for a loan of 500,000 colones that she will use to buy more items for her inventory in bulk show she can bet better prices from her suppliers. She is happy to be applying for a larger amount than she has in the past. Mayubel wants to purchase a new sewing machine so she can make her own clothes to sell. At the moment, she has one machine, but it is very old and doesn’t work very well. 

Mayubel opened her business in 2006 with 100,000 colones. Before her business, she had a domestic worker job that required her to travel from Turrialba to Tres Rios (a 90-minute bus ride each way) every day. She worked for 7 years in a house as a domestic worker and was paid 6000 colones per day, which is the same amount she now earns by selling 2 shirts. 

Having only completed primary school, Mayubel has few options for employment. Domestic work did not pay well and the job left her exhausted. She started her business as an alternative to domestic work. Now, she says she enjoys her work, and takes pride in being able to make a more significant contribution to family income. In a good month, she can earn 300,000 colones and in a bad month, she still earns 200,000 colones. 

Mayubel tailors her business to a range of clients by offering a variety of clothing, for men, women and children. Her sister-in-law makes underwear, which Mayubel can purchase at a good price. The rest of her inventory comes from San Jose, the capital of Costa Rica. 

Mayubel is proud to report that her youngest son is very intelligent. She wants to save enough money to enable him to attend university. Her other two sons never finished high school and now work with their father in construction.

The field consultant who has worked with Mayubel since 2006 describes her as very shy and insecure. Having loans in her name and handling money has made her visibly more confident in making decisions. Rural areas, such as Turrialba, are characterized by many difficulties such as a lack of job opportunities, infrastructural deficiencies, low levels of formal education and lack of available financial services. By lending to Mayubel, you are making a direct investment in the improvement of the life of her and her family, enabling them to help themselves.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Mayubel from  Costa Rica

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is a forty-five-year-old married man living in Arzi, Southern Lebanon with his wife and four children. Mouhamad has owned a factory that specializes in building stones and plastic tents since 1992. Mouhamad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy important raw materials necessary to improve his business in order to face the competitors surrounding him. Mouhamad is seeking to spread his business wider--as far as he can--because his clients are currently limited to the local villagers and residents of neighboring areas.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Jemelyn

texts.en:
Jemelyn farms for a living. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children. Her oldest is only 10 years old. She currently owns a hectare of rice field. She shared that despite the difficulties her family experiences, she is still thankful that God sustains them.

Jemelyn is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 from CEVI. This loan will be used for the farm; she will purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en:
Khamis F. is currently in the business of selling beans, onions, fish etc in the market and is requesting a loan to stock jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.  Khamis is 28 years old and is married to a driver. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Miss. Sreymom V., aged 20, is single and lives with her widowed mother, sisters and brother in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Sreymom has been a silk weaver for five years, and learned this skill from a neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. Sreymom is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline, 26, is a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. She also raises pigs and chickens for additional income. She supports her family through these businesses. She has a 7-year-old child to support.

Jacqueline needs to purchase feed and fertilizers for her businesses. Since she has limited capital, she requested an 8,000 Philippine peso loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc.

loans.use: To buy feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Villa Ingavi Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de German Busch se encuentra en una zona alejada del centro de la ciudad de El Alto. En centro focal se encuentra la asociación Villa Ingavi, la misma que está conformada por 9 mujeres.  Las socias más antiguas ya tienen 15 ciclos (ocho años y medio) formando parte de la asociación.  Los negocios que tienen son: venta de fruta, venta de carne de llama, artesanía de sombreros, venta de comida, Tejedora de Enaguas, Venta de Mantas y macramé, venta de jugos y comerciante de ropa.
La señora Virginia Q., con 29 años de edad ya tiene 6 años como socia, de carácter amable, algo tímida, refiere que está casada y que el bebé que tiene en brazos es el quinto hijo.  Su negocio es una tienda de Juegos en Red, está hubicado en la Zona de Villa Ingenio, cerca de su domicilio.  Ella indica que necesita el crédito para comprar más Tarjetas de Video que se utilizan en las máquinas. Su primer crédito fue de Bs. 800.- y para este crédito su solicitud es de Bs. 1500.-.

En la foto se observan a siete de las socias y a la señora Virginia Q. en el momento de hacer dormir  a su bebé, la señora Florencia Q. no salió en la foto por que se encontraba sentada lejos del lugar elejido para la foto y no podía moverse por que su pie le dolía.
texts.en:
The central office of German Busch is located in an area far from the city centre of El Alto. The Villa Ingavi Association works out of this office and is made up of nine women. The women who have belonged to the association the longest have already completed 15 loan cycles (eight and a half years). They have a variety of businesses: selling fruit, llama meat, hat making, food sales, skirt weaving, poncho and macrame sales, juice selling, and clothing sales. 29-year old señora Virginia Q. has been a member for six years. She is friendly, a little shy, and says that she is married and the baby she is holding is her fifth child. Virginia has an internet games store located in the Villa Ingenio neighbourhood near her house. She needs a loan to buy more video cards which are used in the computers. Her first loan was for Bs.800, and this time she is asking for Bs.1,500. In the photo seven of the women can be seen, and Virginia Q. is the one getting her baby to go to sleep. Señora Florencia Q. isn’t in the photo because when it was taken, she was a long way from the site chosen and couldn’t get there because of painful feet.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: video cards

loans.name: Modi

texts.en:
Modi P. is 47 years old and widowed. She has seven children and they do not go to school. She is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal in wholesale, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a charcoal store.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vilma Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Vilma; pertenece al banco comunal “CRUZ PATA”, Nuestra socia es natural D. Acomayo, ahora vive el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia del Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 52 años D. edad ella es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Nuestra socia alterna sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia venD. granos (habas secas, pallares, frijoles, porotos, maíz en todas las variedades, trigo, quinua), en el mercado D. vino canchón y también se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa ella lleva a Huaypetue  las ropas para venderlas allá a una señora que le compra y a su vez lo venD.. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprare ropa y llevar hasta Huaypetue a vender. 

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total D. la deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is Vilma. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Cruz Pata” and a native of Acomayo, but she now lives in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

Vilma is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She divides her time between her household activities and her small business. Vilma sells dry goods (different types of dried beans, all varieties of corn, wheat, and quinoa) at the market in Vino Canchón. She also buys and sells clothing. The clothing she acquires is taken to a woman in Huaypetue who buys the clothing from her in order to sell. Vilma is requesting a loan to buy clothing to take with her to Huaypetue.

She values and appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Doña Silvia es madre de familia de tres hijos, es muy emprendedora, tiene 36 años de edad, con una pequeña pulpería que ha venido a mejorar los ingresos de la familia. 
Su esposo trabaja en construcción en donde se le ha hecho más fácil el poder construir. Ha ido poco a poco cerrando pero por falta de dinero no logro terminar, solo le falta una parte para cerrar todo su casa, que desea hacer ante que comience el invierno en lleno y asi lograr acomodarse en mejores condiciones. Lo que permitirá mayor higiene y seguridad ante delincuencia. Estos financiamientos han venido a beneficiar las mejoras en la construcción de su casa
texts.en:
Silvia is the mother of three children. She is an enterprising 36 years old owner of a small general store. The business has increase her family's income. Her husband works in construction which has made it easier for them to build. Little by little they have been completing their house but for lack of money they have not yet finished. Only a part is missing to finish the whole house. She wishes to finish it before the winter fully arrives in order to provide better accommodations to her family. It will also provide better hygiene conditions and safety from violence. The loans have been aimed at improving the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, and other materials to finish part of the roof

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
In Srae Ampil village in Kandal province are found these four people who make up this group loan. Mrs. Phalla K. is the group leader, selected by all the members. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Phalla K. is on the staff of an orphan center and she is also a farmer who owns a half-hectare (1.25 acres) of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family. Her problem is that her rice field has infertile soil.

So, to improve her production of rice, Mrs. Phalla K. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She is a widow with a child who is nineteen years old.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Syedaan's Group

texts.en:
Syedaan lives in the mid-sized city of Vehari, Pakistan. Her husband is a loader; he loads items on a donkey cart and delivers them to the required places. She has three children: two sons and one daughter. She couldn’t educate her children due to financial constraints. 

She has a business of animal selling. She purchases animals from the animal market, grows them up, then sells them to earn a profit. Recently, she started embroidery work to earn money for buying animals.
 
She is saving money from her earnings through embroidery, but she has still a shortage of money needed to buy animals. She is applying for the loan to cover that cost. 

She is hopeful that with the help of the profits, one day she will be able to send her younger children to school.

loans.use: Purchase animals for selling

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Liaina

texts.en:
Liaina L. is 40 years old. She is married and has a 1-year-old child.  She owns a business planting, harvesting and selling taamu, a root vegetable much like taro. Liaina has 1 year of experience in this business.  

Liaina needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase harvesting equipment, such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US $63 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2010, Liaina joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan from SPBD. SPBD's loans are Liaina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia M., 43 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years. Virginia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Virginia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but in addition, offers savings, insurance and training programs through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Purity Wanjohi

texts.en:
Purity is a 34-year-old married lady with two children. She sells buckets, mattresses, and handbags in an open-air market. She has been in the business for about four years now and has managed to get a profit of about Kshs.26,000 per month.

She has never borrowed from any other MFI. She hopes to open her own shop and improve her living standards.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur REVIEW Purity Wanjohi from  Kenya

loans.use: To buy more buckets, other utensils, mattresses, and bags for resale

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 24- year-old single man. He sells electric supplies and provides electricity to homes, through his electrical motor engine, when there is no governmental electricity, a major problem in Lebanon since 2008. Khodor is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy an extra motor engine to provide more houses with electricity. This would increase his customer base, income and business. His clients are all the people in his village. He hopes to expand his work to other villages in the future and to open a big electrical appliances showroom.

loans.use: To buy an extra motor engine

loans.name: Zoila Carmensa

texts.es: Zoila Carmensa tiene 75 años,  su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Zoila ya tiene experiencia con créditos pues ha sido muy satisfactorio para su negocio. Ella es una madre muy abnegada y responsable  la ubicación de su negocio es en su misma casa de habitación, decidida a ayudar a su familia, poniendo su pequeño negocio el cual es de gran ayuda para poder cubrir algunas de sus necesidades. El préstamo ha sido solicitado para invertir  en pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y cosméticos que se necesitan en la tienda y lo que sus clientes le solicitan es una persona humilde pero de gran corazón, emprendedora y trabajadora, que vela por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Zoila Carmensa is 75 years old and runs a small shop. She has experience with micro loans and her business has benefited from them. Zoila is a very responsible and self sacrificing mother. She runs her store from inside of her own home, and the income helps to cover some of the basic costs for her family. The loan will be used to purchase pants, blouses, skirts, dresses and cosmetics which she needs in her shop, and which her customers request. Zoila is a humble person with a big heart. Hardworking and enterprising, she watches out for the well being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her small shop which she runs from her home

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Alma Rosa, y su esposo Carlos Javier, son una pareja muy unida, tienen un hijo adolescente, ella trabaja en una maquiladora y el en un centro comercial. 
Los dos son muy trabajadores y quieren mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo, solicitan este crédito ya que están construyendo un cuarto en la parte trasera de la casa y solo les hace falta el dinero para el techo de concreto, ellos les agradecen su ayuda.
texts.en:
Alma Rosa and her husband Carlos Javier are a very close couple. They have a teenage son. She works in a maquiladora (a factory), and he works in a shopping center. They are both very hardworking and want to improve their son's quality of life. They are asking for this loan because they are building a room onto the back of the house, and they need only the money for the concrete roof. They are grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the rent bill.  

For over seven years, she has operated her business of selling fried fish and also operates a retail shop where she sells maize flour, sugar and cooking oil to her neighbors. Rukia's major challenge is seasonality. During the August holidays the demand for fish is very high compared to the months of January and February. She hopes to expand in the future and open another business.

She decided to join Yehu so as to access loans to boost her business. With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase a bundle of fish, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of fish, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina de 46 años de edad tiene 3 hijos 2 mayores de edad los cuales trabajan por su propia cuenta y uno que tiene a cargo de 16 años, el cual estudia 2do año de secundaria. 

La Sra. Luz Marina labora como docente de primaria desde hace 26 años en el Ministerio de Educaciòn.   Està solicitando su octavo  crèdito para con la ayuda de kiva poder construir una habitaciòn con mayor comodidad, la profesora Luz Marina es una mujer muy responsable con voluntad y capacidad de pago. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es  llegar a ver sus hijos realizados que sean personas de bien trabajadoras y brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 46, has three children.  Two of them are adults and work independently and one is 16 years old and still in her care.  He is in second year of secondary school at Rubén Darío Institute.

Luz Marina has worked as an elementary school teacher for the Ministry of Education for 26 years.  She is asking for her 8th loan from Kiva in order to build a more comfortable room.  Teacher Luz Marina is a very responsible woman both willing and able to repay.

Her greatest dream in life is to see her children become well-paid professionals and to provide better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: To add a room onto her house.

loans.name: Lider De Defensores Group

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen Raquel es la secretaria del grupo “ LIDER D. DEFENSORES” integrado por diez personas, todas amigas y vecinas D. Ventanilla – Callao Perú. lo que mas le apasiona son los trabajos manuales algo a lo que siempre se dedico en sus ratos libres empezó como una forma D. liberarse del estrés y relajarse un poco, jamás pensó que  esto significaría un ingreso adicional, fueron sus amistades y compañeras D. trabajo las que la animaron a vender lo que ella confeccionaba como sus tejidos, suvenirs, recuerdos. Etc. Para cada ocasión especial prepara manualidades novedosas, ahora esta preparando bolsos naviD.ños ya cuenta con muchos pedidos es por eso que el dinero D. su préstamo lo  invertirá en la compra D. telas para la confección D. los bolsos, también esta considerando alquilar un local para estas fechas naviD.ñas para exponer y vender sus productos ya que cuenta con el apoyo D. su hija que la anima a seguir en el negocio ambas comparten la creatividad y les gusta lo que hacen.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen serves as secretary of the group “Lider D. Defensores” (Leader of the Defenders), which is composed entirely of women who are neighbors in the Ventanilla area of Callao, Peru. Carmen is passionate about making things by hand and always spends her free time in this manner as a means of relaxing and releasing stress.  She never thought that her hobby would result in extra income.  Her friends and co-workers encouraged her to sell the items she produces such as weavings, souvenirs, mementos, and other crafts.  Carmen produces handmaD. novelties for each special occasion.  Now she is preparing Christmas bags and has already received many orders. 

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in fabrics for making the bags.  Carmen will also consider renting a stand during the holiday season where she can display and sell her products.  She has the support of her daughter who encourages her to continue with the business.  They both share in their creative abilities and enjoy what they do.  

*Sra. Carmen is the seated woman holding a bag.

loans.use: Buy cloth to sew Christmas bags

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio San Roque, que dista a 18 km de la oficina regional Caacupé. 

Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras  están en el ciclo Nº  5º con sus 16 integrantes. 


Una de las integrantes es la señora Atanacia quien se dedica a la venta de carbón desde su casa, con esta actividad ella ayuda a su familia ya que le deja buena ganancia, porque es un producto muy utilizado por la familias para especialmente para al cocción de las comidas diarias ya que el gas para cocinar tienen un precio alto para muchas familias.
 Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra una gran carga de carbón para contar con suficiente cantidad para los clientes.
texts.en:
The 16 women in this group live in the San Roque neighborhood of Caacupé, located 18 km away from the Caacupé regional office.

The group is very pleased with the support they have been getting from Fundación Paraguaya, whose loans are allowing their smalll businesses to grow and increasing their chances of a better life. This is the group's fifth loan.

One of the group members is Atanacia, who is in the business of selling charcoal from home, a profitable activity for her family, since charcoal is used by so many people for cooking (in lieu of gas, which is too expensive). She is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of charcoal so she can answer her clients' needs.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
María es una mujer de pocos recursos económicos, madre soltera de tres hijos, por los cuales trabaja mucho para lograr darles educación.
Hoy en día trabaja de conserje, un trabajo fijo, ya que anteriormente vendía frutas, lavaba y planchaba.
Su casa la ha venido mejorando con financiamiento que la institución ha dado. Son siete ciclos  en donde ha avanzado mucho. Con este nuevo préstamo hará un anexo en la cocina, el cual será de gran beneficio para el bienestar de su familia. los materiales a comprar serán piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, tablas entre otros para seguir con la obra.
texts.en:
María is a woman with few economic resources. She is a single mother with three children for whom she works hard in order to succeed in giving them an education.

Currently, she works as a janitor, a steady job. Previously, she sold fruit and did laundry and ironing. She has made improvements to her house with financing that the microfinance institution has given her. In seven loan cycles she has made a lot of progress. With this new loan she will build an addition to her kitchen which will be of great benefit for the wellbeing of her family. The materials she will buy are stone, sand, cement, iron, and boards, among others, in order to continue with the project.

loans.use: She will buy construction materials in order to build an addition to her kitchen, improving the condition of her home.

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.fr: dynamique et motivée, adidjatou a commencé il y a plus de 10 ans déjà le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. elle exerce son activité à la devanture de sa maison. elle s'approvisionne dans divers marchés locaux à lomé. les périodes de fêtes de fin d'année étant proche elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour accroître son stock de marchandises avec  8 cartons de boîtes de conserve, 13 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 2 cartons de poissons congelés, 7 cartons de savons et divers.
texts.en: An energetic and motivated woman, Adidjatou started a groceries business over ten years ago.  She operates her business in front of her house.  She gets her supplies from various local markets in Lomé.  Since the year-end holidays are fast approaching, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to increase her stock of merchandise with:  8 boxes of canned goods, 13 boxes of pasta, 2 boxes of frozen fish, 7 boxes of soap, and more.

loans.use: Buying grocery items

loans.name: Mavludahon Mirzamahmudova's Group

texts.en:
Mavludahon M. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 39, married, and has one daughter and two sons. Her daughter works in a sewing workshop and her sons study at school.
Mavludahon works in a bakery with her husband. She has applied for a loan because she needs money to start repairing a shed. In the future she wants to see her children get married.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff. .

loans.use: To repair a shed

loans.name: Sop Serigne Saliou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE SALIOU est né depuis le 14 décembre 2008. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles sont unies par des liens de voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE BARRA

Madame OULEYMATOU S. à droite de la photo, emmitouflée d'une écharpe noir parsemée de fleurettes vertes et bleues est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 04 autres qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle s'approvisionne au marché central de Louga pour revendre dans son quartier. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices. 

Son objectif est d'agrandir son commerce et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Saliou was created on December 14, 2008. It is composed of 15 women, all living in the same neighborhood and knowing each other because they are neighbors. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Keur Seigne Barra.

Mrs Ouleymatou S., to the right on the picture and wearing a black scarf with green and blue flowers sewn all over it, chairs the group. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of six children. In addition, family members have entrusted four other children to her care.

She sells second-hand clothes. She gets her supplies at the central market in Louga and resells them in her neighborhood. Her new loan will enable her to bolster her inventory level and increase her earnings. Her objective is to expand her business and strengthen her savings level.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen T. T. is 35 years old with 2 children who are at high school and secondary school. She has a small shop that sells vegetable and fruit in the local market. Her business creates 100,000 VND profit, and it makes it easier to manage family life when her husband is out of work.

Being a client of SeDa credit program since 2004, she has very effectively used the loans for running the business. She hopes that for this loan cycle, she can borrow 9,374,000 VND to improve her shop and buy more products to meet the demands of customers.

loans.use: To improve her shop by buying more products to meet customers' demands.

loans.name: Nooran

texts.en:
Nooran is a talented lady. She runs an embroidery business from home to support her family financially. She makes embroidered clothes for neighborhood clients and earns a good income. She is a resident of Sheikh Bhago which is a small residential area of the city of Kasur. Kasur is known for its leather industry in Pakistan. She came to Kasur after her marriage. 

Nooran has two sons. Both of them have a shoe making business. Nooran couldn’t provide them with education due to poor financial conditions. Both of them are getting good results from their business and receiving regular orders from different shoe factories and shoe shops. Her elder son started this business four years ago and Nooran hopes that an investment will bring profitable changes to his business.  

Her husband’s name is N. A. and he has a construction supplies business. He has contracts with different construction companies and individuals. He has been doing this business for many years and is known for his good quality of construction materials. 

Nooran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her elder son who wants to buy shoe laces, leather, nails and shoe polisher, etc., to make a larger quantity of shoes which will help him complete his orders on time and make more profit. She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that this will earn her son good profits and she will become a regular user.

loans.use: To buy shoe laces, leather, nails and shoe polisher for a shoe making business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos Solís M., está casado y tiene 1 hijo que es su mayor prioridad al igual que su señora esposa. El quiere comprar herramientas para  trabajar en construcción y así también dar un mejor acabado a sus obras y mejor calidad de trabajos. El cuenta con mucha experiencia en esa área de trabajo por lo cual quiere es ir perfeccionando su nivel de trabajo y con la compra de esas herramientas perfeccionara su trabajo para un mejor acabado. El piensa en el futuro de su esposa e hijo y quiere brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a ambos.
Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El   había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales como la Mutual, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos Solís M. is married and has a son, and his first priority is his family.  He wants to buy tools to work in construction and to be able to improve the quality of his jobs by giving them a better finish.  He has a lot of experience in this work area and wants to continue perfecting his skill level.  By purchasing new tools he hopes to be able to to this.  He has his family's future foremost in his mind and wants to give them a better lifestlye.

This is the second loan he has received through FUDECOSUR.  He has had other loans through state banks such as Mutual but FUDECOSUR has given him better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy construction tools

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old, married and has three children. The oldest child is 27 years old.

Elena is a farmer and hog-grower. She has been growing rice for more than 20 years. She earns PHP 5000 per month from rice farming. She also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

Elena requested a loan which she will use to purchase farm fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 42 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Emma de 41 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Este hombre trabajador se dedica a la agricultura, siembra habas, arvejas, papa y cebada. Cada día cuida sus campos durante las mañanas, porque dice que el trabajo requiere mucha dedicación, para que la cosecha sea todo un éxito y de esta manera pueda recoger toda su producción para venderla a los mayoristas de la zona, que le pagan muy bien. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque la agricultura es lo que aprendió desde  muy joven y es la mejor herencia que puede dejarle a sus hijos. Cuando la producción aumenta y se acerca la cosecha sus hijos mayores le ayudan en la actividad agrícola, pues el resto del tiempo estudian en la ciudad. Como Raúl es un hombre que se proyecta a futuro, pues quiere brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. En adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad habas y arvejas, ya que los precios de estos productos se mantienen estables en el mercado; y también quiere empezar con la crianza de mayor cantidad de reses. Es el quinto crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además dice que su grupo de trabajo es uno de los mejores, pues todos los integrantes se mantienen puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas, y esto les permite continuar adelante. Con el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar reses, a lo que hará engordar para venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Raul is 42 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife, 41 year old Emma, and their five children to whom they want to provide a better life.  This hard working man is a farmer who raises beans, peas, potatoes, and barley.  He cares for his fields every morning and says that a successful harvest requires much dedication so that he can collect it and sell it to the local distributors who pay him very well.

He learned these skills when he was a boy and he enjoys his work very much.  This is the best inheritance he can leave to his children.  His oldest children help him around harvest time and attend school in town the rest of the year.

Raul, being a man who thinks about the future, wants to provide the best for his children.  In the future he plans to raise a larger quantity of beans and peas, since the prices for these crops are stable in the market.  He also wants to begin raising cattle.

This will be his fifth loan through MFP and he is grateful to all the people who made this loan possible, allowing him to continue working.  He also says that his workgroup is one of the best because all of the members make their payments on time and this helps them to continue moving forward.  He will use the money from this loan to buy cattle to raise and resell at a profit.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Luchadoras” tiene más de 2 ciclos de trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a 6 señoras que emprenderán recién sus actividades.
La sra. Nelly se dedica a la venta de ropas, es un rubro en el cual está desde hace una década aproximadamente, pues ha descubierto que si se ofrece muy buena calidad de productos, los clientes se vuelven usuarios fieles de estos, por eso se ha mantenido con buena reputación dentro de este ámbito.
Ella desea poder ampliar su stock de productos, por eso es que solicita el crédito, para poder comprar ropas como pantalones, remeras, camisillas, polleras, tohallas, etc.
Las mujeres de este comité son todas muy trabajadoras, que poseen la esperanza de poder ir aumentando su calidad de vida, de poder adquirir un mejor futuro para sus familias, ellas confían plenamente en que podrán recibir la ayuda de Kiva.
texts.en:
The Luchadoras (Fighters) Group has completed more than two loan cycles with the Fundación Paraguaya. The majority of its members already have profitable businesses, but six of the women recently began their businesses.

Mrs. Nelly works selling clothing. It is an area where she has worked for about 10 years. She has discovered that if she offers very good quality products, her customers return and they become faithful clients. In this way she has earned a very good reputation. She desires to stock more products and is asking for a loan to buy clothing, such as pants, T-shirts, tank-tops, skirts, towels, etc.

The women in this group are all very hard-working and share the hope of continuing to improve their quality of life and achieve a better future for their families. The fully trust that they will receive help from Kiva.

loans.use: buy T-shirts, shorts, tank-tops, pants, skirts, towels, etc.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina works hard to support her family. Erlina is single and has a peanut butter-making business.

Erlina is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.  She is getting the Envirofit stove because it uses less fuel to cook food.  She wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer.

Erlina is aware that by using the Envirofit stove, she is saving money and she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Nuriance
loans.use: to purchase eight vegetable plots, seeds, insecticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Tugolokoke Development Group

texts.en:
Retailing has been 41-year-old Polline's business inclination for the past 9 years. Mukono is where she plies her trade. A worthwhile and return-value enterprise is what she calls it. She says this on the basis of the fact that she has been able to shoulder most of her family's responsibilities with earnings from this business.  

The good graces she has been enjoying have not come easy though as she has had to work painstakingly hard to establish herself. The idea to start this business she reveals came from her husband.  Polline principally sells home products in her shop.

This happily married mother of 5 says she has never regretted making the decision to venture into this business. With the passage of time, she has been brought to terms with the fundamentals and precepts of running this genre of business. She has used the knowledge she has acquired to streamline, improve and bring changes to bear on her business. 

On the side Polline also ekes out supplementary profits from a pig husbandry and sales business.  Weekly, she says her profits are about 100,000 Uganda shillings.  With this kiva loan, she says she is going to purchase more retail home products like plastics and cutlery to resell. 

Charles' face (the male group member) is not seen in the group photo.  He is marked as unpictured.

loans.use: to buy home products to resell

loans.name: Brenda Del Pilar

texts.es: Brenda Del Pilar de 28 años. Brenda posee una pulpería en los cuales comercializa productos de primera necesidad como pastas, pan, huevos y otros más los cuales son fundamentales dentro de un hogar. Ella cuenta con 12 años de poseer el negocio, el cual le ha permitido ir mejorando su economía familiar, la cual en muchas ocasiones es bastante mala, sobre todo porque muchas veces ella no cuenta con todos los productos que las personas buscan lo cual disminuye en gran manera sus ganancias. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo, con el fin de poder invertir y comprar pastas, sopas, fósforos, crema y granos básicos  para poder surtir su negocio con esos productos tan necesarios que no posee.
texts.en:
Brenda Del Pilar is 28 years old.  Brenda has a grocery store where she sells basic needs products like pasta, bread, eggs, and others that are fundamental to a household.  She has had her business for 12 years.  It has allowed her to improve her family finances.  On many occasions their finances are pretty bad.  This is mostly because she often does not have all of the products that people are looking for.  This greatly decreases her earnings.

That is why she is requesting a loan.  She will use the loan to be able to buy pasta, soup, matches, cream, and basic grains.  She will do this to be able to stock her business with the products that she needs but does not have.

loans.use: to be able to buy pasta, soup, matches, cream, and basic grains.

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dios es mi Fortaleza lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Blanca quien tiene una pequeña venta de gaseosa, helados y hielo. Ella desea aumentar su negocio hacerlo más grande es por ello que con el crédito comprara productos para surtir la venta con granos básicos, pan, café, huevo…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Johana comerciante de ropa y zapatos por encargo desde hace 6 años, Candida quien tiene una tortillería y vende frijoles cocidos, y Yamileth se dedica a la venta de comida.
texts.en:
The 'Dios es mi Fortaleza' (God is my Strength) group has four hard-working and entrepreneurial members.  One of them is Blanca, who owns a small store where she sells soda, frozen treats and ice.  She would like to increase her business and make it larger.  She will use her loan to buy products with which to stock her store: basic grains, bread, coffee, eggs, etc.

The other members of the group are Johana, who has been selling clothes and shoes to order for six years; Candida, who owns a tortilla bakery and sells baked beans; and Yamileth, who sells food.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bread, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Célibataire et sans enfant, Adjo a 36 ans et est coiffeuse de profession. Parallèlement à son  activité principale, Adjo vent du jus et de l’eau en sachet et du glaçon. elle a débuté cette activité  en 2008 et nous sollicite  à nouveau pour un crédit  pour mieux asseoir son commerce en s’approvisionnant en sucres, en aromes ,puis en pure water. Adjo est une jeune femme active et  de bonne moralité.
texts.en:
Single with no child, Adjo is 36 years old and a hairdresser by trade. In addition to her main activity, she retails juice, water in pouches and ice. She started this business in 2008, and is requesting a new loan to better establish her business by stocking up on sweeteners, flavorings and pure water.
Adjo is an active young woman of good character.

loans.use: to buy pouches of pure water, bags of sugar and flavorings.

loans.name: Melvin Jesus

texts.es: Melvin Jesús, tiene la edad 25 de  años, está soltero y vive con su padres. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de concentrado para el engorde de cerdos. El cuenta con varios cerdos a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus padres y crecer con le proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Melvin Jesús, 25, is single living with his parents.  He intends to use the loan to buy feed concentrate to fatten up pigs.  He has several pigs in his possession and he intends to feed them concentrate to fatten them up more quickly.  He wants his animals to reach ideal weight to sell them in the local and nearby markets.  He wants to earn higher profits for his and his parents’ wellbeing and to grow with this pig raising project.

This is his first Fudecosur loan.  He’s had no previous loans in state banks but Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Perina

texts.en: Perina is 38 years old. She has seven children. Six of the children are in school. She is a married woman. She sells tomato paste and onions. She has been in this business for two years. She will use the profit from her business to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables like tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Miguel Oswaldo

texts.es:
Hace 5 años Miguel de 47 años trabajó en un hospital donde adquirió conocimientos referentes a medicamentos.  La experiencia que tuvo lo animó a establecer su farmacia en la que trabaja de 6:00am a 23:00pm. Junto a su esposa han salido adelante a pesar que la zona  periurbana en la que viven  es peligrosa, aunque hasta el momento no se les ha presentado ninguna dificultad. Tienen 2 hijos uno de 20 años y otra de 14 que estudian en la escuela particular con mucha dedicación.
Su objetivo ahora es conseguir un préstamo para comprar cemento, arena , piedras y agrandar su farmacia. Y así hacerla mas visible a los clientes.
texts.en:
For 5 years, Miguel, aged, 47, worked in a hospital where he acquired knowledge about medicines.  The experience that he gained encouraged him to establish his pharmacy, where he works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m.   He and his wife have been getting ahead in life, in spite of the fact that the periurban area where they live is dangerous.  However, so far this hasn't given them any difficulties.

They have two children, one aged 20 and the other aged 14, who study hard at a private school.

His goal now is to get a loan to buy cement, sand, and stone to expand his pharmacy.  In this way, he will make it more visible for customers.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and stone to expand his pharmacy.

loans.name: Jannet Del Socorro

texts.es:
Janneth, de 35 años de edad, habita en la ciudad  de Granada, ella es comerciante, esta casada, es madre de dos hijos de 12  y 9 años de edad respectivamente, es dueña de una pulpería la cual tiene 5 años de tenerla. Inicio con una pequeña cantidad de caramelos, galletas y pan que vendía al cumplir 30 años de edad dejo de trabajar como domestica ya que sus hijos los cuidaba su abuelita y no les dedicaba tiempo, asi que tuvo que buscar una alternativa de trabajo que le permitiera tener ingresos y al mismo tiempo cuidar a sus hijos fue entonces que el esposo le dio un pequeño capital para invertir en la pulpería ella compro granos básicos. Cuando la pulpería tuvo un año de estar funcionando, ella hizo otra inversión y así la ha ido surtiendo poco a poco.  
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar frijoles al por mayor. Ella considera que es una buena época de comprar frijoles ya que están baratos y quiere aprovechar a vender lo mas que se pueda antes de que incrementen su precio en el mercado. En lo próximo es seguir trabajando para poder sacar adelante su negocio y hacerlo mas sostenible.
texts.en:
35-year-old Janneth lives in the city of Granada and is a shopkeeper.  She is married and has two children aged 12 and 9.  Janneth owns a grocery store which she has had for five years.  She started out selling just a small quantity of candies, cookies and bread.  When she turned 30, she stopped working as a domestic as her grandmother was looking after her children and she didn't have much time to spend with them.  She had to look for an alternative form of work which would allow her to make money and, at the same time, look after her children.  Her husband gave her a small amount of capital to invest in a grocery store business and she bought some basic grains.  When her grocery store had been running for a year, she made another investment and she has been gradually stocking it in this way.

Janneth needs this loan to buy beans wholesale.  She believes that this is a good time to buy beans as they are cheap and she would like to take advantage and sell as many as she can before their market price rises.  Janneth would like to continue working so that she can get ahead in her business and make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy beans wholesale

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en:
Muniratu is a palm oil extractor.  She is married and has 4 children. Her spouse is a mason. 

Muniratu supports her husband and works to help insure the general well-being of their home. 

The loan will be used to buy more palm fruits for the production of oil.  She hopes to invest the profit into her children's education.

loans.use: to obtain more palm fruits for the oil.

loans.name: Huyên's Group

texts.en:
Huyên is a 41 year-old woman living in Yen Phong district, Bac Ninh province.  

Huyên is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is N. Xá nhóm 19 (19).

Huyên is married and has three school-age children. To making a living, Huyên owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising rabbits for sale. Huyên has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Huyên joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Huyên has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and resell. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  

Huyên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Huệ is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her livestock business by buying food for pigs.

2. Quyết is a 23-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her livestock business by buying food for pigs .

3. Tỵ is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her livestock business by buying food for pigs and chickens.

4. Tính is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business raising chickens.

5. Cầu is a 55-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business raising pigs.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huyên là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Huyên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là N. Xá nhóm 19 (19).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ nuôi thỏ để bán.  Huyên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huyên kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Huyên đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huyên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Huệ là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Quyết là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Tỵ là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Tính  là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Cầu là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es: Clementina de 45 años, esta casada, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 son mayores de edad y ya tienen familia. Por lo tanto vive con su esposo y se hace cargo de 3 hijos menores a quienes educa y cría. La casa que habita es propia. Ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, siendo la actividad económica que predomina en su comunidad, labor que heredaron de sus padres. Cultivan café, kión y achiote en sus propios terrenos que abarcan 6 parcelas aproximadamente. Todo lo que siembra lo vende, siendo su mayor fuente de ingresos, ya que además cuenta con una bodega donde ofrece diversos productos de primera necesidad. Es la primera vez que trabaja con MFP, y se siente contenta con  el trabajo en su banco comunal, “soy consciente que trabajando con el grupo tendremos mayor producción, por que tenemos los mismos intereses”, comenta.
