Con el préstamo ella afianzará las plantaciones de café, con la compra de abonos naturales, además para el pago de mano de obra para la limpieza de sus sembríos de kión.
texts.en: Clementina, 45, is married and has five children.  Three of them are adults and have their own families.  She lives with her husband and cares for three minor children who she educates and cares for.  She owns her house.  She and her husband are farmers, the dominant economic activity in her community and a skill that was passed down from their parents.  They farm coffee, ginger and annatto on their own fields that encompass six parcels approximately.  Everything she grows she sells; this is her main source of income but she also has a store where she sells basic need items.  		This is the first time she’s worked with MFP and she feels happy with her communal bank.  “I’m aware that working with a group we will have higher production because we share the same goals,” she comments.  She will use the loan to tie back the coffee plants, to buy natural manure and also to pay labor costs to weed the ginger plantations.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to hire day workers.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 46 years old and married. 

Nancy has a shop that sells blankets, pillow cases, bed sheets, and bath towels. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy additional blankets, bed sheets, bath towels, and pillow cases.

Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional blankets, bed sheets, carpets, pillow cases, and bath towels.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea is 41 years old, a widow who has been residing in Siem Reap province. She has only one child who is living together with her in a small home. She cultivates rice crops for her livelihood. She has been involved in agriculture for many years. Since she is alone with no one to help to raise her child, she has tried hard to work on her farmland and devote some time to earning more income by taking care of the animals for an animal market, located in the her commune. She typically earns around $4.00 from this business.

Because of the weather, Chea's house is broken and requires repair immediately. With her saved money and the loan of $300 she has requested from HKL, Chea will be able to fix some parts of her house, buy some materials for construction, and pay for labor. She would like to say thanks for the kindly help of Kiva’s funders.

loans.use: to fix some parts of her house, buy some materials for construction, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny is a mother of 4 children aged between 18 and 4. She is 38 and has been an active farmer for the past 6 years in her home area of Kitale in Western Kenya. She has been practicing poultry and dairy farming, supplying milk and eggs to the local market.

Winny has requested a loan of 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. She says she will buy and insure a dairy cow at 31,200 KES and use the other 30,000 KES  to boost her poultry by buying more birds. She is confident the two businesses will provide income to meet her family's basic needs as well as repaying the loan.

She highly appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and buy poultry

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac a 37-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda, with 4 children. He wants a loan to purchase cocoa. He has been trading in his cocoa business for seven years. His personal goals include educating his children. He is faced with some challenges in his business, such as seasonal weather, high transport costs and price fluctuations, and his dream is to trade wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia, aged 39, is married and lives with her family: her husband and five children. Her elder son is involved in a business selling motorbike spare parts and another son works in a factory. Two of her children are enrolled in school and her youngest one is not yet of school age.

Asia's husband is a mason. In order to support him financially, she offers a sewing service. Asia’s days are focused on managing her household work and handling her sewing jobs. She manages both of these very responsibly, giving them the required time. Her family and her customers are very satisfied with her. Asia has applied for this loan for her son, who will purchase spare parts in larger quantities to be able to meet his customers’ orders on time and to generate more revenue. Asia is hopeful that her son's business will be well-established after making this investment.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorbikes

loans.name: Benjamina Gigi

texts.en:
Benjamina Gigi is 48-years-old and married with four children.

Benjamina Gigi works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12500 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, bread and other groceries to sell.

Benjamina Gigi has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Benjamina Gigi aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, bread and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont à l'école primaire.Elle vend des crèmes glacées et des produits agricoles comme le mil, l'arachide et le haricot.Son activité génère des revenus qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et d'appuyer son mari dans les dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Toutefois, les frais de scolarité des enfants sont essentiellement à sa charge. Pour renforcer sa capacité de production, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f auprès de UIMCEC afin d'acheter un réfrigérateur neuf.Son ambition est d'installer une cantine au marché central de s localité.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman, who is mother to three children, two of whom are at primary school. She sells ice-creams and agricultural products such as millett, groundnut and beans. Her business generates sufficient income to look after herself and help out her husband with the family expenses. However, she is essentially responsable for the children's schooling costs. In order to strengthen her production capacity, she is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs from UIMCEC so that she can buy a new fridge. Her ambition is to have a stall in her town's central market.

loans.use: to buy a new refridgerator

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a married woman. She has two children, aged five years and 12 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail store where she sells cosmetics such as weaves, Cutex, and hair oil. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge as being insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more cosmetics such as weaves, braids, and hair oil. Martha's business goal is to expand her retail store by adding more cosmetics within five years.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics such as weaves, hair oil, and braids.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married woman. She has a son who is 5 years old. She describes herself to be determined and ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothes. She will use the 10,000-Kenyan-shilling loan to buy more clothes. Her business goal is to be a clothes supplier to retailers within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Jorge Elías

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Empezó con esta actividad debido a que tiene la idea de que a su edad se debería emprender en un negocio propio.  Trabaja solo desde muy temprano en la mañana la noche.  Es soltero pero tiene hijos que ya son mayores de edad.  Aspira poder mejorar su vivienda a futuro, así como adquirir otra moto para expandir su negocio.  Al momento necesita del dinero para invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para su tricimoto.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the sector of Orquídeas in Guayaquil.  He started this venture because he came up with the idea that he should establish his own business at his age.  He works alone from the early morning hours until nightfall.  The borrower is single and has grown children.  He aspires to improve his home in the future, as well as acquire another motorcycle for expanding his business.  

At the moment, he needs the money from this loan so that he can invest in spare parts for his three-wheeled motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.ru: В селах женщины выглядят взрослее, чем городах. Из-за тяжелой физической работы, из-за финансового положения, из-за отсутствия мужа в семье заставляет женщин стать мужественными и взять все в свои руки. Многие мужчины не находя работы уезжают заграницей на заработки. Ко всему этому они оставляют на своих родителей своим женам на присмотр. Женщинам очень тяжело. Она из таких Гулнисо. Ей 54 года. Гулнисо занимается животноводством. У нее на данный момент 2 скота и она хочет купить еще скотов, чтобы получить больше молока и продать. Так как молоко, которое они получают, хватает только на их семью.

loans.use: Для приобретения скотов

loans.name: Valeh

texts.en:
Valeh has been engaged in this busines for 8 years. 
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $200 and repairs a store. 
For the second time he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought refrigerator.
The third borrowed loan amount of $600 he spent for buying this store.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to expand the area of his store and to buy food-stuffs.
This 47-year- old man lives in Salyan region Khaladj village with his family, married, has 3 children.

loans.use: To expand he area of his store and to buy the food-stuffs

loans.name: Nhatt

texts.en: Nhatt S. is 68 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her 3 children, her husband, and two of her nephews.  Two of her daughters work in a garment factory in the outskirts of the city, and they can each make $70-$80 per month.  Nhatt S. bakes a delicious roast beef snack that is commonly served alongside wine in Cambodia.  With this loan, she will buy the necessary equipment to increase her output and raise her income.  As she earns more profit, she plans to build a store where she can sell her snacks.

loans.use: Buying equipment for cooking business

loans.name: Komedan

texts.fr:
MrA. Komedan, a father of five, was born in 1971 at Mawussi in the Afagnan county. He became a carpenter after high school and has opened a business in the main borough of his village. His work's quality, and the creativity of his furniture models of always testify to his know-how. Therefore, he takes care of his family through the earnings of his craft. On top of his carpentrywork, he would like to open a wood-selling outlet to increase his benefit. This is why he asks for a $1200 loan to buy wood in production areas and resell it to other carpenters in adjoining villages. With this business he would be able to improve his family's living conditions especially for his children's health and schooling

Translated from French by Monique Guichard, Kiva volunteer

Né à Mawussi dans la sous préfecture d’Afagnan en 1971, Monsieur A. Komedan est père d’une famille de cinq enfants. Devenu menuisier après ses études secondaires, il a ouvert son atelier au quartier principal de son village. La finesse de son travail, l’esprit de créativité des modèles de ses meubles portent toujours les marques de son savoir. C’est d’ailleurs du revenu de son métier qu’il arrive à prendre en charge sa famille. En plus de ses travaux de menuiserie, Mr A. voudrait ouvrir un dépôt de vente de bois pour augmenter son revenu. A cet effet, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour s’approvisionner en bois dans les zones de production et le revendre aux autres menuisiers des localités environnantes. A partir de ce commerce, il pourra réussir à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille surtout de ses enfants en matière de santé et de scolarité.

loans.use:
Buying wood in production zones ans reselling it

S'approvisionner en bois dans les zones de production et le revendre

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is a 29-year-old single mother who does sewing work in her home to earn money for her family. She has two children and her husband died two years ago, since which time she has worked to support her family. She is applying to get $1000 to purchase a new sewing machine to do more work and earn more money.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Te

texts.en: Mrs. Te L., age 47, is a widow and works as a farmer earning $1 per day. She has one child who no longer lives at home. She plans to increase her income by starting a clothing sales business. She would like to request this loan of $500 to finance the purchase of clothes from the wholesalers to resell to people in her area for a profit. She plans to save the money to be able to take care of herself in her old age.

loans.use: To start a clothing sales business

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
Don Máximo is 38 years old, lives with his partner Esther and their two sons, 8 and 2 years old. The oldest brother attends elementary school and the youngest stays home with his mother.

Don Máximo is driving a taxi motorcycle in the area of customs at Encarnación taking merchandise and passengers to Posadas-Argentina. It is a difficult job as it must be done daily no matter the cold or hot weather.

The couple owns a house which they built with a lot of sacrifice. Máximo has started a new project, as he has opened a general store which his wife is in charge of and this way generates an extra income. For this purpose they built an extra room and they have the furniture and necessary instruments, all they need is to purchase a larger variety of merchandise.

Don Máximo has saved some money but needs more funds to purchase the necessary merchandise such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, flour, rice, sugar, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Máximo tiene 38 años de edad, vive en pareja con Esther y tienen dos hijos, uno de 8 años y otro de 2 años. El hijo mayor ya va a la escuela primaria, y el más pequeño queda con la madre en la casa.

El señor Máximo se dedica al servicio de taximoto, en la zona de la aduana de Encarnación, llevando mercaderías y pasajeros a Posadas-Argentina. Es un trabajo sacrificado, pues haga frío o calor, debe realizar su labor diariamente.

La pareja tiene casa propia, lograron construir con mucho sacrificio. Máximo ha empezado un nuevo proyecto, abriendo una despensa para que su esposa pueda atenderlo y así generar un ingreso extra. Para ello, han construido un salón extra en la casa donde abrieron el negocio, ya poseen todos los muebles e instrumentos necesarios para ello, solo falta comprar mayor variedad de mercaderías.

Máximo cuenta ya con un dinero ahorrado, pero para poder completar lo necesario para la compra de mercaderías, el solicita el crédito. Entre las mercaderías que comprará podemos citar: productos enlatados, gaseosas, fideos, harina, arroz, azúcar, etc.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, flour, rice, sugar, etc. to increase stock at a general store.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en: My name is Nasim T., and my husband’s name is T. Mehmood. We are residents of Lahore. I have four children, two sons and two daughters. My husband runs snooker hall, where people from nearby areas come to play snooker [a variant of billiards].  My husband is requesting a loan of $250 to invest in his snooker hall. He wants to expand his business to give our children a better future.

loans.use: Expand snooker hall

loans.name: Magsud

texts.en: Magsud is an Internally Displaced Person from the Lachin region located in the southeast part of Azerbaijan. He and his family were relocated to Lokbatan settlement in the suburbs of Baku as a result of Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. He trades fruits and vegetables near the marketplace. He wants to increase the volume of sales, invest more in the business and increase his income. He borrowed three previous loans from Normicro Baku branch. Now he applies again for $1400 to invest in business. $1200 of this amount will be funded by Kiva and the rest will be funded by Normicro.

loans.use: To invest in business

loans.name: Cecilio Modesto

texts.es:
Cecilio C. comes from Villanueva in León, Nicaragua. At a very young age he decided to enter the world of farming but when he realised how low an income it offered, he decided to invest in two television sets in order to start up his own business renting videogames in his area.

It is important to point out that the area in which he lives has no electricity as it is far from any urban area, and this is why Cecilio has decided to invest in the necessities for his home and have a solar panel which he must pay for in order to rent out the videogames.

He is father to one child, who is of school age, and this is why he is so driven to provide for his family and make his business a success. The issue today is that he must urgently pay for the solar panel in order to continue his business, and this is why he has turned to Ceprodel in order to receive a loan which will allow him to pay his debt and continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Cecilio C. es un caballero originario del municipio Villanueva en el departamento de León de Nicaragua. Desde muy pequeño se dedicó al negocio de jornalero pero al ver que sus ingresos eran muy cortos decide invertir en dos televisores para iniciar un negocio propio como lo es el alquiler de videojuegos en su localidad.

Es de mucho interés mencionar que en el local donde el vive, no existe energía eléctrica por estar muy alejado de la zona urbana, es por este motivo que el señor Cecilio C. decide invertir en la necesidades de su hogar y adquiere un panel solar que tiene la obligación de pagarlo por haberlo obtenido al crédito.

Es padre de un hijo en edad escolar y por esta razón es que se esfuerza para suplir todas sus necesidades y salir adelante en su negocio. Su necesidad actual es la urgencia de pago del panel solar para continuar con su negocio y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan salir de esta deuda y suplir su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase a solar panel

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en: Raymond lives and works in Beirut. Raymond is a car mechanic. He owns a car workshop. This is the first time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs $1200 to buy material to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is 62 years old, and this is why many institutions do not want to offer him a line of credit. But Carlos is in good health and has all the desires to continue working. His main source of income is in the transportation sector. Carlos has a vehicle with which he travels through the area between the cities of La Paz and El Alto. Is with this activity that Carlos supports his two children and wife, their home is located in the Zona Exaltación of the City of El Alto. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair the engine of his car and buy new tires. This is Carlos’s second loan with Impro, the evaluation carried out qualifies him to have the loan approved.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos tiene 62 años de edad, por esa razón muchas instituciones no quieren otorgarle un crédito. Pero Carlos esta en perfecto estado de salud y tiene toda las ganas de seguir trabajando, su principal fuente de ingreso es el transporte, tiene un vehículo con el que recorre el tramo entre las ciudades de La Paz y El Alto. Con dicha actividad mantiene a sus dos hijos y esposa, su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Exaltación de la Ciudad de El Alto. El monto del crédito será destinado para comprar un motor nuevo y cambiar los neumáticos del vehículo. Este es el segundo crédito de Carlos en Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo.

loans.use: Maintenance of vehicle

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba is married and has four children: José Guadalupe, age 26, laborer; Jaime Humberto, age 25, teacher; Daniela, age 20, lives in her home; and María Magdalena, age 17, who also lives with her. She began her business because her husband’s salary wasn’t enough to cover the household expenses and children’s school tuition. She needed to make extra money, as they are still paying for their home. She started one year ago, selling food to her neighbors, and after she was successful doing that, she established a cafeteria and sold Mexican snacks.

She is requesting a loan of $350, which she will repay over 6 months, to purchase ingredients to make her food. With your help, she will continue to have a successful business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalba es casada y tiene 4 hijos , Jose Guadalupe de 26 obrero, Jaime Humberto de 25 maestro, Daniela de 20 años vive en su hogar y Maria Magdalena de 17 años tambien. Inició el negocio por necesidad economicas ya que con el sueldo de su marido no podia solventar los gastos de la casa y de estudio de sus hijos. Ella requeria contar con recurso extras ya que ademas se encuentran pagando su casa. Comenzó hace 1 año, vendiendo comidas a sus vecinos, y como le funciono establecio una cafeteria y venta de antojitos mexicanos.

Ahora solicita un prestamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para contar con mas materia prima para elaborar sus alimentos. Con tu ayuda ella seguira con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her food

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng S., 56, and her husband, Mr. Som-oun Nhem, 58, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometres from Phnom Penh, were married in 1962 and have seven children, two sons and five daughters. All of their children were married, two of whom live in the family.

Mrs. Kheng has been selling silk produces for fifteen years. She buys the goods from the local villagers and then resells them in the provinces. Mr. Som-oun has been a primary school teacher since 1983. Mrs. Kheng is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase more silk goods for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk goods for resale.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
For three years, Ofelia has sold catalog cosmetics. At the same time, she sells ceviche every weekend outside the home. Nevertheless, she has been forced to stop selling due to her poor health. Ofelia also sells clothing when she receives orders. Her neighbors and her family members are her customers. The loans that she has requested are to purchase a mototaxi for her son so he may work. Ofelia would like to start a bar or clothing shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Ofelia vende cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 3 años. Asimismo, ella vende cebiche todos los fines de semana afuera de su casa. Sin embargo, ha tenido que dejar de vender porque está delicada de salud. Ofelia también vende ropa por pedidos. Sus vecinos y familiares son sus clientes. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar una mototaxi y dársela a su hijo para que trabaje. A Ofelia le gustaría poner un bar en su casa o una tienda de ropa.

loans.use: To purchase a mototaxi to give to her son so he may work.

loans.name: Hilolbi

texts.ru:
Hilolbi G. lives in the Vahdat district of Tajikistan with her five children. They all live happily together. Her husband left for Russia to find work. She practices animal husbandry; raising cows on her plot of land. She would like to receive a loan so that she can purchase one more cow, which would increase her supply of milk. She would then be able to increase her income from selling the milk. She will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

She herself raises animals. She has land to care for cows Ганиева Хилолби жительница Вахдатского района. Живет со своей семьей. У нее пятеро детей. Все живут дружно. Муж уехал на заработки в Россию.Сама она занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где ухаживет за коровами. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить еще одну корову, так как приобретение еще одной коровы даст возможность получать больше молока . А это поможет получать больше дохода от продаваемого молока. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Soen

texts.en:
Soen S., 32, is a mother of one child and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1998, she and her husband, Met Ol, 45, have been raising pigs to earn a living and are able to make about $2.50 each day in profit.  Soen’s monthly expenses, including utilities, total $80. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more pigs and pig feed. In the future, Soen plans to breed cows.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María inició el negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado el comercio y para tener un ingreso propio además de no depender de sus hijos y estar ella ocupada inicio su negocio desde que su esposo vivía como estaba enfermo ya no podía trabajar. Inicio su negocio hace aproximadamente 6 años vendiendo solamente cocas frituras dulces leche y tortillas hoy en día vende de todo un poco de abarrotes y ya tiene juegos de video para los niños.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y brindar un mejor servicio así como contar con todo tipo de artículos para resurtir abarrotes, refrescos, dulces, y demás mercancía.
texts.en:
Maria started her business because she always liked commerce and she wanted to have her own income, not depend on her children, and to stay busy. She began her business after her husband became ill and could no longer work. The first 6 months she sold only soda, fries, sweets, milk, and tortillas, but now she sells everything--a few general goods and now has arcade games for children.

She needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to buy merchandise and provide better service by providing all kinds of things to resupply her basic goods, refreshments, sweets, and other merchandise.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 33 años, vive junto a su esposo, de esta unión, tienen 4 hijos muy educados y respetuosos. En horas de la mañana prepara los alimentos para toda su familia, después, a eso de la 10.00 am ya está lista para partir a la chacra con el almuerzo de su esposo. Con esta rutina lleva 5 años, para la educación de sus hijos. Su esposo y ella han sembrado hectárea de café y en menor cantidad, frutos cítricos, ellos siembran estos productos porque con ellos no pierden, siempre recuperan lo que invierten. Pero en estos momentos están pasando momentos muy difíciles porque su esposo está enfermo, tiene cáncer en primer grado, Yolanda tiene la esperanza de que se va a recuperar con los tratamientos de quimioterapia. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita Yolanda invertirá para incrementar su producción agrícola y así poder solventar los gastos del tratamiento de su esposo.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 33 years old and lives with her husband; from this marriage, she has four children who are very well-mannered and respectful. In early morning hours, she prepares food for the entire family. Later, at about 10:00 a.m., she is ready to leave the ranch with her husband's lunch. She has performed this routine for five years for the education of their children. She and her husband have planted a hectare of coffee and a lesser amount of citrus fruits. They plant these products because they do not lose and only recover what they invest. But at the moment, they are going through difficult times because her husband is sick with cancer in the early stages. Yolanda’s hope is that he will recover through chemotherapy treatments. This is her first time applying for a loan with MFP. Yolanda asks for the money to increase her agricultural production in order to cover the costs of treating her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her agricultural production

loans.name: Cristina Haydee

texts.es:
La señora Cristina Haydee tiene 47 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Poder y vive en la calle Mariano Melgar 115 del distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta primero de secundaria, pero prefirió trabajar y aprender costura y no continuó estudiando secundaria.  Se casó a los 29 años, tiene un hijo de 7 años y una hija de 18 años, los cuales son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de comida; desayuno, almuerzo y cena, que lo elabora para repartir de casa en casa con previo pedido. Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, invirtió en insumos para la venta de comidas.
Con este crédito de S/ 300 el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en la compra de gaseosa, jugos y arreglará su refrigeradora.
Cristina sueña con tener un restaurant muy grande.
texts.en:
Cristina Haydee is 47 years old and married. She got married when she was 29 years old and has a 7 year old son and an 18 year old daughter who are in school . She is a member of the Banco Comunal Mujeres al Poder, and lives on Mariano Melgar Street, in the district of El Porvenir, in the province of Trujillo, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. She began high school but did not complete it, deciding at the time that she would rather learn to sew and begin work. Today, she runs a business selling meals: breakfasts, lunches and dinners which she prepares for home delivery. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she paid back in 4 installments, Cristina bought ingredients for her meals. With this next loan of 300 soles, which will also be paid back in 4 installments, she will buy soft drinks and juices, and she will fix her refrigerator. Cristina's dream is to have her own restaurant

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for drinks and repairs

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. She has been doing handicrafts for twenty-two years. She does crochet and some woolen projects. Salma requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise. Salma has been a microcredit client for three years now and has always paid on time.

The loan had a good influence on her and her family's lifestyle. Salam is special for her work because her business is rare. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She decided to do this business in order to help support her family.

loans.use: Salma needs the loan to purchase materials

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu A. is 37 years old. She is divorced and the mother of two kids. Currently all her kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she earns her daily source of livelihood.  She has been a food vendor for twenty five years now, and has made an income that has supported her family. She sells Fante kenkey which is one of the favorite foods enjoyed by many Ghanaians, because it supplies carbohydrate components in diets. Fante Kenkey is prepared from milled maize and is made into stew or soup and it can also be mashed for ice kenkey. 

Salamatu buys her supplies directly from farmers. This enables her to avoid middlemen who would buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy a bulk supply of maize to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Salamatu belongs to a village bank called ‘Regina’. She would like to receive a loan of GH¢500 to make her business expand by increasing her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily O. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW member, she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Emily is 30 years old, married, and has three children who are all currently in school. She lives in the Nyalenda area of Kisumu. Emily works in food sales, owning a small shop that sells foodstuffs. She began this business because it is fast moving and she makes quick sales. Educated at a college level (Science Lab and Technology), Emily used to work at a salon. She decided this year to open her own business.

Emily has applied for her first loan from K-MET, for approximately $150 USD. She will use this money to enlarge her business by purchasing new inventory and expanding her range of foodstuffs.

loans.use: Buying more food stuff

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is married with 2 grown-up children. She sells various home products at the local market in Shidnitsa city. Her gross income is 15,000 UAH per month; net profit is 4,000 UAH per month.

Eugenia has been in this business for 14 years. She tries to renew her assortment often and keep low prices for her products. Her previous experience in sales helps her in her own business as well. Eugenia is a happy, honest and hard-working person.

Eugenia would like to receive a loan of 12,000 UAH to increase the inventory. She would spend additional income to help her children and grandchildren to cope with temporary economic difficulties.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: La señora Elisa está casada con su marido Óscar. No tienen hijos que viven con ellos por motivo que todos están casados. Elisa y su marido tiene una zapatería en el mercado de abasto de Ciudad de Hernandarias que lograron montar gracias a que se fueron a trabajar juntos en la Argentina por más de 10 años. Es su primer crédito con la Fundación que retiraron para comprar zapatos escolares, ya que las clases están por iniciarse.  Sus ventas estan bien y le está yendo muy bien en su inversión, ellos esperan trabajar mucho tiempo con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Señora Elisa is married to her husband, Óscar. They don't have children living with them due to the fact that all of them are married. Elisa and her husband have a shoe shop in the wholesale food market of Ciudad de Hernandarias that they were able to start up thanks to their having worked together in Argentina for more than ten years. This is her first loan with Fundación Paraguaya which they have taken out in order to buy school shoes now that classes are beginning. Their sales are good and her investment is going well. They hope to be working with the Foundation for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school shoes

loans.name: Mosurat

texts.en: Mosurat is 45 years old and married with five children. She sells cooked foods such as rice, beans, and fufu. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers, and she sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Tagbaneh Traders Group

texts.en:
This is Theresa R. K., Ya Bom K. and Iyebah T.. They named their group Tagbaneh Traders. They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have accessed several loans from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a lot of developments in the lives of these businesswomen. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 800,000 for each in order to further strengthen their businesses.

Theresa (right) is the leader of the group. She is 52 and was born in Makeni city. She is married with six children, four of whom are already grown-ups while two are in tertiary institutions. Theresa sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), vegetable oil and gara lappers (locally dyed clothes, sometimes with fabricated designs). She has been a businesswoman since her childhood days. With this loan, Theresa will be able to expand her business. She will be able to buy at least 20 barters (five gallons make a barter) of palm-oil and two “pieces” of “brillian” (30 yards make a piece and a brillian is the white cotton used in producing the gara lappers).

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Ermilinda

texts.en:
Ermilinda C. is from the village of Unidos. She is 41 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Ermilinda owns and operates a business providing construction services to local community members. She has just started this business.

Ermilinda joined PMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This will be the second PMPC loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as working capital and purchase additional inventory.
